verses.text: Now it came to pass in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I was in the midst of the captivity by the River Chebar, the heavens were opened and I saw visions of God. On the fifth day of the month, in the fifth year of King Jehoiachin's captivity, the word of the Lord came to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the River Chebar; and the hand of the Lord was upon me.
parts: Now it came to pass in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I was in the midst of the captivity by the River Chebar, the heavens were opened and I saw visions of God.

On the fifth day of the month, in the fifth year of King Jehoiachin's captivity, the word of the Lord came to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the River Chebar; and the hand of the Lord was upon me.

verses.text: I looked, and behold, a sweeping wind came from the north, and a great cloud was in it, with a surrounding brightness and fire flashing forth from it.
parts: I looked, and behold, a sweeping wind came from the north, and a great cloud was in it, with a surrounding brightness and fire flashing forth from it.

verses.text: In the midst, there was as it were the likeness of four living creatures.
parts: In the midst, there was as it were the likeness of four living creatures.

verses.text: Each had four faces, and each had four wings.
parts: Each had four faces, and each had four wings.

verses.text: Their legs were straight, and their feet were winged.
parts: Their legs were straight, and their feet were winged.

verses.text: The hand of a man was underneath their wings on their four sides.
parts: The hand of a man was underneath their wings on their four sides.

verses.text: The faces of those four did not turn as they proceeded, and they went with each face opposite the other.
parts: The faces of those four did not turn as they proceeded, and they went with each face opposite the other.

verses.text: This was the likeness of their faces: the face of a man, the face of a lion on the right side of the foursome, the face of an ox on the left, and the face of an eagle.
parts: This was the likeness of their faces: the face of a man, the face of a lion on the right side of the foursome, the face of an ox on the left, and the face of an eagle.

verses.text: Their wings were spread out above them.
parts: Their wings were spread out above them.

verses.text: Each went straight forward wherever the spirit was going, and did not turn back.
parts: Each went straight forward wherever the spirit was going, and did not turn back.

verses.text: In the midst of the living creatures there was an appearance as of burning coals of fire, as an appearance of lamps turning among the living creatures.
parts: In the midst of the living creatures there was an appearance as of burning coals of fire, as an appearance of lamps turning among the living creatures.

verses.text: I looked and behold, there was one wheel on the earth next to each living creature with its four faces. The appearance of the wheels was like the appearance of beryl, and each of the four had one likeness; and their work was as it were a wheel within a wheel.
parts: I looked and behold, there was one wheel on the earth next to each living creature with its four faces.
The appearance of the wheels was like the appearance of beryl, and each of the four had one likeness; and their work was as it were a wheel within a wheel.

verses.text: The appearance of the wheels was like the appearance of beryl, and each of the four had one likeness; and their work was as it were a wheel within a wheel.
parts: The appearance of the wheels was like the appearance of beryl, and each of the four had one likeness; and their work was as it were a wheel within a wheel.

verses.text: They went on their four sides, and did not turn when they went.
parts: They went on their four sides, and did not turn when they went.

verses.text: Neither did their backs turn, and they were high.
parts: Neither did their backs turn, and they were high.

verses.text: When the living creatures went, the wheels went beside them; and when the living creatures lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up.
parts: When the living creatures went, the wheels went beside them; and when the living creatures lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up.

verses.text: Wherever the cloud happened to be, there was the spirit ready to go.
parts: Wherever the cloud happened to be, there was the spirit ready to go.

verses.text: When the living creatures went, the wheels went; when the living creatures came to a stop, the wheels stopped; and when those were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up with them, for the spirit of life was in the wheels.
parts: When the living creatures went, the wheels went; when the living creatures came to a stop, the wheels stopped; and when those were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up with them, for the spirit of life was in the wheels.

verses.text: The likeness above the heads of the living creatures was like a firmament, like the appearance of crystal, spread out over their wings above.
parts: The likeness above the heads of the living creatures was like a firmament, like the appearance of crystal, spread out over their wings above.

verses.text: Their wings were outspread underneath the firmament, clapping their wings one to the other, two wings joined to each, and two wings covering up their bodies.
parts: Their wings were outspread underneath the firmament, clapping their wings one to the other, two wings joined to each, and two wings covering up their bodies.

verses.text: I heard the sound of their wings when they went, like the sound of much water; and when they stood still, their wings rested.
parts: I heard the sound of their wings when they went, like the sound of much water; and when they stood still, their wings rested.

verses.text: Then behold, a voice came from above the firmament, above their head.
parts: Then behold, a voice came from above the firmament, above their head.

verses.text: There was as it were the appearance of a sapphire stone, and the likeness of a throne upon it.
parts: There was as it were the appearance of a sapphire stone, and the likeness of a throne upon it.

verses.text: Then I saw as it were the outward appearance of amber from the appearance of the waist and upward.
parts: Then I saw as it were the outward appearance of amber from the appearance of the waist and upward.

verses.text: Like the appearance of a rainbow in a cloud on a rainy day, so was the condition of the surrounding brightness.
parts: Like the appearance of a rainbow in a cloud on a rainy day, so was the condition of the surrounding brightness.

headers: Ezekiel's Vision of God and the Four Creatures
Ezekiel Called as a Prophet to Israel

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, stand on your feet, and I will speak to you.” The Spirit then came upon me, took me up, raised me, and set me on my feet; and I heard Him speaking to me.
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, stand on your feet, and I will speak to you.” The Spirit then came upon me, took me up, raised me, and set me on my feet; and I heard Him speaking to me.

verses.text: So He said to me, “Son of man, I am sending you to the house of Israel, to the ones provoking Me.
parts: So He said to me, “Son of man, I am sending you to the house of Israel, to the ones provoking Me.

verses.text: Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord.’
parts: Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord.’

verses.text: Now then, if they listen or are put off—for they are a rebellious house—still they will know you are a prophet in their midst.
parts: Now then, if they listen or are put off—for they are a rebellious house—still they will know you are a prophet in their midst.

verses.text: “But you, Son of man, do not be afraid of them nor be dismayed by their looks, for they will swarm and sting you, and crowd against you on every side.
parts: “But you, Son of man, do not be afraid of them nor be dismayed by their looks, for they will swarm and sting you, and crowd against you on every side.

verses.text: You shall speak My words to them, whether they hear or are put off, because they are a house of provocation.
parts: You shall speak My words to them, whether they hear or are put off, because they are a house of provocation.

verses.text: You, son of man, listen to the One who speaks to you.
parts: You, son of man, listen to the One who speaks to you.

verses.text: Then I looked, and behold, there was a hand reaching out to me, and the roll of a book was in it. He unrolled it before me, and there written on the inside and the outside were words of lamentation and mourning and woe.
parts: Then I looked, and behold, there was a hand reaching out to me, and the roll of a book was in it.
He unrolled it before me, and there written on the inside and the outside were words of lamentation and mourning and woe.

verses.text: He unrolled it before me, and there written on the inside and the outside were words of lamentation and mourning and woe.
parts: He unrolled it before me, and there written on the inside and the outside were words of lamentation and mourning and woe.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, eat this scroll, and go and speak to the children of Israel.” So I opened my mouth, and he fed me the scroll.
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, eat this scroll, and go and speak to the children of Israel.”
So I opened my mouth, and he fed me the scroll.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, your mouth shall eat and your stomach will be filled with this scroll that is given you.” So I ate it, and it was in my mouth as sweet as honey.
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, your mouth shall eat and your stomach will be filled with this scroll that is given you.” So I ate it, and it was in my mouth as sweet as honey.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, go!
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, go!

verses.text: For you are not sent to a people of unfamiliar speech and obscure language, but to the house of Israel.
parts: For you are not sent to a people of unfamiliar speech and obscure language, but to the house of Israel.

verses.text: Neither are you sent to many peoples speaking a foreign language or using strange tongues, nor to a people of heavy speech, whose words you would not understand.
parts: Neither are you sent to many peoples speaking a foreign language or using strange tongues, nor to a people of heavy speech, whose words you would not understand.

verses.text: But the house of Israel shall be unwilling to listen to you, because they are unwilling to listen to Me; for all the house of Israel is argumentative and hard-hearted.
parts: But the house of Israel shall be unwilling to listen to you, because they are unwilling to listen to Me; for all the house of Israel is argumentative and hard-hearted.

verses.text: Behold, I have made your face to be strong against their faces, and I will strengthen your case against their arguments.
parts: Behold, I have made your face to be strong against their faces, and I will strengthen your case against their arguments.

verses.text: Your argument shall be continually stronger than a rock.
parts: Your argument shall be continually stronger than a rock.

verses.text: Again He said to me, “Son of man, receive into your heart all My words I have spoken to you, and listen with your ears.
parts: Again He said to me, “Son of man, receive into your heart all My words I have spoken to you, and listen with your ears.

verses.text: Go!
parts: Go!

verses.text: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me a great thunderous voice: “Blessed is the glory of the Lord from His place.”
parts: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me a great thunderous voice: “Blessed is the glory of the Lord from His place.”

verses.text: I also perceived the sound of the wings of the living creatures as they clapped one to the other, and the sound of the wheels nearby, and the sound of the earth quaking.
parts: I also perceived the sound of the wings of the living creatures as they clapped one to the other, and the sound of the wheels nearby, and the sound of the earth quaking.

verses.text: Then the Spirit moved me and raised me up, and I went forth under the impulse of my spirit; but the hand of the Lord was strong upon me.
parts: Then the Spirit moved me and raised me up, and I went forth under the impulse of my spirit; but the hand of the Lord was strong upon me.

verses.text: Thus lifted up, I then entered among the captivity and circulated among those who were dwelling by the River Chebar.
parts: Thus lifted up, I then entered among the captivity and circulated among those who were dwelling by the River Chebar.

verses.text: Again it came to pass, after seven days, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, I made you a watchman for the house of Israel, and you will hear a word from My mouth and shall threaten them from Me: When I say to the lawless, ‘You shall surely die,’ and you do not give him explicit warning, nor speak to warn the lawless to turn from his ways so he may live, that lawless man shall die in his unrighteousness; but his blood I will require at your hand.
parts: Again it came to pass, after seven days, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, I made you a watchman for the house of Israel, and you will hear a word from My mouth and shall threaten them from Me:

When I say to the lawless, ‘You shall surely die,’ and you do not give him explicit warning, nor speak to warn the lawless to turn from his ways so he may live, that lawless man shall die in his unrighteousness; but his blood I will require at your hand.

verses.text: “Son of man, I made you a watchman for the house of Israel, and you will hear a word from My mouth and shall threaten them from Me:
parts: “Son of man, I made you a watchman for the house of Israel, and you will hear a word from My mouth and shall threaten them from Me:

verses.text: When I say to the lawless, ‘You shall surely die,’ and you do not give him explicit warning, nor speak to warn the lawless to turn from his ways so he may live, that lawless man shall die in his unrighteousness; but his blood I will require at your hand.
parts: When I say to the lawless, ‘You shall surely die,’ and you do not give him explicit warning, nor speak to warn the lawless to turn from his ways so he may live, that lawless man shall die in his unrighteousness; but his blood I will require at your hand.

verses.text: However, if you warn the lawless, and he does not turn from his lawlessness, nor from his way, that lawless man shall die in his unrighteousness; but you delivered your soul.
parts: However, if you warn the lawless, and he does not turn from his lawlessness, nor from his way, that lawless man shall die in his unrighteousness; but you delivered your soul.

verses.text: Again, when a righteous man turns from his righteousness and commits a transgression, and I put him to the test, he shall die, because you did not give him explicit warning.
parts: Again, when a righteous man turns from his righteousness and commits a transgression, and I put him to the test, he shall die, because you did not give him explicit warning.

verses.text: But if you explicitly warn the righteous man not to sin, and he does not sin, the righteous man shall live, because you explicitly warned him; and you will deliver your own soul.”
parts: But if you explicitly warn the righteous man not to sin, and he does not sin, the righteous man shall live, because you explicitly warned him; and you will deliver your own soul.”

verses.text: Again the hand of the Lord came upon me, and He said to me, “Arise and go out into the plain, and there you will be spoken to.” So I arose and went out into the plain, and behold, the glory of the Lord stood there, just like the vision and just like the glory I saw by the River Chebar; and I fell on my face.
parts: Again the hand of the Lord came upon me, and He said to me, “Arise and go out into the plain, and there you will be spoken to.”
So I arose and went out into the plain, and behold, the glory of the Lord stood there, just like the vision and just like the glory I saw by the River Chebar; and I fell on my face.

verses.text: So I arose and went out into the plain, and behold, the glory of the Lord stood there, just like the vision and just like the glory I saw by the River Chebar; and I fell on my face.
parts: So I arose and went out into the plain, and behold, the glory of the Lord stood there, just like the vision and just like the glory I saw by the River Chebar; and I fell on my face.

verses.text: Then the Spirit came upon me and set me on my feet, and said to me, “Go inside and shut yourself within your house.
parts: Then the Spirit came upon me and set me on my feet, and said to me, “Go inside and shut yourself within your house.

verses.text: As for you, son of man, behold, chains are appointed for you, and they will put you in them so you cannot go out from their midst.
parts: As for you, son of man, behold, chains are appointed for you, and they will put you in them so you cannot go out from their midst.

verses.text: I shall bind your tongue, and you will become deaf.
parts: I shall bind your tongue, and you will become deaf.

verses.text: But when I speak with you, I shall open your mouth, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord.’ He who hears, let him hear; and he who disobeys, let him disobey; for it is a house of provocation.
parts: But when I speak with you, I shall open your mouth, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord.’ He who hears, let him hear; and he who disobeys, let him disobey; for it is a house of provocation.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, take a brick for yourself and lay it before you.
parts: “As for you, son of man, take a brick for yourself and lay it before you.

verses.text: On this outline you shall draw a wall, build a rampart round about it, put a barricade against it, place armies around it, and arrange it with engines of war all around.
parts: On this outline you shall draw a wall, build a rampart round about it, put a barricade against it, place armies around it, and arrange it with engines of war all around.

verses.text: Then take for yourself a frying-pan made of iron, and set it as an iron wall between you and the city.
parts: Then take for yourself a frying-pan made of iron, and set it as an iron wall between you and the city.

verses.text: “You shall sleep on your left side and lay the acts of unrighteousness of the house of Israel upon it.
parts: “You shall sleep on your left side and lay the acts of unrighteousness of the house of Israel upon it.

verses.text: For I have laid on you their two acts of unrighteousness according to the number of the days, one hundred and ninety days.
parts: For I have laid on you their two acts of unrighteousness according to the number of the days, one hundred and ninety days.

verses.text: When you accomplish all this, then you shall sleep on your right side; and you shall bear the acts of unrighteousness of the house of Judah for forty days.
parts: When you accomplish all this, then you shall sleep on your right side; and you shall bear the acts of unrighteousness of the house of Judah for forty days.

verses.text: You shall set your face toward the confinement of Jerusalem; and you shall strengthen your arm and prophesy against it.
parts: You shall set your face toward the confinement of Jerusalem; and you shall strengthen your arm and prophesy against it.

verses.text: Behold, I have appointed chains for you, and you may turn from one side to the other until the days of your confinement are accomplished.
parts: Behold, I have appointed chains for you, and you may turn from one side to the other until the days of your confinement are accomplished.

verses.text: “Also take for yourself wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and spelt; put them into one vessel made of earth, and make loaves of bread for yourself.
parts: “Also take for yourself wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and spelt; put them into one vessel made of earth, and make loaves of bread for yourself.

verses.text: Your food which you eat shall be by weight, twenty shekels a day; from time to time you shall eat them.
parts: Your food which you eat shall be by weight, twenty shekels a day; from time to time you shall eat them.

verses.text: You shall also drink water by measure, one-sixth of a hin, and from time to time you shall drink.
parts: You shall also drink water by measure, one-sixth of a hin, and from time to time you shall drink.

verses.text: You shall eat them as a barley cake baked in ashes.
parts: You shall eat them as a barley cake baked in ashes.

verses.text: Then you shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord God of Israel: So shall the children of Israel eat unclean things among the Gentiles.’ ”
parts: Then you shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord God of Israel: So shall the children of Israel eat unclean things among the Gentiles.’ ”

verses.text: So I said, “Not so, O Lord God of Israel.
parts: So I said, “Not so, O Lord God of Israel.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Behold, I give you cow dung instead of human waste, and you shall prepare your loaves of bread upon it.”
parts: Then He said to me, “Behold, I give you cow dung instead of human waste, and you shall prepare your loaves of bread upon it.”

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, behold, I will break the support of bread in Jerusalem, and they shall eat bread by weight and in want and drink water by measure and in a state of ruin,
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, behold, I will break the support of bread in Jerusalem, and they shall eat bread by weight and in want and drink water by measure and in a state of ruin,

verses.text: so as to become in need of bread and water.
parts: so as to become in need of bread and water.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, take for yourself a sword sharper than a barber's razor.
parts: “As for you, son of man, take for yourself a sword sharper than a barber's razor.

verses.text: One-fourth you shall burn in the midst of the city, at the completion of the days of the confinement.
parts: One-fourth you shall burn in the midst of the city, at the completion of the days of the confinement.

verses.text: You shall also take from there a small amount of hair and wrap it in the fold of your garment.
parts: You shall also take from there a small amount of hair and wrap it in the fold of your garment.

verses.text: Then from this amount, again take some and throw it into the midst of the fire and burn it in the fire.
parts: Then from this amount, again take some and throw it into the midst of the fire and burn it in the fire.

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord: “This is Jerusalem; I have put her in the midst of the surrounding countries, in the midst of the nations.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord: “This is Jerusalem; I have put her in the midst of the surrounding countries, in the midst of the nations.

verses.text: So you shall speak of My ordinances to the lawless one among the nations, and my laws to the lawless one from the surrounding countries; because they rejected My ordinances, and have not walked in My laws.”
parts: So you shall speak of My ordinances to the lawless one among the nations, and my laws to the lawless one from the surrounding countries; because they rejected My ordinances, and have not walked in My laws.”

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: “Because your opportunity for lawlessness is taken from the nations around you, and you have not walked in my laws, nor kept My ordinances—indeed you have not even kept the ordinances of the nations around you—”
parts: Therefore thus says the Lord: “Because your opportunity for lawlessness is taken from the nations around you, and you have not walked in my laws, nor kept My ordinances—indeed you have not even kept the ordinances of the nations around you—”

verses.text: therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will execute judgment in your midst in the sight of the nations.
parts: therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will execute judgment in your midst in the sight of the nations.

verses.text: I will do among you what I have not done, and the likes of which I will not do again, because of all your abominations.
parts: I will do among you what I have not done, and the likes of which I will not do again, because of all your abominations.

verses.text: Therefore fathers shall eat their children in your midst, and children shall eat their fathers; and I will execute judgments among you, and all of you who remain, I will scatter to every wind.
parts: Therefore fathers shall eat their children in your midst, and children shall eat their fathers; and I will execute judgments among you, and all of you who remain, I will scatter to every wind.

verses.text: Therefore, as I live,” says the Lord, “surely, because you defiled My holy things with all your abominations, I also will reject you.
parts: Therefore, as I live,” says the Lord, “surely, because you defiled My holy things with all your abominations, I also will reject you.

verses.text: One-fourth of you shall be destroyed by death, and one-fourth shall be consumed in your midst by famine.
parts: One-fourth of you shall be destroyed by death, and one-fourth shall be consumed in your midst by famine.

verses.text: Thus shall My anger and My wrath be accomplished against them.
parts: Thus shall My anger and My wrath be accomplished against them.

verses.text: I will make you desolate, along with your daughters around you, in the sight of everyone who travels through.
parts: I will make you desolate, along with your daughters around you, in the sight of everyone who travels through.

verses.text: You shall be mournful and miserable among the nations around you when I execute judgments among you, in the vengeance of my anger.
parts: You shall be mournful and miserable among the nations around you when I execute judgments among you, in the vengeance of my anger.

verses.text: When I send forth against them My arrows of famine, and they are extinguished, I also shall break your supply of bread.
parts: When I send forth against them My arrows of famine, and they are extinguished, I also shall break your supply of bread.

verses.text: So I will send against you famine and evil beasts and shall punish you.
parts: So I will send against you famine and evil beasts and shall punish you.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, set your face against the mountains of Israel and prophesy against them.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, set your face against the mountains of Israel and prophesy against them.

verses.text: You shall say, ‘You mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord.
parts: You shall say, ‘You mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord.

verses.text: Your altars, along with your sacred precincts, shall be broken down.
parts: Your altars, along with your sacred precincts, shall be broken down.

verses.text: and scatter your bones all around your altars.
parts: and scatter your bones all around your altars.

verses.text: In all your dwelling places, the cities shall be laid waste, and the high places shall be abolished, so as to destroy your altars and break your idols in pieces and remove your sacred precincts.
parts: In all your dwelling places, the cities shall be laid waste, and the high places shall be abolished, so as to destroy your altars and break your idols in pieces and remove your sacred precincts.

verses.text: “The wounded shall fall in your midst, and you shall know that I am the Lord, when some among you are escaping from the sword among the nations and when you are scattered among the countries.
parts: “The wounded shall fall in your midst, and you shall know that I am the Lord, when some among you are escaping from the sword among the nations and when you are scattered among the countries.

verses.text: when some among you are escaping from the sword among the nations and when you are scattered among the countries.
parts: when some among you are escaping from the sword among the nations and when you are scattered among the countries.

verses.text: Then those of you who escape among the nations where they were taken captive will remember Me.
parts: Then those of you who escape among the nations where they were taken captive will remember Me.

verses.text: Then they shall come to know that I, the Lord, have spoken.”
parts: Then they shall come to know that I, the Lord, have spoken.”

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord: “Clap your hands and stamp your feet, and say, ‘Good, well done!
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord: “Clap your hands and stamp your feet, and say, ‘Good, well done!

verses.text: He who is near shall fall by the sword, and he who is far off shall die an untimely death; and he who is in the confinement shall perish by famine.
parts: He who is near shall fall by the sword, and he who is far off shall die an untimely death; and he who is in the confinement shall perish by famine.

verses.text: Then you shall come to know that I am the Lord, when your wounded are among your idols, all around your altars, on every high hill, and under every shady tree where they offered a sweet aroma to their idols.
parts: Then you shall come to know that I am the Lord, when your wounded are among your idols, all around your altars, on every high hill, and under every shady tree where they offered a sweet aroma to their idols.

verses.text: So I will stretch out My hand against them, and appoint the land for destruction and ruin, from the desert of Diblah, in all their dwelling places.
parts: So I will stretch out My hand against them, and appoint the land for destruction and ruin, from the desert of Diblah, in all their dwelling places.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “You, son of man, speak and say, ‘Thus says the Lord to the land of Israel: “An end has come; the end has come upon the four corners of the land.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“You, son of man, speak and say, ‘Thus says the Lord to the land of Israel: “An end has come; the end has come upon the four corners of the land.

verses.text: An end has come upon you who dwell in the land.
parts: An end has come upon you who dwell in the land.

verses.text: The time has come; the day is near, not with tumult nor with travail.
parts: The time has come; the day is near, not with tumult nor with travail.

verses.text: Now it is near.
parts: Now it is near.

verses.text: My eye will not spare, neither will I show mercy; because I will cause your ways to come against you.
parts: My eye will not spare, neither will I show mercy; because I will cause your ways to come against you.

verses.text: Now the end has come to you.
parts: Now the end has come to you.

verses.text: My eye will not spare against you, nor will I have mercy; because I will cause your way to come against you, and your abominations shall be in your midst.
parts: My eye will not spare against you, nor will I have mercy; because I will cause your way to come against you, and your abominations shall be in your midst.

verses.text: ‘For thus says the Lord: “Behold, the end has come.
parts: ‘For thus says the Lord: “Behold, the end has come.

verses.text: “Behold, the end has come.
parts: “Behold, the end has come.

verses.text: The support of the lawless one shall be crushed, and without either tumult or haste.
parts: The support of the lawless one shall be crushed, and without either tumult or haste.

verses.text: The time has come, behold the day.
parts: The time has come, behold the day.

verses.text: For the one who buys shall no longer turn to the one who sells, and a man shall no longer have control over his life.
parts: For the one who buys shall no longer turn to the one who sells, and a man shall no longer have control over his life.

verses.text: Blow with the trumpet and judge all at once.
parts: Blow with the trumpet and judge all at once.

verses.text: There shall be war by the sword from without and death and famine from within.
parts: There shall be war by the sword from without and death and famine from within.

verses.text: Those who are saved and survive will be on the mountains; I will slay all the rest—each one in his wrongdoings.
parts: Those who are saved and survive will be on the mountains; I will slay all the rest—each one in his wrongdoings.

verses.text: All hands shall be feeble, and all legs will be stained with urine.
parts: All hands shall be feeble, and all legs will be stained with urine.

verses.text: They will clothe themselves with sackcloth, and astonishment shall cover them.
parts: They will clothe themselves with sackcloth, and astonishment shall cover them.

verses.text: They will throw their silver into the streets, and their gold will be disregarded.
parts: They will throw their silver into the streets, and their gold will be disregarded.

verses.text: “As for their choice of adornment, they displayed these in arrogance and made their abominable images from them.
parts: “As for their choice of adornment, they displayed these in arrogance and made their abominable images from them.

verses.text: I will hand over these things into the hands of foreigners, to plunder these things; and I will give these things to the troublemakers of the land as booty, and they shall desecrate them.
parts: I will hand over these things into the hands of foreigners, to plunder these things; and I will give these things to the troublemakers of the land as booty, and they shall desecrate them.

verses.text: I will turn My face away from them, and they will defile My place of service.
parts: I will turn My face away from them, and they will defile My place of service.

verses.text: “They will create disorder, because the land is full of peoples, and the city is full of lawlessness.
parts: “They will create disorder, because the land is full of peoples, and the city is full of lawlessness.

verses.text: I will turn back the pride of their strength, and their holy things shall be defiled.
parts: I will turn back the pride of their strength, and their holy things shall be defiled.

verses.text: Though propitiation shall come and one shall seek peace, there shall be none.
parts: Though propitiation shall come and one shall seek peace, there shall be none.

verses.text: “There will be woe upon woe, and message upon message, and a vision will be sought from a prophet; but the law will perish from the priest, and counsel from the elders.
parts: “There will be woe upon woe, and message upon message, and a vision will be sought from a prophet; but the law will perish from the priest, and counsel from the elders.

verses.text: The ruler shall clothe himself with destruction, and the hands of the people of the land will weaken.
parts: The ruler shall clothe himself with destruction, and the hands of the people of the land will weaken.

verses.text: Again it came to pass in the sixth year, in the fifth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I sat in my house with the elders of Judah sitting before me, that the hand of the Lord came upon me. Then I looked, and behold, there was the likeness of a man, as of fire from His waist down, and from His waist up like the appearance of amber.
parts: Again it came to pass in the sixth year, in the fifth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I sat in my house with the elders of Judah sitting before me, that the hand of the Lord came upon me.
Then I looked, and behold, there was the likeness of a man, as of fire from His waist down, and from His waist up like the appearance of amber.

verses.text: He extended what looked like a hand and raised me up by the crown of my head.
parts: He extended what looked like a hand and raised me up by the crown of my head.

verses.text: Behold, the glory of the Lord God of Israel was there, like the vision I saw in the plain.
parts: Behold, the glory of the Lord God of Israel was there, like the vision I saw in the plain.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, lift your eyes toward the north.” So I lifted my eyes toward the north, and behold, I looked from the north toward the eastern gate.
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, lift your eyes toward the north.” So I lifted my eyes toward the north, and behold, I looked from the north toward the eastern gate.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, do you see what they are doing?
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, do you see what they are doing?

verses.text: So He brought me to the porches of the court.
parts: So He brought me to the porches of the court.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, dig a hole.” So I dug, and behold, a door.
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, dig a hole.” So I dug, and behold, a door.

verses.text: He said to me, “Go in, and see the lawless deeds they are doing here.”
parts: He said to me, “Go in, and see the lawless deeds they are doing here.”

verses.text: So I went in, and behold, I saw vain abominations—all the idols of the house of Israel were portrayed on the wall all around.
parts: So I went in, and behold, I saw vain abominations—all the idols of the house of Israel were portrayed on the wall all around.

verses.text: There were seventy men of the elders of the house of Israel, and in their midst stood Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan.
parts: There were seventy men of the elders of the house of Israel, and in their midst stood Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, do you see what the elders of the house of Israel are doing, each one of them in their private bedroom?
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, do you see what the elders of the house of Israel are doing, each one of them in their private bedroom?

verses.text: Then He said to me, “You will see even greater acts of lawlessness they are doing.” So He brought me to the porches of the court of the Lord's house that faces north; and behold, women were sitting there weeping for Tammuz.
parts: Then He said to me, “You will see even greater acts of lawlessness they are doing.” So He brought me to the porches of the court of the Lord's house that faces north; and behold, women were sitting there weeping for Tammuz.

verses.text: So He brought me to the porches of the court of the Lord's house that faces north; and behold, women were sitting there weeping for Tammuz.
parts: So He brought me to the porches of the court of the Lord's house that faces north; and behold, women were sitting there weeping for Tammuz.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Do you see this, son of man?
parts: Then He said to me, “Do you see this, son of man?

verses.text: So He brought me into the inner court of the Lord's house; and behold, there, at the outer entrance of the Lord's temple, between the porch and the altar, were about twenty men.
parts: So He brought me into the inner court of the Lord's house; and behold, there, at the outer entrance of the Lord's temple, between the porch and the altar, were about twenty men.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Do you see this, son of man?
parts: Then He said to me, “Do you see this, son of man?

verses.text: As for Me, I shall treat them in anger.
parts: As for Me, I shall treat them in anger.

verses.text: Then He cried out in my ears with a loud voice, saying, “The punishment of the city is near, and each had instruments of destruction in his hand.” Behold, six men were coming from the way of the high gate that looks toward the north, and each one's ax was in his hand.
parts: Then He cried out in my ears with a loud voice, saying, “The punishment of the city is near, and each had instruments of destruction in his hand.” Behold, six men were coming from the way of the high gate that looks toward the north, and each one's ax was in his hand.

verses.text: Then the glory of the God of Israel went up from the cherubim, and the glory which was over them went into the inner court of the house.
parts: Then the glory of the God of Israel went up from the cherubim, and the glory which was over them went into the inner court of the house.

verses.text: and He said to him, “Go through the midst of Jerusalem and put a mark on the foreheads of the men who sigh and groan over all the lawless deeds taking place within her.”
parts: and He said to him, “Go through the midst of Jerusalem and put a mark on the foreheads of the men who sigh and groan over all the lawless deeds taking place within her.”

verses.text: To the others He said in my hearing, “Go after him through the city and kill.
parts: To the others He said in my hearing, “Go after him through the city and kill.

verses.text: Utterly destroy old men and youth, and virgins, infants, and women, but do not come near anyone on whom is the mark.
parts: Utterly destroy old men and youth, and virgins, infants, and women, but do not come near anyone on whom is the mark.

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Defile the house, and go out and fill the roads with the dead, and smite.”
parts: Then He said to them, “Defile the house, and go out and fill the roads with the dead, and smite.”

verses.text: So it was, as they were smiting, I fell on my face and cried out, and said, “Alas, O Lord, are You wiping out all the remnant of Israel in pouring out Your anger on Jerusalem?” Then He said to me, “The wrongdoing of the house of Israel and Judah has become exceedingly great, for the land is full of many peoples, and the city is full of wrongdoings and uncleanness.
parts: So it was, as they were smiting, I fell on my face and cried out, and said, “Alas, O Lord, are You wiping out all the remnant of Israel in pouring out Your anger on Jerusalem?” Then He said to me, “The wrongdoing of the house of Israel and Judah has become exceedingly great, for the land is full of many peoples, and the city is full of wrongdoings and uncleanness.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “The wrongdoing of the house of Israel and Judah has become exceedingly great, for the land is full of many peoples, and the city is full of wrongdoings and uncleanness.
parts: Then He said to me, “The wrongdoing of the house of Israel and Judah has become exceedingly great, for the land is full of many peoples, and the city is full of wrongdoings and uncleanness.

verses.text: My eye will not spare, nor will I have mercy, but I will recompense their deeds on their own heads.”
parts: My eye will not spare, nor will I have mercy, but I will recompense their deeds on their own heads.”

verses.text: Then behold, the man clothed with the long robe and girded with the belt on his waist reported back and said, “I have done as You commanded me.”
parts: Then behold, the man clothed with the long robe and girded with the belt on his waist reported back and said, “I have done as You commanded me.”

verses.text: Then I looked, and behold, over the firmament above the heads of the cherubim, there was the likeness of a throne over them, like a sapphire stone. He spoke to the man clothed with the long robe, “Go in between the wheels underneath the cherubim, and fill your hands with coals of fire from among the cherubim, and scatter them over the city.” So he went in as I watched.
parts: Then I looked, and behold, over the firmament above the heads of the cherubim, there was the likeness of a throne over them, like a sapphire stone.

He spoke to the man clothed with the long robe, “Go in between the wheels underneath the cherubim, and fill your hands with coals of fire from among the cherubim, and scatter them over the city.” So he went in as I watched.

verses.text: Now the cherubim were standing on the right side of the house as the man was entering, and the cloud filled the inner court.
parts: Now the cherubim were standing on the right side of the house as the man was entering, and the cloud filled the inner court.

verses.text: Then the glory of the Lord went up from the cherubim into the inner court of the house.
parts: Then the glory of the Lord went up from the cherubim into the inner court of the house.

verses.text: The sound of the wings of the cherubim was heard as far as the outer court, like the voice of Almighty God when He speaks.
parts: The sound of the wings of the cherubim was heard as far as the outer court, like the voice of Almighty God when He speaks.

verses.text: Then it came to pass, as He was commanding the man clothed in the sacred robe, saying, “Take fire from between the wheels, from between the cherubim,” that he went in and stood near the wheels.
parts: Then it came to pass, as He was commanding the man clothed in the sacred robe, saying, “Take fire from between the wheels, from between the cherubim,” that he went in and stood near the wheels.

verses.text: A cherub stretched out his hand into the midst of the fire, between the cherubim, and took and put it into the hands of the man clothed with the sacred garment.
parts: A cherub stretched out his hand into the midst of the fire, between the cherubim, and took and put it into the hands of the man clothed with the sacred garment.

verses.text: I saw the cherubim having the likeness of men's hands under their wings.
parts: I saw the cherubim having the likeness of men's hands under their wings.

verses.text: I looked, and behold, four wheels were standing near the cherubim, one wheel by each cherub; and the appearance of the wheels was like that of a precious stone.
parts: I looked, and behold, four wheels were standing near the cherubim, one wheel by each cherub; and the appearance of the wheels was like that of a precious stone.

verses.text: As for their appearance, there was one likeness to the four, as when a wheel is in the midst of a wheel.
parts: As for their appearance, there was one likeness to the four, as when a wheel is in the midst of a wheel.

verses.text: When they went, they went on their four sides.
parts: When they went, they went on their four sides.

verses.text: Their backs and hands, and their wings and wheels, were all full of eyes all around their four wheels.
parts: Their backs and hands, and their wings and wheels, were all full of eyes all around their four wheels.

verses.text: As for the wheels, they were called in my hearing, “wheel.”
parts: As for the wheels, they were called in my hearing, “wheel.”

verses.text: The cherubim were the same living creatures I saw by the River Chebar.
parts: The cherubim were the same living creatures I saw by the River Chebar.

verses.text: When the cherubim went, the wheels close to them went; and when the cherubim lifted their wings to mount up from the earth, the wheels did not turn.
parts: When the cherubim went, the wheels close to them went; and when the cherubim lifted their wings to mount up from the earth, the wheels did not turn.

verses.text: When the cherubim stood, the wheels stood; and when the cherubim mounted up, the wheels mounted up with them, because the spirit of life was in them.
parts: When the cherubim stood, the wheels stood; and when the cherubim mounted up, the wheels mounted up with them, because the spirit of life was in them.

verses.text: Then the glory of the Lord departed from the house and went upon the cherubim. The cherubim lifted their wings and mounted up from the earth in my sight.
parts: Then the glory of the Lord departed from the house and went upon the cherubim.
The cherubim lifted their wings and mounted up from the earth in my sight.

verses.text: The cherubim lifted their wings and mounted up from the earth in my sight.
parts: The cherubim lifted their wings and mounted up from the earth in my sight.

verses.text: This is the living creature I saw under the God of Israel, by the River Chebar, and I knew they were cherubim.
parts: This is the living creature I saw under the God of Israel, by the River Chebar, and I knew they were cherubim.

verses.text: Each had four faces and each had eight wings, and the likeness of a man's hand was under their wings.
parts: Each had four faces and each had eight wings, and the likeness of a man's hand was under their wings.

verses.text: As for the likeness of their faces, these are the same faces I saw under the glory of the God of Israel by the River Chebar; and they went straight forward.
parts: As for the likeness of their faces, these are the same faces I saw under the glory of the God of Israel by the River Chebar; and they went straight forward.

verses.text: Moreover the Spirit took me up and brought me to the front gate of the Lord's house, the gate which looks eastward; and behold, on the porches of the gate were about twenty-five men.
parts: Moreover the Spirit took me up and brought me to the front gate of the Lord's house, the gate which looks eastward; and behold, on the porches of the gate were about twenty-five men.

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Son of man, these are the men who plan worthless things and give evil counsel in this city,
parts: Then the Lord said to me, “Son of man, these are the men who plan worthless things and give evil counsel in this city,

verses.text: who say, ‘Have not the houses been constructed recently?
parts: who say, ‘Have not the houses been constructed recently?

verses.text: Therefore prophesy against them, prophesy, son of man!”
parts: Therefore prophesy against them, prophesy, son of man!”

verses.text: Then the Spirit of the Lord fell upon me and said to me, “Say this, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Thus you have said, O house of Israel; for I know the deliberations of your spirit.
parts: Then the Spirit of the Lord fell upon me and said to me, “Say this, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Thus you have said, O house of Israel; for I know the deliberations of your spirit.

verses.text: You multiplied your dead in this city and filled its streets with the wounded.
parts: You multiplied your dead in this city and filled its streets with the wounded.

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘Your dead, whom you trampled in its midst, they are the meat, and this city is the cauldron; but I shall bring you out of the midst of it.
parts: Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘Your dead, whom you trampled in its midst, they are the meat, and this city is the cauldron; but I shall bring you out of the midst of it.

verses.text: You fear the sword; thus I will bring a sword upon you,’ says the Lord.
parts: You fear the sword; thus I will bring a sword upon you,’ says the Lord.

verses.text: ‘I will bring you out of its midst and deliver you into the hands of foreigners, and execute judgments on you.
parts: ‘I will bring you out of its midst and deliver you into the hands of foreigners, and execute judgments on you.

verses.text: You shall fall by the sword.
parts: You shall fall by the sword.

verses.text: This city shall not be your cauldron, nor shall you be the meat in its midst.
parts: This city shall not be your cauldron, nor shall you be the meat in its midst.

verses.text: You shall know that I am the Lord.’ ” ’ ”
parts: You shall know that I am the Lord.’ ” ’ ”

verses.text: Then it came to pass while I was prophesying that Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died.
parts: Then it came to pass while I was prophesying that Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, your brethren, and the men of your captivity, and all the house of Israel are at their end, to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem said, ‘Keep far away from the Lord.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, your brethren, and the men of your captivity, and all the house of Israel are at their end, to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem said, ‘Keep far away from the Lord.

verses.text: “Son of man, your brethren, and the men of your captivity, and all the house of Israel are at their end, to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem said, ‘Keep far away from the Lord.
parts: “Son of man, your brethren, and the men of your captivity, and all the house of Israel are at their end, to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem said, ‘Keep far away from the Lord.

verses.text: Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “I will reject them among the nations, and scatter them into every land; yet I shall be a little sanctuary for them in the countries wherever they may go.’ ”
parts: Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “I will reject them among the nations, and scatter them into every land; yet I shall be a little sanctuary for them in the countries wherever they may go.’ ”

verses.text: Therefore I said, ‘Thus says the Lord: “I shall also receive them from the nations, and gather them from the countries where I scattered them; and I will give them the land of Israel.’ ”
parts: Therefore I said, ‘Thus says the Lord: “I shall also receive them from the nations, and gather them from the countries where I scattered them; and I will give them the land of Israel.’ ”

verses.text: They shall enter there and remove all its abominations and lawlessness from it.
parts: They shall enter there and remove all its abominations and lawlessness from it.

verses.text: Then I will give them another heart and put a new spirit within them.
parts: Then I will give them another heart and put a new spirit within them.

verses.text: so they may walk in My commandments, keep My ordinances, and do them.
parts: so they may walk in My commandments, keep My ordinances, and do them.

verses.text: But as for the heart set upon their abominations and lawlessness—as their heart went after these things—so I have recompensed their ways on their own heads,” says the Lord.
parts: But as for the heart set upon their abominations and lawlessness—as their heart went after these things—so I have recompensed their ways on their own heads,” says the Lord.

verses.text: Then the cherubim lifted up their wings with the wheels beside them, and the glory of the God of Israel was high above them.
parts: Then the cherubim lifted up their wings with the wheels beside them, and the glory of the God of Israel was high above them.

verses.text: Then the glory of the Lord went up from the midst of the city and stood on the mountain opposite the city.
parts: Then the glory of the Lord went up from the midst of the city and stood on the mountain opposite the city.

verses.text: The Spirit took me up—in a vision by the Spirit of God—and brought me to the land of the Chaldeans, to the captivity.
parts: The Spirit took me up—in a vision by the Spirit of God—and brought me to the land of the Chaldeans, to the captivity.

verses.text: and spoke to the host of captives all the words the Lord made known to me.
parts: and spoke to the host of captives all the words the Lord made known to me.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, you dwell in the midst of wrongdoers who have eyes to see, but do not see, and ears to hear, but do not hear; for they are a house of provocation.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, you dwell in the midst of wrongdoers who have eyes to see, but do not see, and ears to hear, but do not hear; for they are a house of provocation.

verses.text: As for you, son of man, prepare belongings for captivity, for captivity by daylight and in their sight.
parts: As for you, son of man, prepare belongings for captivity, for captivity by daylight and in their sight.

verses.text: You will carry out your belongings as baggage for captivity by day before their eyes; and you shall go out in the evening as a captive goes out.
parts: You will carry out your belongings as baggage for captivity by day before their eyes; and you shall go out in the evening as a captive goes out.

verses.text: Dig through the wall for yourself, and you shall go out through it in their sight.
parts: Dig through the wall for yourself, and you shall go out through it in their sight.

verses.text: You shall be carried on men's shoulders and go forth in secret.
parts: You shall be carried on men's shoulders and go forth in secret.

verses.text: So I did this according to all He commanded me.
parts: So I did this according to all He commanded me.

verses.text: Then in the morning, the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, has not the house of Israel, the house that provokes, said to you, ‘What are you doing?’ Say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord, the Master, the Ruler and the Leader in Jerusalem and over all the house of Israel in their midst.
parts: Then in the morning, the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, has not the house of Israel, the house that provokes, said to you, ‘What are you doing?’ Say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord, the Master, the Ruler and the Leader in Jerusalem and over all the house of Israel in their midst.

verses.text: “Son of man, has not the house of Israel, the house that provokes, said to you, ‘What are you doing?’
parts: “Son of man, has not the house of Israel, the house that provokes, said to you, ‘What are you doing?’

verses.text: Say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord, the Master, the Ruler and the Leader in Jerusalem and over all the house of Israel in their midst.
parts: Say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord, the Master, the Ruler and the Leader in Jerusalem and over all the house of Israel in their midst.

verses.text: Say, “I am performing signs in her midst.
parts: Say, “I am performing signs in her midst.

verses.text: The ruler in their midst will be carried on men's shoulders and will go out secretly through the wall.
parts: The ruler in their midst will be carried on men's shoulders and will go out secretly through the wall.

verses.text: I will spread out My net over him, and he shall be caught in My enclosure.
parts: I will spread out My net over him, and he shall be caught in My enclosure.

verses.text: I will scatter to every wind all his assistants around him, and all his auxiliaries; and I will unsheathe a sword after them.
parts: I will scatter to every wind all his assistants around him, and all his auxiliaries; and I will unsheathe a sword after them.

verses.text: Then they shall know that I am the Lord, when I scatter them among the nations and disperse them in the countries.
parts: Then they shall know that I am the Lord, when I scatter them among the nations and disperse them in the countries.

verses.text: But I will spare a few of their men from the sword, famine, and pestilence so they may declare all their lawlessness among the nations where they go.
parts: But I will spare a few of their men from the sword, famine, and pestilence so they may declare all their lawlessness among the nations where they go.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, you shall eat your bread in sorrow and drink your water with torment and affliction. You shall say to the people of the land, ‘Thus says the Lord to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to the land of Israel: “They shall eat their bread in poverty and drink their water in desolation, that the land may be destroyed with its fullness; for all who dwell in it are ungodly.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, you shall eat your bread in sorrow and drink your water with torment and affliction.

parts: “Son of man, you shall eat your bread in sorrow and drink your water with torment and affliction.
