parts: You shall say to the people of the land, ‘Thus says the Lord to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to the land of Israel: “They shall eat their bread in poverty and drink their water in desolation, that the land may be destroyed with its fullness; for all who dwell in it are ungodly.

verses.text: Their inhabited cities shall be utterly wasted and their land destroyed.
parts: Their inhabited cities shall be utterly wasted and their land destroyed.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, what is your parable about the land of Israel which says, ‘The days are far off; the vision has perished’?
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, what is your parable about the land of Israel which says, ‘The days are far off; the vision has perished’?

verses.text: “Son of man, what is your parable about the land of Israel which says, ‘The days are far off; the vision has perished’?
parts: “Son of man, what is your parable about the land of Israel which says, ‘The days are far off; the vision has perished’?

verses.text: Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “I shall remove this parable, and no longer shall the house of Israel repeat this parable.” For you shall say to them, “The days are at hand, and the word of every vision.
parts: Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “I shall remove this parable, and no longer shall the house of Israel repeat this parable.” For you shall say to them, “The days are at hand, and the word of every vision.

verses.text: For there shall no longer be any false vision or favorable prophesying in the midst of the children of Israel.
parts: For there shall no longer be any false vision or favorable prophesying in the midst of the children of Israel.

verses.text: For I, the Lord, shall speak my words; I will speak and perform them.
parts: For I, the Lord, shall speak my words; I will speak and perform them.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, behold, the house of Israel which provokes is surely saying, ‘The vision this man sees is many days from now, and he prophesies of times far off.’ Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “All My words I speak shall no longer be delayed.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, behold, the house of Israel which provokes is surely saying, ‘The vision this man sees is many days from now, and he prophesies of times far off.’ Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “All My words I speak shall no longer be delayed.

verses.text: “Son of man, behold, the house of Israel which provokes is surely saying, ‘The vision this man sees is many days from now, and he prophesies of times far off.’
parts: “Son of man, behold, the house of Israel which provokes is surely saying, ‘The vision this man sees is many days from now, and he prophesies of times far off.’

verses.text: Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “All My words I speak shall no longer be delayed.
parts: Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “All My words I speak shall no longer be delayed.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel.

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord: “Woe to those who prophesy from their hearts, but who see nothing at all!
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord: “Woe to those who prophesy from their hearts, but who see nothing at all!

verses.text: O Israel, your prophets are like foxes in the deserts.
parts: O Israel, your prophets are like foxes in the deserts.

verses.text: They do not stand in a firm place, and they gather flocks in the house of Israel.
parts: They do not stand in a firm place, and they gather flocks in the house of Israel.

verses.text: They see lies and prophesy vain things.
parts: They see lies and prophesy vain things.

verses.text: Have you not seen a false vision, and spoken worthless prophecies?’ ”
parts: Have you not seen a false vision, and spoken worthless prophecies?’ ”

verses.text: “Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Because your words are lies and your prophecies are worthless, therefore I am against you,” says the Lord.
parts: “Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Because your words are lies and your prophecies are worthless, therefore I am against you,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “I shall stretch out My hand against the prophets who see lies and utter worthless things.
parts: “I shall stretch out My hand against the prophets who see lies and utter worthless things.

verses.text: Because they have deceived My people, saying, ‘Peace, peace,’ and there is no peace; and one builds a wall, and they plaster it—it shall certainly fall.
parts: Because they have deceived My people, saying, ‘Peace, peace,’ and there is no peace; and one builds a wall, and they plaster it—it shall certainly fall.

verses.text: Say to those who plaster it, ‘It will fall,’ for there shall be flooding rain; and I will send hailstones against its joints, and it shall fall; and a wind will rise up and break it down.
parts: Say to those who plaster it, ‘It will fall,’ for there shall be flooding rain; and I will send hailstones against its joints, and it shall fall; and a wind will rise up and break it down.

verses.text: Behold, the wall has fallen, and will not they say to you, ‘Where is the mortar you used to plaster it?’ ”
parts: Behold, the wall has fallen, and will not they say to you, ‘Where is the mortar you used to plaster it?’ ”

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: “I will also bring forth a driving and furious wind, and there shall be a flooding rain in My anger.
parts: Therefore thus says the Lord: “I will also bring forth a driving and furious wind, and there shall be a flooding rain in My anger.

verses.text: So I will break down the wall you plastered, and it shall fall.
parts: So I will break down the wall you plastered, and it shall fall.

verses.text: Thus will I accomplish My anger on the wall and on those who plastered it—it shall fall.” So I said to you, “The wall is no more, nor those who plastered it;
parts: Thus will I accomplish My anger on the wall and on those who plastered it—it shall fall.” So I said to you, “The wall is no more, nor those who plastered it;

verses.text: even so are the prophets of Israel who prophesy over Jerusalem, and who see visions of peace for her when there is no peace,” says the Lord.’
parts: even so are the prophets of Israel who prophesy over Jerusalem, and who see visions of peace for her when there is no peace,” says the Lord.’

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, set your face against the daughters of your people who prophesy from their own heart, and prophesy against them.
parts: “As for you, son of man, set your face against the daughters of your people who prophesy from their own heart, and prophesy against them.

verses.text: You shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Woe to the women who sew pillows under every elbow, and make coverings for every head of every age, to mislead souls!
parts: You shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Woe to the women who sew pillows under every elbow, and make coverings for every head of every age, to mislead souls!

verses.text: They desecrated My people for the sake of a handful of barley and for pieces of bread, so as to kill souls which should not die, and to keep souls alive which should not live, while you prophesy to a people who listen to worthless speeches.”
parts: They desecrated My people for the sake of a handful of barley and for pieces of bread, so as to kill souls which should not die, and to keep souls alive which should not live, while you prophesy to a people who listen to worthless speeches.”

verses.text: ‘Therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against your pillows whereby you conspire against souls.
parts: ‘Therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against your pillows whereby you conspire against souls.

verses.text: I will tear away your coverings and deliver My people out of your hand.
parts: I will tear away your coverings and deliver My people out of your hand.

verses.text: Because you have turned aside the heart of the righteous man unjustly—whom I did not turn aside—so as to strengthen the hands of the lawless man, that he should not completely turn from his evil way and live;
parts: Because you have turned aside the heart of the righteous man unjustly—whom I did not turn aside—so as to strengthen the hands of the lawless man, that he should not completely turn from his evil way and live;

verses.text: therefore, you shall no longer see false visions, nor utter prophecies; for I will deliver My people out of your hand, and you shall know that I am the Lord.” ’ ”
parts: therefore, you shall no longer see false visions, nor utter prophecies; for I will deliver My people out of your hand, and you shall know that I am the Lord.” ’ ”

verses.text: Now some of the elders of Israel came to me and sat before me.
parts: Now some of the elders of Israel came to me and sat before me.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

verses.text: “Son of man, these men devised inventions in their hearts, and placed before their face the stumbling block of their wrongdoings.
parts: “Son of man, these men devised inventions in their hearts, and placed before their face the stumbling block of their wrongdoings.

verses.text: Therefore speak to them, and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Any man of the house of Israel who devises inventions in his heart, and places before his face the stumbling block of his wrongdoing, and then comes to the prophet, I, the Lord, will answer him according to the things in which his mind is entangled,
parts: Therefore speak to them, and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Any man of the house of Israel who devises inventions in his heart, and places before his face the stumbling block of his wrongdoing, and then comes to the prophet, I, the Lord, will answer him according to the things in which his mind is entangled,

verses.text: so as to lead astray the house of Israel according to their hearts, which are completely alienated from Me in their inventions.’ ”
parts: so as to lead astray the house of Israel according to their hearts, which are completely alienated from Me in their inventions.’ ”

verses.text: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Be converted and turn away from your practices and all your ungodliness; then turn your faces back again.
parts: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Be converted and turn away from your practices and all your ungodliness; then turn your faces back again.

verses.text: For any man from the house of Israel, or the resident aliens who sojourn in Israel, who alienates himself from Me, and devises inventions in his heart, and places before his face the stumbling block of his wrongdoing, and comes to the prophet to inquire of him concerning Me, then I, the Lord, will answer him according to the things that entangle his mind.
parts: For any man from the house of Israel, or the resident aliens who sojourn in Israel, who alienates himself from Me, and devises inventions in his heart, and places before his face the stumbling block of his wrongdoing, and comes to the prophet to inquire of him concerning Me, then I, the Lord, will answer him according to the things that entangle his mind.

verses.text: I shall set My face against that man, and make him desolate and ruined, and remove him from the midst of My people.
parts: I shall set My face against that man, and make him desolate and ruined, and remove him from the midst of My people.

verses.text: If the prophet is led astray and speaks, I, the Lord, have led that prophet astray; and I will stretch out My hand against him and destroy him from the midst of My people Israel.
parts: If the prophet is led astray and speaks, I, the Lord, have led that prophet astray; and I will stretch out My hand against him and destroy him from the midst of My people Israel.

verses.text: So they shall bear their wrongdoing—the one who inquired shall bear his wrongdoing according to his wrong, and likewise it shall be for the prophet,
parts: So they shall bear their wrongdoing—the one who inquired shall bear his wrongdoing according to his wrong, and likewise it shall be for the prophet,

verses.text: so the house of Israel may not stray from Me, nor be defiled any longer with all their transgressions, but be My people and I their God,” says the Lord.’ ”
parts: so the house of Israel may not stray from Me, nor be defiled any longer with all their transgressions, but be My people and I their God,” says the Lord.’ ”

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, if a land sins against Me by committing a trespass, I shall stretch out My hand against it.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, if a land sins against Me by committing a trespass, I shall stretch out My hand against it.

verses.text: “Son of man, if a land sins against Me by committing a trespass, I shall stretch out My hand against it.
parts: “Son of man, if a land sins against Me by committing a trespass, I shall stretch out My hand against it.

verses.text: Even though these three men: Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they would deliver only themselves by their righteousness,” says the Lord.
parts: Even though these three men: Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they would deliver only themselves by their righteousness,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “If again I bring wild animals upon the land and punish it, and it becomes desolate because men fear the wild animals, even though these three men were in the land, as I live,” says the Lord, “neither sons nor daughters would be saved.
parts: “If again I bring wild animals upon the land and punish it, and it becomes desolate because men fear the wild animals, even though these three men were in the land, as I live,” says the Lord, “neither sons nor daughters would be saved.

verses.text: even though these three men were in the land, as I live,” says the Lord, “neither sons nor daughters would be saved.
parts: even though these three men were in the land, as I live,” says the Lord, “neither sons nor daughters would be saved.

verses.text: “Or again, if I should bring a sword on that land and say, ‘Let a sword go through the land,’ and I removed man and cattle from it, even though these three men were in it, as I live,” says the Lord, “they would deliver neither sons nor daughters, but only they themselves would be delivered.
parts: “Or again, if I should bring a sword on that land and say, ‘Let a sword go through the land,’ and I removed man and cattle from it, even though these three men were in it, as I live,” says the Lord, “they would deliver neither sons nor daughters, but only they themselves would be delivered.

verses.text: even though these three men were in it, as I live,” says the Lord, “they would deliver neither sons nor daughters, but only they themselves would be delivered.
parts: even though these three men were in it, as I live,” says the Lord, “they would deliver neither sons nor daughters, but only they themselves would be delivered.

verses.text: “Or if I should send death upon the land and pour out My anger upon it in blood, to destroy both man and cattle from it, and Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as I live,” says the Lord, “neither sons nor daughters would be left.
parts: “Or if I should send death upon the land and pour out My anger upon it in blood, to destroy both man and cattle from it, and Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as I live,” says the Lord, “neither sons nor daughters would be left.

verses.text: and Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as I live,” says the Lord, “neither sons nor daughters would be left.
parts: and Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as I live,” says the Lord, “neither sons nor daughters would be left.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “But even if I send upon Jerusalem My four evil punishments—sword, famine, wild animals, and death—to destroy from it both man and cattle, yet behold, the remnant in it, those of it who are saved, who bring out sons and daughters from it, behold, these shall go forth to you.
parts: Thus says the Lord: “But even if I send upon Jerusalem My four evil punishments—sword, famine, wild animals, and death—to destroy from it both man and cattle, yet behold, the remnant in it, those of it who are saved, who bring out sons and daughters from it, behold, these shall go forth to you.

verses.text: yet behold, the remnant in it, those of it who are saved, who bring out sons and daughters from it, behold, these shall go forth to you.
parts: yet behold, the remnant in it, those of it who are saved, who bring out sons and daughters from it, behold, these shall go forth to you.

verses.text: Then they will console you, because you will see their ways and their inventions; and you will know I have not done in vain whatever I did in it,” says the Lord.
parts: Then they will console you, because you will see their ways and their inventions; and you will know I have not done in vain whatever I did in it,” says the Lord.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, of all the wood of the branches in the forest, what would be made from the wood of the vine?
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, of all the wood of the branches in the forest, what would be made from the wood of the vine?

verses.text: Would they take wood from it to make something for profit?
parts: Would they take wood from it to make something for profit?

verses.text: It is only thrown into the fire to be consumed, for the fire consumes what is pruned from it each year; thus nothing is left.
parts: It is only thrown into the fire to be consumed, for the fire consumes what is pruned from it each year; thus nothing is left.

verses.text: Not even while it was whole would it be useful for profit.
parts: Not even while it was whole would it be useful for profit.

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘As the wood of the vine among the trees of the forest, which I give to the fire to be consumed, so I give the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and I shall set My face against them.
parts: “Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘As the wood of the vine among the trees of the forest, which I give to the fire to be consumed, so I give the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and I shall set My face against them.

verses.text: and I shall set My face against them.
parts: and I shall set My face against them.

verses.text: Thus I shall give the land over to ruin, because they utterly transgressed,’ says the Lord.”
parts: Thus I shall give the land over to ruin, because they utterly transgressed,’ says the Lord.”

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, testify emphatically to Jerusalem concerning her lawlessness.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, testify emphatically to Jerusalem concerning her lawlessness.

verses.text: You shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord to Jerusalem: “Your root and birth are from the land of Canaan.
parts: You shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord to Jerusalem: “Your root and birth are from the land of Canaan.

verses.text: As for your birth, on the day you were born they did not bind your breasts, nor were you washed in water.
parts: As for your birth, on the day you were born they did not bind your breasts, nor were you washed in water.

verses.text: Nor did My eye pity you to do any one of these things for you, to suffer anything for you; but you were cast out into the open field because of the perversity of your soul on the day you were born.
parts: Nor did My eye pity you to do any one of these things for you, to suffer anything for you; but you were cast out into the open field because of the perversity of your soul on the day you were born.

verses.text: “As I passed by, I saw you defiled in your blood.
parts: “As I passed by, I saw you defiled in your blood.

verses.text: I made you as a field in full bloom, and you multiplied, became great, and entered into great cities.
parts: I made you as a field in full bloom, and you multiplied, became great, and entered into great cities.

verses.text: As I passed by and saw you, behold, it was your time, a time for lodging people.
parts: As I passed by and saw you, behold, it was your time, a time for lodging people.

verses.text: “Then I washed you in water, washed away your blood, and anointed you with oil.
parts: “Then I washed you in water, washed away your blood, and anointed you with oil.

verses.text: I clothed you in embroidered garments with purple underneath.
parts: I clothed you in embroidered garments with purple underneath.

verses.text: I adorned you with jewelry and put bracelets on your wrists and a necklace around your neck.
parts: I adorned you with jewelry and put bracelets on your wrists and a necklace around your neck.

verses.text: I put a ring in your nose, earrings in your ears, and a crown of boasting on your head.
parts: I put a ring in your nose, earrings in your ears, and a crown of boasting on your head.

verses.text: Thus you were adorned with gold and silver, and your clothing was of fine linen, silk, and embroidered cloth.
parts: Thus you were adorned with gold and silver, and your clothing was of fine linen, silk, and embroidered cloth.

verses.text: Your name went out among the nations for your beauty, because it was perfected with elegance and beauty which I put upon you,” says the Lord.
parts: Your name went out among the nations for your beauty, because it was perfected with elegance and beauty which I put upon you,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “But you put your trust in your beauty, played the prostitute because of your name, and poured out your fornication on everyone passing by.
parts: “But you put your trust in your beauty, played the prostitute because of your name, and poured out your fornication on everyone passing by.

verses.text: You took cloth from your garments, made idols of needlework for yourself, and committed fornication with them.
parts: You took cloth from your garments, made idols of needlework for yourself, and committed fornication with them.

verses.text: You also took the fine jewelry of My gold and silver that I gave you and made male images for yourself, and committed fornication with them.
parts: You also took the fine jewelry of My gold and silver that I gave you and made male images for yourself, and committed fornication with them.

verses.text: You took your embroidered garments and clothed them.
parts: You took your embroidered garments and clothed them.

verses.text: and took My bread which I gave you—the pastry of fine flour, oil, and honey I fed you—and set it before them as a fragrant offering; and so it was,” says the Lord.
parts: and took My bread which I gave you—the pastry of fine flour, oil, and honey I fed you—and set it before them as a fragrant offering; and so it was,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “You also took your sons and daughters whom you bore, and sacrificed these to them to be destroyed, and committed fornication as if that were a small matter.
parts: “You also took your sons and daughters whom you bore, and sacrificed these to them to be destroyed, and committed fornication as if that were a small matter.

verses.text: Besides your fornication, you slaughtered your children and offered them as a sacrifice to ward off evil from yourselves.
parts: Besides your fornication, you slaughtered your children and offered them as a sacrifice to ward off evil from yourselves.

verses.text: Thus you no longer remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and behaved improperly, and lived defiled in your blood.
parts: Thus you no longer remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and behaved improperly, and lived defiled in your blood.

verses.text: “So it came to pass, after all your evils,” says the Lord, “that you also built for yourself a house of fornication, and made a public place for yourself in every street; and at the beginning of every road, you built your brothel and ravaged your beauty.
parts: “So it came to pass, after all your evils,” says the Lord, “that you also built for yourself a house of fornication, and made a public place for yourself in every street; and at the beginning of every road, you built your brothel and ravaged your beauty.

verses.text: “that you also built for yourself a house of fornication, and made a public place for yourself in every street;
parts: “that you also built for yourself a house of fornication, and made a public place for yourself in every street;

verses.text: and at the beginning of every road, you built your brothel and ravaged your beauty.
parts: and at the beginning of every road, you built your brothel and ravaged your beauty.

verses.text: You committed fornication with the children of Egypt, your fleshly neighbor, and committed fornication in many ways, to provoke Me to anger.
parts: You committed fornication with the children of Egypt, your fleshly neighbor, and committed fornication in many ways, to provoke Me to anger.

verses.text: So when I stretch out My hand against you, then I will abolish your customs and will deliver you over to souls who hate you, even to the daughters of foreign lands, who will turn you aside from your way wherein you were ungodly.
parts: So when I stretch out My hand against you, then I will abolish your customs and will deliver you over to souls who hate you, even to the daughters of foreign lands, who will turn you aside from your way wherein you were ungodly.

verses.text: You also committed fornication with the daughters of Assyria, and even then you were not satisfied; indeed you committed fornication with them and were not satisfied.
parts: You also committed fornication with the daughters of Assyria, and even then you were not satisfied; indeed you committed fornication with them and were not satisfied.

verses.text: You multiplied your covenants with the Chaldeans, and not even with these were you satisfied.
parts: You multiplied your covenants with the Chaldeans, and not even with these were you satisfied.

verses.text: Why should I make a covenant with your daughter,” says the Lord, “when you do all these things, the deeds of a prostitute?
parts: Why should I make a covenant with your daughter,” says the Lord, “when you do all these things, the deeds of a prostitute?

verses.text: “With your daughters, you built a house of prostitution at the beginning of every road, set up your high place in every street, and became as a prostitute gathering wages.
parts: “With your daughters, you built a house of prostitution at the beginning of every road, set up your high place in every street, and became as a prostitute gathering wages.

verses.text: An adulterous wife is like you, who prefers a whore's wages to her own husband.
parts: An adulterous wife is like you, who prefers a whore's wages to her own husband.

verses.text: She even gives wages to those who commit fornication with her; and you give wages to all your lovers, and load them with wages, so they should come to you from all around for your prostitution.
parts: She even gives wages to those who commit fornication with her; and you give wages to all your lovers, and load them with wages, so they should come to you from all around for your prostitution.

verses.text: So there happened in you a perverseness in your prostitution beyond that of other women, and they committed fornication with you when you gave them wages; and no wages were received by you; thus perverseness happened in you.
parts: So there happened in you a perverseness in your prostitution beyond that of other women, and they committed fornication with you when you gave them wages; and no wages were received by you; thus perverseness happened in you.

verses.text: “Now then, prostitute, hear the word of the Lord!
parts: “Now then, prostitute, hear the word of the Lord!

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: ‘Because you poured out your money, and your shamefulness was uncovered in your prostitution with your lovers, and because of your many inventions of lawlessness, and the blood of your children you gave to them;
parts: Thus says the Lord: ‘Because you poured out your money, and your shamefulness was uncovered in your prostitution with your lovers, and because of your many inventions of lawlessness, and the blood of your children you gave to them;

verses.text: therefore, behold, I will gather against you all your lovers with whom you consorted, and all those you loved, and all those you hated.
parts: therefore, behold, I will gather against you all your lovers with whom you consorted, and all those you loved, and all those you hated.

verses.text: Thus I will be avenged on you with the vengeance of an adulteress, and bring upon you the blood of fury and jealousy.
parts: Thus I will be avenged on you with the vengeance of an adulteress, and bring upon you the blood of fury and jealousy.

verses.text: I shall deliver you into their hands, and they will demolish your house of prostitution and destroy your high place.
parts: I shall deliver you into their hands, and they will demolish your house of prostitution and destroy your high place.

verses.text: They also shall bring up a multitude against you to stone you with stones, and to strike you down with their swords.
parts: They also shall bring up a multitude against you to stone you with stones, and to strike you down with their swords.

verses.text: They will burn down your houses and execute punishments on you in the sight of many women.
parts: They will burn down your houses and execute punishments on you in the sight of many women.

verses.text: So I shall discharge My anger against you, then My jealousy will depart from you.
parts: So I shall discharge My anger against you, then My jealousy will depart from you.

verses.text: Because you did not remember the day of your youth, but grieved Me with all these things, therefore behold, I recompensed your deeds on your own head,’ says the Lord.
parts: Because you did not remember the day of your youth, but grieved Me with all these things, therefore behold, I recompensed your deeds on your own head,’ says the Lord.

verses.text: “These are all the things they spoke against you in a parable, saying, ‘Like mother, like daughter!’ You are your mother's daughter, rejecting her husband and children; and you are the sister of your sisters, who reject their husbands and children.
parts: “These are all the things they spoke against you in a parable, saying, ‘Like mother, like daughter!’
You are your mother's daughter, rejecting her husband and children; and you are the sister of your sisters, who reject their husbands and children.

verses.text: You are your mother's daughter, rejecting her husband and children; and you are the sister of your sisters, who reject their husbands and children.
parts: You are your mother's daughter, rejecting her husband and children; and you are the sister of your sisters, who reject their husbands and children.

verses.text: Your elder sister who dwells with her daughters to the north of you is Samaria, and your younger sister who dwells to the south of you is Sodom and her daughters.
parts: Your elder sister who dwells with her daughters to the north of you is Samaria, and your younger sister who dwells to the south of you is Sodom and her daughters.

verses.text: You not only walked in their ways and acted according to their lawlessness; but, as if that were too little, you excelled more than they in all your ways.
parts: You not only walked in their ways and acted according to their lawlessness; but, as if that were too little, you excelled more than they in all your ways.

verses.text: “As I live,” says the Lord, “surely your sister Sodom and her daughters have carried on in the manner you and your daughters have done.
parts: “As I live,” says the Lord, “surely your sister Sodom and her daughters have carried on in the manner you and your daughters have done.

verses.text: Surely this was the lawless action of your sister Sodom, namely, arrogance.
parts: Surely this was the lawless action of your sister Sodom, namely, arrogance.

verses.text: So they were haughty and committed acts of lawlessness before Me; therefore, I removed them as I saw fit.
parts: So they were haughty and committed acts of lawlessness before Me; therefore, I removed them as I saw fit.

verses.text: But Samaria did not commit half your sins, for you multiplied your lawlessness beyond them, and declared your sisters righteous by all the lawless deeds you committed.
parts: But Samaria did not commit half your sins, for you multiplied your lawlessness beyond them, and declared your sisters righteous by all the lawless deeds you committed.

verses.text: Therefore, bear your punishment, for you corrupted your sisters by your sins, sins more lawless than their own.
parts: Therefore, bear your punishment, for you corrupted your sisters by your sins, sins more lawless than their own.

verses.text: “I will turn away from their faithlessness, the faithlessness of Sodom and her daughters, and I will turn away from the faithlessness of Samaria and her daughters.
parts: “I will turn away from their faithlessness, the faithlessness of Sodom and her daughters, and I will turn away from the faithlessness of Samaria and her daughters.

verses.text: so you may bear your punishment and be dishonored by all you did to provoke My anger.
parts: so you may bear your punishment and be dishonored by all you did to provoke My anger.

verses.text: But your sister Sodom and her daughters shall be restored as they were from the beginning, and Samaria and her daughters shall be restored as they were from the beginning.
parts: But your sister Sodom and her daughters shall be restored as they were from the beginning, and Samaria and her daughters shall be restored as they were from the beginning.

verses.text: Surely your sister Sodom was not mentioned by your mouth in the days of your arrogance, before your evils were uncovered.
parts: Surely your sister Sodom was not mentioned by your mouth in the days of your arrogance, before your evils were uncovered.

verses.text: Even now you are a disgrace to the daughters of Syria and all those around her, and to the daughters of the foreigners around you on every side.
parts: Even now you are a disgrace to the daughters of Syria and all those around her, and to the daughters of the foreigners around you on every side.

verses.text: By your deeds of ungodliness and lawlessness, you received these things,” says the Lord.
parts: By your deeds of ungodliness and lawlessness, you received these things,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord: ‘I will deal with you as you have done, as you dishonored these things so as to break my covenant. Nevertheless I shall remember My covenant with you in the days of your youth, and raise up an everlasting covenant for you.
parts: “For thus says the Lord: ‘I will deal with you as you have done, as you dishonored these things so as to break my covenant.
Nevertheless I shall remember My covenant with you in the days of your youth, and raise up an everlasting covenant for you.

verses.text: Nevertheless I shall remember My covenant with you in the days of your youth, and raise up an everlasting covenant for you.
parts: Nevertheless I shall remember My covenant with you in the days of your youth, and raise up an everlasting covenant for you.

verses.text: Then you will remember your way and be utterly dishonored when you receive your older and younger sisters.
parts: Then you will remember your way and be utterly dishonored when you receive your older and younger sisters.

verses.text: But I shall raise up My covenant with you.
parts: But I shall raise up My covenant with you.

verses.text: that you may remember and be ashamed, and may never open your mouth again because of your dishonor, when I am reconciled to you for all you did,’ says the Lord.”
parts: that you may remember and be ashamed, and may never open your mouth again because of your dishonor, when I am reconciled to you for all you did,’ says the Lord.”

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, pose a riddle, and speak a parable to the house of Israel.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, pose a riddle, and speak a parable to the house of Israel.

verses.text: You shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “A great eagle—with large wings, spreading them out very far, and full of talons, and with the design to enter Lebanon—took the choice branches of the cedar.
parts: You shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “A great eagle—with large wings, spreading them out very far, and full of talons, and with the design to enter Lebanon—took the choice branches of the cedar.

verses.text: He nipped off its topmost tender twig, carried it to the land of Canaan, and set it in the fortified city.
parts: He nipped off its topmost tender twig, carried it to the land of Canaan, and set it in the fortified city.

verses.text: Then he took some of the seed of the land, planted it in a fertile field by much water, and set it in a conspicuous place.
parts: Then he took some of the seed of the land, planted it in a fertile field by much water, and set it in a conspicuous place.

verses.text: So it grew and became a weak vine, small in size as to its appearance.
parts: So it grew and became a weak vine, small in size as to its appearance.

verses.text: “But there was another great eagle with large wings and many talons; and behold, this vine and her roots turned itself toward him, and stretched its branches toward him, that he might water it together with the soil where it was planted.
parts: “But there was another great eagle with large wings and many talons; and behold, this vine and her roots turned itself toward him, and stretched its branches toward him, that he might water it together with the soil where it was planted.

verses.text: She thrives in a good field by much water, so as to produce shoots and bear fruit, that she may be a large vine.’ ”
parts: She thrives in a good field by much water, so as to produce shoots and bear fruit, that she may be a large vine.’ ”

verses.text: “Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Will it prosper?
parts: “Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Will it prosper?

verses.text: Behold, it thrives, but will it prosper?
parts: Behold, it thrives, but will it prosper?

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, say now to the house that provokes, ‘Do you not understand what these things mean?’ Tell them, ‘When the king of Babylon comes to Jerusalem, he will take its king and rulers, and take them with himself to Babylon.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, say now to the house that provokes, ‘Do you not understand what these things mean?’ Tell them, ‘When the king of Babylon comes to Jerusalem, he will take its king and rulers, and take them with himself to Babylon.

verses.text: “Son of man, say now to the house that provokes, ‘Do you not understand what these things mean?’ Tell them, ‘When the king of Babylon comes to Jerusalem, he will take its king and rulers, and take them with himself to Babylon.
parts: “Son of man, say now to the house that provokes, ‘Do you not understand what these things mean?’ Tell them, ‘When the king of Babylon comes to Jerusalem, he will take its king and rulers, and take them with himself to Babylon.

verses.text: He will also take one from the royal seed, and make a covenant with him, and place him under oath.
parts: He will also take one from the royal seed, and make a covenant with him, and place him under oath.

verses.text: Then he will take away the leaders of the land that it may become a weak kingdom, so as never to lift itself up, that he may preserve his covenant and establish it.
parts: Then he will take away the leaders of the land that it may become a weak kingdom, so as never to lift itself up, that he may preserve his covenant and establish it.

verses.text: But this one shall revolt from him and send his messengers to Egypt, so they might give him horses and many people.
parts: But this one shall revolt from him and send his messengers to Egypt, so they might give him horses and many people.

verses.text: As I live,’ says the Lord, ‘he shall certainly die in the midst of Babylon, in the place where the king dwells who made him king, who dishonored My oath and broke My covenant.
parts: As I live,’ says the Lord, ‘he shall certainly die in the midst of Babylon, in the place where the king dwells who made him king, who dishonored My oath and broke My covenant.

verses.text: But with a small army and few people, Pharaoh shall wage war against him by throwing up a mound and building engines of war, so as to carry away souls.
parts: But with a small army and few people, Pharaoh shall wage war against him by throwing up a mound and building engines of war, so as to carry away souls.

verses.text: So he will not escape when he does all these things to him, because he dishonored the oath by breaking the covenant, although he gave his hand in trust.’
parts: So he will not escape when he does all these things to him, because he dishonored the oath by breaking the covenant, although he gave his hand in trust.’

verses.text: Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “As I live, surely My covenant which he broke and My oath which he dishonored—I will recompense these things on his head.
parts: Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “As I live, surely My covenant which he broke and My oath which he dishonored—I will recompense these things on his head.

verses.text: I will spread My net over him, and he shall be caught in its enclosure.
parts: I will spread My net over him, and he shall be caught in its enclosure.

verses.text: His whole line of battle will fall by the sword, and those who remain I will scatter to every wind.
parts: His whole line of battle will fall by the sword, and those who remain I will scatter to every wind.

verses.text: “Therefore, thus says the Lord: ‘I shall take the choice branches of the cedar from its top and nip off their heart, and plant it on a high mountain. I shall hang it on a lofty mountain of Israel, yes, I will plant it; and it will bring forth shoots, produce fruit, and be a great cedar.
parts: “Therefore, thus says the Lord: ‘I shall take the choice branches of the cedar from its top and nip off their heart, and plant it on a high mountain.
I shall hang it on a lofty mountain of Israel, yes, I will plant it; and it will bring forth shoots, produce fruit, and be a great cedar.

verses.text: I shall hang it on a lofty mountain of Israel, yes, I will plant it; and it will bring forth shoots, produce fruit, and be a great cedar.
parts: I shall hang it on a lofty mountain of Israel, yes, I will plant it; and it will bring forth shoots, produce fruit, and be a great cedar.

verses.text: So all the trees of the field will know that I, the Lord, am He who humbles the high tree and exalts the humble tree, who dries up the green tree and makes the dry tree flourish.
parts: So all the trees of the field will know that I, the Lord, am He who humbles the high tree and exalts the humble tree, who dries up the green tree and makes the dry tree flourish.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, what is the meaning of this parable among the children of Israel which says, ‘The fathers eat unripe grapes, and the children's teeth grind’?
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, what is the meaning of this parable among the children of Israel which says, ‘The fathers eat unripe grapes, and the children's teeth grind’?

verses.text: As I live,” says the Lord, “you shall no longer use this parable in Israel.
parts: As I live,” says the Lord, “you shall no longer use this parable in Israel.

verses.text: For all souls are Mine; the soul of the father as well as the soul of the son is Mine.
parts: For all souls are Mine; the soul of the father as well as the soul of the son is Mine.

verses.text: But the man who is righteous and does judgment and righteousness,
parts: But the man who is righteous and does judgment and righteousness,

verses.text: who will not eat on the mountains, or lift up his eyes to the inventions of the house of Israel, or defile his neighbor's wife, and who will not approach a woman during her menstruation,
parts: who will not eat on the mountains, or lift up his eyes to the inventions of the house of Israel, or defile his neighbor's wife, and who will not approach a woman during her menstruation,

verses.text: or oppress any man, but who will restore to the debtor his pledge, and commit no robbery, but who will give his bread to the hungry and cover the naked,
parts: or oppress any man, but who will restore to the debtor his pledge, and commit no robbery, but who will give his bread to the hungry and cover the naked,

verses.text: and who will not lend his money with interest, but will turn his hand from wrongdoing, and do righteous judgment between a man and his neighbor,
parts: and who will not lend his money with interest, but will turn his hand from wrongdoing, and do righteous judgment between a man and his neighbor,

verses.text: and walk in My ordinances, and keep My requirements to do them—this man is righteous.
parts: and walk in My ordinances, and keep My requirements to do them—this man is righteous.

verses.text: “But if he begets a troublesome son, who sheds blood, commits sins, does not walk in the way of his righteous father, but eats on the mountains, defiles his neighbor's wife, oppresses the poor and needy, commits robbery, does not restore a pledge, sets his eyes on the idols, commits lawlessness, exacts interest, and takes unjust gains—this son shall not live, because he did all this lawlessness.
parts: “But if he begets a troublesome son, who sheds blood, commits sins, does not walk in the way of his righteous father, but eats on the mountains, defiles his neighbor's wife, oppresses the poor and needy, commits robbery, does not restore a pledge, sets his eyes on the idols, commits lawlessness, exacts interest, and takes unjust gains—this son shall not live, because he did all this lawlessness.

verses.text: does not walk in the way of his righteous father, but eats on the mountains, defiles his neighbor's wife,
parts: does not walk in the way of his righteous father, but eats on the mountains, defiles his neighbor's wife,

verses.text: oppresses the poor and needy, commits robbery, does not restore a pledge, sets his eyes on the idols, commits lawlessness,
parts: oppresses the poor and needy, commits robbery, does not restore a pledge, sets his eyes on the idols, commits lawlessness,

verses.text: exacts interest, and takes unjust gains—this son shall not live, because he did all this lawlessness.
parts: exacts interest, and takes unjust gains—this son shall not live, because he did all this lawlessness.

verses.text: “If, however, he begets a son who sees all the sins his father commits, but fears and does not do according to these things— does not eat on the mountains, nor sets his eyes on the inventions of the house of Israel, nor defiles his neighbor's wife, nor oppresses anyone, nor withholds a pledge, nor commits robbery, but gives his bread to the hungry, covers the naked, and turns his hand from wrongdoing, nor receives interest, nor takes unjust gains, but does righteousness and walks in My ordinances—this son shall not die for the wrongdoings of his father.
parts: “If, however, he begets a son who sees all the sins his father commits, but fears and does not do according to these things— does not eat on the mountains, nor sets his eyes on the inventions of the house of Israel, nor defiles his neighbor's wife, nor oppresses anyone, nor withholds a pledge, nor commits robbery, but gives his bread to the hungry, covers the naked, and turns his hand from wrongdoing, nor receives interest, nor takes unjust gains, but does righteousness and walks in My ordinances—this son shall not die for the wrongdoings of his father.

verses.text: does not eat on the mountains, nor sets his eyes on the inventions of the house of Israel, nor defiles his neighbor's wife,
parts: does not eat on the mountains, nor sets his eyes on the inventions of the house of Israel, nor defiles his neighbor's wife,

verses.text: nor oppresses anyone, nor withholds a pledge, nor commits robbery, but gives his bread to the hungry, covers the naked,
parts: nor oppresses anyone, nor withholds a pledge, nor commits robbery, but gives his bread to the hungry, covers the naked,

verses.text: and turns his hand from wrongdoing, nor receives interest, nor takes unjust gains, but does righteousness and walks in My ordinances—this son shall not die for the wrongdoings of his father.
parts: and turns his hand from wrongdoing, nor receives interest, nor takes unjust gains, but does righteousness and walks in My ordinances—this son shall not die for the wrongdoings of his father.

verses.text: As for his father, if he cruelly oppresses and robs his brother, and does these contrary things in the midst of My people, he shall die in his wrongdoing.
parts: As for his father, if he cruelly oppresses and robs his brother, and does these contrary things in the midst of My people, he shall die in his wrongdoing.

verses.text: “Yet you say, ‘Why does a son not bear the wrongdoing of his father?’ Because the son practiced righteousness, showed mercy, kept all My commandments and did them.
parts: “Yet you say, ‘Why does a son not bear the wrongdoing of his father?’ Because the son practiced righteousness, showed mercy, kept all My commandments and did them.

verses.text: But the soul who sins shall die.
parts: But the soul who sins shall die.

verses.text: But if a lawless man turns from all the lawless deeds he commits, keeps all My commandments, does righteousness and shows mercy, he will surely live and not die.
parts: But if a lawless man turns from all the lawless deeds he commits, keeps all My commandments, does righteousness and shows mercy, he will surely live and not die.

verses.text: None of the transgressions he commits will be remembered.
parts: None of the transgressions he commits will be remembered.

verses.text: Do I ever will the death of a lawless man,” says the Lord, “since My will is for him to turn from the evil way and live?
parts: Do I ever will the death of a lawless man,” says the Lord, “since My will is for him to turn from the evil way and live?

verses.text: But when a righteous man turns away from his righteousness and commits a wrongdoing, according to all the lawlessness a lawless man commits, then all the righteousness he does shall not be remembered.
parts: But when a righteous man turns away from his righteousness and commits a wrongdoing, according to all the lawlessness a lawless man commits, then all the righteousness he does shall not be remembered.

verses.text: “Yet you say, ‘The Lord's way is not straight.’ Hear now, all the house of Israel, is My way not straight?
parts: “Yet you say, ‘The Lord's way is not straight.’ Hear now, all the house of Israel, is My way not straight?

verses.text: When the righteous man turns away from his righteousness, commits a transgression, and dies in the transgression he commits, he should die because of it.
parts: When the righteous man turns away from his righteousness, commits a transgression, and dies in the transgression he commits, he should die because of it.

verses.text: Again when a lawless man turns away from the lawlessness he commits and does judgment and righteousness, then he guards his life;
parts: Again when a lawless man turns away from the lawlessness he commits and does judgment and righteousness, then he guards his life;

verses.text: for he turned himself away from all the ungodliness he committed.
parts: for he turned himself away from all the ungodliness he committed.

verses.text: Yet the house of Israel says, ‘The Lord's way is not right.’ Is not My way right, O house of Israel?
parts: Yet the house of Israel says, ‘The Lord's way is not right.’ Is not My way right, O house of Israel?

verses.text: I shall judge you, O house of Israel, each one according to his way,” says the Lord.
parts: I shall judge you, O house of Israel, each one according to his way,” says the Lord.

verses.text: Cast away from yourself all your ungodliness you commit against Me, and make a new heart and a new spirit for yourselves.
parts: Cast away from yourself all your ungodliness you commit against Me, and make a new heart and a new spirit for yourselves.

verses.text: For I do not will the death of the one who dies,” says the Lord.
parts: For I do not will the death of the one who dies,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, take up a lamentation for the prince of Israel. You shall say, ‘Why did your mother became a young lion in the midst of lions?
parts: “As for you, son of man, take up a lamentation for the prince of Israel.
You shall say, ‘Why did your mother became a young lion in the midst of lions?

verses.text: Then one of her young lions leaped off.
parts: Then one of her young lions leaped off.

verses.text: The nations also heard of him.
parts: The nations also heard of him.

verses.text: So she saw he was driven away from her, and her assurance perished.
parts: So she saw he was driven away from her, and her assurance perished.

verses.text: He lived among the lions and became a lion.
parts: He lived among the lions and became a lion.

verses.text: He prowled in his boldness, laid waste their cities, and destroyed the land with its fullness by the noise of his roaring.
parts: He prowled in his boldness, laid waste their cities, and destroyed the land with its fullness by the noise of his roaring.

verses.text: Then the nations came against him from the countries all around, and spread their nets over him.
parts: Then the nations came against him from the countries all around, and spread their nets over him.

verses.text: They put him in a muzzle, and he came to the king of Babylon in a cage for wild animals.
parts: They put him in a muzzle, and he came to the king of Babylon in a cage for wild animals.

verses.text: ‘Your mother was like a vine, like a blossom on a pomegranate tree, planted in water.
parts: ‘Your mother was like a vine, like a blossom on a pomegranate tree, planted in water.

verses.text: She became a rod of strength for a tribe of leaders.
parts: She became a rod of strength for a tribe of leaders.

verses.text: But she was broken to pieces in anger, for she was thrown down on the ground, and the wind and burning heat dried her chosen branches.
parts: But she was broken to pieces in anger, for she was thrown down on the ground, and the wind and burning heat dried her chosen branches.

verses.text: So now they have planted her in the desert, in a waterless land.
parts: So now they have planted her in the desert, in a waterless land.

verses.text: Fire went out from the rod of her chosen branches and devoured her.
parts: Fire went out from the rod of her chosen branches and devoured her.

headers: The Will of the Lord, and Man's Rebellion

verses.text: Again it came to pass in the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, that men from the elders of the house of Israel came to inquire of the Lord, and they sat before me. Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Have you come to inquire of Me?
parts: Again it came to pass in the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, that men from the elders of the house of Israel came to inquire of the Lord, and they sat before me.
Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Have you come to inquire of Me?

verses.text: Shall I utterly take vengeance on them, son of man?
parts: Shall I utterly take vengeance on them, son of man?

verses.text: “You shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “From the day I chose Israel and made Myself known to the seed of the house of Jacob, and to those in the land of Egypt, and helped them with My hand, saying, ‘I am the Lord your God’— in that day I helped them with My hand to lead them from the land of Egypt into the land I prepared for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, a land more abundant than all other lands.
parts: “You shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “From the day I chose Israel and made Myself known to the seed of the house of Jacob, and to those in the land of Egypt, and helped them with My hand, saying, ‘I am the Lord your God’— in that day I helped them with My hand to lead them from the land of Egypt into the land I prepared for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, a land more abundant than all other lands.

verses.text: in that day I helped them with My hand to lead them from the land of Egypt into the land I prepared for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, a land more abundant than all other lands.
parts: in that day I helped them with My hand to lead them from the land of Egypt into the land I prepared for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, a land more abundant than all other lands.

verses.text: I said to them, ‘Let each of you cast away the abominations before his eyes, and not defile yourselves with the practices of Egypt.
parts: I said to them, ‘Let each of you cast away the abominations before his eyes, and not defile yourselves with the practices of Egypt.

verses.text: But they fell away from Me and were unwilling to obey Me.
parts: But they fell away from Me and were unwilling to obey Me.

verses.text: So I acted that My name would not at all be desecrated in the sight of the nations in the midst of whom they were, and among whom I made Myself known in their sight, to lead them out of Egypt.
parts: So I acted that My name would not at all be desecrated in the sight of the nations in the midst of whom they were, and among whom I made Myself known in their sight, to lead them out of Egypt.

verses.text: “I brought them out of Egypt and led them into the desert.
parts: “I brought them out of Egypt and led them into the desert.

verses.text: I gave them My ordinances and made known My requirements to them, which if a man will do them, he shall live by them.
parts: I gave them My ordinances and made known My requirements to them, which if a man will do them, he shall live by them.

verses.text: I also gave them My Sabbaths as a sign between Me and them, so they might know that I am the Lord who sanctifies them.
parts: I also gave them My Sabbaths as a sign between Me and them, so they might know that I am the Lord who sanctifies them.

verses.text: I said to the house of Israel in the desert, ‘You shall walk in my ordinances.’ But they did not walk in them, and they rejected my requirements, which if a man will do them, he shall live by them; and they desecrated my Sabbaths exceedingly.
parts: I said to the house of Israel in the desert, ‘You shall walk in my ordinances.’ But they did not walk in them, and they rejected my requirements, which if a man will do them, he shall live by them; and they desecrated my Sabbaths exceedingly.

verses.text: So I acted that My name might not be at all desecrated before the nations before whose eyes I brought them out.
parts: So I acted that My name might not be at all desecrated before the nations before whose eyes I brought them out.

verses.text: I swore an oath against them in the desert that I would no longer bring them into the land I gave them, a land flowing with milk and honey, a land sweeter than all other lands,
parts: I swore an oath against them in the desert that I would no longer bring them into the land I gave them, a land flowing with milk and honey, a land sweeter than all other lands,

verses.text: because they rejected My requirements and did not walk in My ordinances; instead, they desecrated My Sabbaths and walked after the inventions of their hearts.
parts: because they rejected My requirements and did not walk in My ordinances; instead, they desecrated My Sabbaths and walked after the inventions of their hearts.

verses.text: Nevertheless My eye spared them from utter destruction, and I did not make an end to them in the wilderness.
parts: Nevertheless My eye spared them from utter destruction, and I did not make an end to them in the wilderness.

verses.text: “But I said to their children in the desert, ‘Do not walk in the customs of your fathers, nor observe their requirements, nor have fellowship with their practices, nor defile yourself with them.
parts: “But I said to their children in the desert, ‘Do not walk in the customs of your fathers, nor observe their requirements, nor have fellowship with their practices, nor defile yourself with them.

verses.text: I am the Lord your God.
parts: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: Sanctify My Sabbaths, and let them be a sign between Me and you, that you may know that I am the Lord your God.’
parts: Sanctify My Sabbaths, and let them be a sign between Me and you, that you may know that I am the Lord your God.’

verses.text: But they rebelled against me, along with their children.
parts: But they rebelled against me, along with their children.

verses.text: But I did this so My name would not be desecrated in the sight of the nations before whose eyes I brought them out.
parts: But I did this so My name would not be desecrated in the sight of the nations before whose eyes I brought them out.

verses.text: Thus I swore an oath against them in the desert, that I might scatter them among the nations and disperse them in the countries,
parts: Thus I swore an oath against them in the desert, that I might scatter them among the nations and disperse them in the countries,

verses.text: because they did not keep My requirements and rejected My ordinances.
parts: because they did not keep My requirements and rejected My ordinances.

verses.text: Therefore I gave them ordinances that were not good, and requirements in which they should not live.
parts: Therefore I gave them ordinances that were not good, and requirements in which they should not live.

verses.text: I will defile them by their gifts, when I pass through upon everyone that opens the womb, that I may destroy them.’ ”
parts: I will defile them by their gifts, when I pass through upon everyone that opens the womb, that I may destroy them.’ ”

verses.text: “Therefore speak to the house of Israel, son of man, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Up to this point, your fathers provoked Me by the transgressions they committed against Me.
parts: “Therefore speak to the house of Israel, son of man, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Up to this point, your fathers provoked Me by the transgressions they committed against Me.

verses.text: But I led them into the land I swore with an oath to give them, and they saw every high hill and every shade tree.
parts: But I led them into the land I swore with an oath to give them, and they saw every high hill and every shade tree.

verses.text: Then I said to them, ‘What is this high place you go to?’ So they call its name Bamah, to this day.’ ”
parts: Then I said to them, ‘What is this high place you go to?’ So they call its name Bamah, to this day.’ ”

verses.text: Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Do you defile yourselves with the lawlessness of your fathers, and commit fornication after their abominations?
parts: Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Do you defile yourselves with the lawlessness of your fathers, and commit fornication after their abominations?

verses.text: You defile yourselves in the first fruits of your gifts with all your inventions to this very day.
parts: You defile yourselves in the first fruits of your gifts with all your inventions to this very day.

verses.text: for it will not be as you say, ‘We will be like the nations and like the tribes of the earth, to worship trees and stones.’
parts: for it will not be as you say, ‘We will be like the nations and like the tribes of the earth, to worship trees and stones.’

verses.text: “Therefore, as I live,” says the Lord, “I will reign over you with a mighty hand, with a high arm, and with anger poured out. I shall lead you out from the peoples and will receive you from the countries where you were scattered, with a mighty hand, with a high arm, and with anger poured out.
parts: “Therefore, as I live,” says the Lord, “I will reign over you with a mighty hand, with a high arm, and with anger poured out.
I shall lead you out from the peoples and will receive you from the countries where you were scattered, with a mighty hand, with a high arm, and with anger poured out.

verses.text: I shall lead you out from the peoples and will receive you from the countries where you were scattered, with a mighty hand, with a high arm, and with anger poured out.
parts: I shall lead you out from the peoples and will receive you from the countries where you were scattered, with a mighty hand, with a high arm, and with anger poured out.

verses.text: I shall bring you into the desert of the peoples and will judge you face to face.
parts: I shall bring you into the desert of the peoples and will judge you face to face.

verses.text: As I judged your fathers in the desert of the land of Egypt, so I shall judge you,” says the Lord.
parts: As I judged your fathers in the desert of the land of Egypt, so I shall judge you,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “I will make you pass under my scepter and bring you in by number.
parts: “I will make you pass under my scepter and bring you in by number.

verses.text: I will select the ungodly from among you, and those who revolted; for I shall lead them out of their sojourning, and they will not enter the land of Israel.

verses.text: You sat on a furnished bed, with a decorated table before it, and they rejoiced over My incense and oil.
parts: You sat on a furnished bed, with a decorated table before it, and they rejoiced over My incense and oil.

verses.text: They played harmonious music, and put bracelets on their wrists and a crown of boasting on their heads, to attract the multitude of men coming from the desert.
parts: They played harmonious music, and put bracelets on their wrists and a crown of boasting on their heads, to attract the multitude of men coming from the desert.

verses.text: Therefore I asked, ‘Are they not committing adultery and doing the deeds of a prostitute with these?
parts: Therefore I asked, ‘Are they not committing adultery and doing the deeds of a prostitute with these?

verses.text: Yes, they went in to her as men go in to a prostitute; thus they went in to Oholah and Oholibah, to commit lawlessness.
parts: Yes, they went in to her as men go in to a prostitute; thus they went in to Oholah and Oholibah, to commit lawlessness.

verses.text: But righteous men will take revenge on them after the manner of an adulteress, and after the manner of women who shed blood; because they are adulteresses, and blood is on their hands.
parts: But righteous men will take revenge on them after the manner of an adulteress, and after the manner of women who shed blood; because they are adulteresses, and blood is on their hands.

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: ‘Bring up a multitude against them and give them up to trouble and plunder.
parts: “Thus says the Lord: ‘Bring up a multitude against them and give them up to trouble and plunder.

verses.text: They will stone them with the stones of a crowd and stab them with their swords.
parts: They will stone them with the stones of a crowd and stab them with their swords.

verses.text: Thus I shall turn away ungodliness from the land, and all women will be taught not to imitate their ungodliness.
parts: Thus I shall turn away ungodliness from the land, and all women will be taught not to imitate their ungodliness.

verses.text: Your ungodliness will be recompensed upon you, and you will bear the sins of your inventions.
parts: Your ungodliness will be recompensed upon you, and you will bear the sins of your inventions.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, saying, “Son of man, record for yourself daily, from this day, the day on which the king of Babylon laid siege against Jerusalem.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, saying,
“Son of man, record for yourself daily, from this day, the day on which the king of Babylon laid siege against Jerusalem.

verses.text: Speak a parable to the house which provokes, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Stand over a basin and pour water into it.
parts: Speak a parable to the house which provokes, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Stand over a basin and pour water into it.

verses.text: Put pieces of meat in it, every good piece, the thigh and shoulder full of meat,
parts: Put pieces of meat in it, every good piece, the thigh and shoulder full of meat,

verses.text: taken from the choice cattle.
parts: taken from the choice cattle.

verses.text: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord: “O bloody city, the basin in which there is scum, and the scum has not gone out of it.
parts: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord: “O bloody city, the basin in which there is scum, and the scum has not gone out of it.

verses.text: For her blood is in her midst; I set it upon a smooth rock; I did not pour it on the ground, that the dirt may cover it,
parts: For her blood is in her midst; I set it upon a smooth rock; I did not pour it on the ground, that the dirt may cover it,

verses.text: that My wrath may come forth and take vengeance.
parts: that My wrath may come forth and take vengeance.

verses.text: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord: “I will also make a great display of fire.
parts: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord: “I will also make a great display of fire.

verses.text: I shall heap the wood on and kindle the fire, to consume the meat and boil away the sauce.
parts: I shall heap the wood on and kindle the fire, to consume the meat and boil away the sauce.

verses.text: I will set the basin on the coals, so its copper may become thoroughly heated and melted in the midst of her uncleanness, so her scum may be consumed,
parts: I will set the basin on the coals, so its copper may become thoroughly heated and melted in the midst of her uncleanness, so her scum may be consumed,

verses.text: and her abundant scum may not come forth from her.
parts: and her abundant scum may not come forth from her.

verses.text: Her scum shall be shameful, because you defiled yourself, and what if you will not be cleansed any more, until I have satisfied my wrath?
parts: Her scum shall be shameful, because you defiled yourself, and what if you will not be cleansed any more, until I have satisfied my wrath?

verses.text: I, the Lord, have spoken it, and it will come to pass; and I shall do it.
parts: I, the Lord, have spoken it, and it will come to pass; and I shall do it.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, behold, I will take away your inventions before your eyes in the line of battle, but you shall neither mourn nor weep.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, behold, I will take away your inventions before your eyes in the line of battle, but you shall neither mourn nor weep.

parts: “Son of man, behold, I will take away your inventions before your eyes in the line of battle, but you shall neither mourn nor weep.

verses.text: There shall be groaning over bloodshed and mourning on bended knee.
parts: There shall be groaning over bloodshed and mourning on bended knee.

verses.text: So I spoke to the people in the morning in the manner He commanded me, and that evening my wife died.
parts: So I spoke to the people in the morning in the manner He commanded me, and that evening my wife died.

verses.text: Then the people said to me, “Will you not tell us what these things mean that you are doing?” So I answered them, “The word of the Lord came to me, saying, ‘Speak to the house of Israel, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I shall desecrate My sanctuary, the boast of your strength, the object of your desire, over which your souls spare nothing; and your sons and daughters whom you left will fall by the sword.

verses.text: Your hair will be on your heads and your sandals on your feet.

verses.text: Thus Ezekiel shall be a sign to you; according to all he does, you will do.
parts: Thus Ezekiel shall be a sign to you; according to all he does, you will do.

verses.text: ‘As for you, son of man, it shall not be as in the day when I take their strength from them, the arrogance of their boasting, the objects of their desire, and the arrogance of their souls, their sons and their daughters.
parts: ‘As for you, son of man, it shall not be as in the day when I take their strength from them, the arrogance of their boasting, the objects of their desire, and the arrogance of their souls, their sons and their daughters.

headers: Judgment on the Gentile Nations: Ammon

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, set your face against the children of Ammon and prophesy against them.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, set your face against the children of Ammon and prophesy against them.

verses.text: You shall say to the children of Ammon, ‘Hear the word of the Lord.
parts: You shall say to the children of Ammon, ‘Hear the word of the Lord.

verses.text: therefore, behold, I shall deliver you over to the children of Kedem as an inheritance.
parts: therefore, behold, I shall deliver you over to the children of Kedem as an inheritance.

verses.text: I shall make the city of Ammon a pasturage for camels, and Rabbah a resting place for sheep.
parts: I shall make the city of Ammon a pasturage for camels, and Rabbah a resting place for sheep.

verses.text: For thus says the Lord: “Because you clapped your hands, and applauded with your feet, and rejoiced in your soul against the land of Israel;
parts: For thus says the Lord: “Because you clapped your hands, and applauded with your feet, and rejoiced in your soul against the land of Israel;

verses.text: therefore, I shall stretch out My hand against you and give you as plunder to the nations.
parts: therefore, I shall stretch out My hand against you and give you as plunder to the nations.

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord: “Because Moab said, ‘Behold, the house of Israel and Judah is like all the nations,’ therefore, behold, I shall weaken the shoulder of Moab from its prominent cities—its choice land—as is the house of Beth Jeshimoth, above the spring of the seaside city.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord: “Because Moab said, ‘Behold, the house of Israel and Judah is like all the nations,’ therefore, behold, I shall weaken the shoulder of Moab from its prominent cities—its choice land—as is the house of Beth Jeshimoth, above the spring of the seaside city.

parts: therefore, behold, I shall weaken the shoulder of Moab from its prominent cities—its choice land—as is the house of Beth Jeshimoth, above the spring of the seaside city.

verses.text: I have given these cities, as well as the children of Ammon, as an inheritance to the sons of Kedem, so there may be no memory of the sons of Ammon.
parts: I have given these cities, as well as the children of Ammon, as an inheritance to the sons of Kedem, so there may be no memory of the sons of Ammon.

verses.text: Thus I shall take vengeance upon Moab, and they will know that I am the Lord.”
parts: Thus I shall take vengeance upon Moab, and they will know that I am the Lord.”

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord: “Because of what Edom did when it took revenge on the house of Judah, and because they remembered wrongs and exacted punishment,” therefore, thus says the Lord: “I shall also stretch out My hand against Edom, and destroy man and cattle from it, and make it a desert.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord: “Because of what Edom did when it took revenge on the house of Judah, and because they remembered wrongs and exacted punishment,” therefore, thus says the Lord: “I shall also stretch out My hand against Edom, and destroy man and cattle from it, and make it a desert.

parts: I shall execute My vengeance on Edom by the hand of My people Israel, and they will do in Edom according to My wrath and anger.

verses.text: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord: “Because the foreigners exacted vengeance and raised up vengeance, rejoicing in their souls to destroy My people forever,” therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, I shall stretch out My hand against the foreigners, and I shall utterly destroy the Cretans.
parts: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord: “Because the foreigners exacted vengeance and raised up vengeance, rejoicing in their souls to destroy My people forever,” therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, I shall stretch out My hand against the foreigners, and I shall utterly destroy the Cretans.
