parts: I shall execute great vengeance, and they will know that I am the Lord, when I bring My vengeance upon them.” ’ ”

verses.text: Again it came to pass in the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, because Tyre spoke against Jerusalem, saying, ‘Good, well done!’ she is crushed; the nations destroyed her; she is turned to Me; she who was full is made desolate!
parts: Again it came to pass in the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, because Tyre spoke against Jerusalem, saying, ‘Good, well done!’ she is crushed; the nations destroyed her; she is turned to Me; she who was full is made desolate!

verses.text: Therefore, thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I am against you, O Tyre, and will cause many nations to come up against you, as the sea causes its waves to crash the shore.
parts: Therefore, thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I am against you, O Tyre, and will cause many nations to come up against you, as the sea causes its waves to crash the shore.

verses.text: They will knock down your walls, O Tyre, and break down your towers.
parts: They will knock down your walls, O Tyre, and break down your towers.

verses.text: It will be a drying-place for fishing nets in the midst of the sea, for I have spoken,’ says the Lord.
parts: It will be a drying-place for fishing nets in the midst of the sea, for I have spoken,’ says the Lord.

verses.text: Also her daughters which are on the plain will be killed by the sword.
parts: Also her daughters which are on the plain will be killed by the sword.

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, from the north I will bring Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon against you, O Tyre.
parts: “For thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, from the north I will bring Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon against you, O Tyre.

verses.text: He will kill your daughters with the sword in the plain; he will establish outposts and build forts around you.
parts: He will kill your daughters with the sword in the plain; he will establish outposts and build forts around you.

verses.text: Your walls and towers will be struck down with his swords.
parts: Your walls and towers will be struck down with his swords.

verses.text: Because of the great number of his horses, their dust clouds will cover you, and because of the sound of his horsemen and the wheels of his chariots, your walls will shake when he enters your gates, like one who enters a city from the plain.
parts: Because of the great number of his horses, their dust clouds will cover you, and because of the sound of his horsemen and the wheels of his chariots, your walls will shake when he enters your gates, like one who enters a city from the plain.

verses.text: With the hooves of his horses, they will trample all your streets.
parts: With the hooves of his horses, they will trample all your streets.

verses.text: He will plunder your army and strip your possessions.
parts: He will plunder your army and strip your possessions.

verses.text: He will destroy the multitude of your musicians, and the sound of your harps will be heard no more.
parts: He will destroy the multitude of your musicians, and the sound of your harps will be heard no more.

verses.text: I shall make you bare like the top of a rock, a place for spreading nets; you will never be rebuilt, for I have spoken,’ says the Lord.
parts: I shall make you bare like the top of a rock, a place for spreading nets; you will never be rebuilt, for I have spoken,’ says the Lord.

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord and Master to Tyre: ‘Will not the coastlands shake at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan, when the sword is unsheathed in your midst?
parts: “For thus says the Lord and Master to Tyre: ‘Will not the coastlands shake at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan, when the sword is unsheathed in your midst?

verses.text: Then all the rulers of the nations along the seacoast will step down from their thrones, lay aside their crowns, and take off their embroidered garments.
parts: Then all the rulers of the nations along the seacoast will step down from their thrones, lay aside their crowns, and take off their embroidered garments.

verses.text: They will take up a lamentation for you and say to you, “How were you destroyed from out of the sea, O renowned city that caused her fear to be on all her inhabitants?”
parts: They will take up a lamentation for you and say to you, “How were you destroyed from out of the sea, O renowned city that caused her fear to be on all her inhabitants?”

verses.text: From the day of your fall, the coastlands will also be afraid.’
parts: From the day of your fall, the coastlands will also be afraid.’

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord and Master: ‘When I make you a wasted city, like cities not to be inhabited, and when I bring the abyss upon you, and much water covers you, then I shall bring you down to those who descend into the pit, to the people of old, and I shall make you dwell in the depths of the earth, like an eternal desert, with those who go down into the pit, that you may never be inhabited, nor raised up to the land of the living.
parts: “For thus says the Lord and Master: ‘When I make you a wasted city, like cities not to be inhabited, and when I bring the abyss upon you, and much water covers you, then I shall bring you down to those who descend into the pit, to the people of old, and I shall make you dwell in the depths of the earth, like an eternal desert, with those who go down into the pit, that you may never be inhabited, nor raised up to the land of the living.

verses.text: I shall give you over to destruction, and you will never exist again,’ says the Lord and Master.”
parts: I shall give you over to destruction, and you will never exist again,’ says the Lord and Master.”

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, take up a lamentation for Tyre, and you shall say to Tyre, situated at the entrance of the sea and market of the peoples on many coastlands, ‘Thus says the Lord to Tyre: “You say, ‘I clothed myself with beauty.’ In the heart of the sea, your sons clothed you with beauty for Beelim.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

“Son of man, take up a lamentation for Tyre, and you shall say to Tyre, situated at the entrance of the sea and market of the peoples on many coastlands, ‘Thus says the Lord to Tyre: “You say, ‘I clothed myself with beauty.’ In the heart of the sea, your sons clothed you with beauty for Beelim.

verses.text: Cedar from Senir was used by you in building.
parts: Cedar from Senir was used by you in building.

verses.text: and they made your oars out of wood from Bashan.
parts: and they made your oars out of wood from Bashan.

verses.text: Your couch was made of fine embroidered linen from Egypt, to cover you with splendor, and to clothe you with blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah.
parts: Your couch was made of fine embroidered linen from Egypt, to cover you with splendor, and to clothe you with blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah.

verses.text: Your rulers were the inhabitants of Sidon, and the Aradians were your oarsmen.
parts: Your rulers were the inhabitants of Sidon, and the Aradians were your oarsmen.

verses.text: The elders of Byblos and their wise men were in you.
parts: The elders of Byblos and their wise men were in you.

verses.text: “Persians, Lydians, and Libyans were in your army.
parts: “Persians, Lydians, and Libyans were in your army.

verses.text: The sons of the Aradians and your army were upon your walls.
parts: The sons of the Aradians and your army were upon your walls.

verses.text: “Those from Carthage were your merchants because of the abundance of all your strength.
parts: “Those from Carthage were your merchants because of the abundance of all your strength.

verses.text: Greece and all the extended regions, these busied themselves in the trade of human lives and of vessels of copper for your markets.
parts: Greece and all the extended regions, these busied themselves in the trade of human lives and of vessels of copper for your markets.

verses.text: The house of Togarmah furnished your marketplace with horses and horsemen.
parts: The house of Togarmah furnished your marketplace with horses and horsemen.

verses.text: The sons of Rodians were your traders.
parts: The sons of Rodians were your traders.

verses.text: To those who brought in the goods, you paid them wages in return from the abundant market of your mixed goods: myrrh and embroidered works from Tharsis, and even people as merchandise.
parts: To those who brought in the goods, you paid them wages in return from the abundant market of your mixed goods: myrrh and embroidered works from Tharsis, and even people as merchandise.

verses.text: Judah and the sons of Israel, these traded with you.
parts: Judah and the sons of Israel, these traded with you.

verses.text: Damascus was a merchant in your marketplace because of the abundance of all your power: wine from Helbon and wool from Miletos.
parts: Damascus was a merchant in your marketplace because of the abundance of all your power: wine from Helbon and wool from Miletos.

verses.text: From Asel, there came wrought iron and wheels for your market of mixed goods.
parts: From Asel, there came wrought iron and wheels for your market of mixed goods.

verses.text: Dedan was your merchant, with choice animals for chariots.
parts: Dedan was your merchant, with choice animals for chariots.

verses.text: Arabia and all the rulers of Kedar, these were your traders, bringing camels, rams, and lambs in which they traded with you.
parts: Arabia and all the rulers of Kedar, these were your traders, bringing camels, rams, and lambs in which they traded with you.

verses.text: The merchants of Sheba and Raamah traded with you.
parts: The merchants of Sheba and Raamah traded with you.

verses.text: Harran and Canneh also traded with you.
parts: Harran and Canneh also traded with you.

verses.text: as they brought trade in blue cloth, in choice treasures bound with ropes, and in cypress wood.
parts: as they brought trade in blue cloth, in choice treasures bound with ropes, and in cypress wood.

verses.text: The ships of Tarshish were your merchants in abundance, with your market of mixed goods, and you were filled and heavily loaded in the heart of the sea.
parts: The ships of Tarshish were your merchants in abundance, with your market of mixed goods, and you were filled and heavily loaded in the heart of the sea.

verses.text: “Your oarsmen brought you into many waters, but the south wind broke you to pieces in the heart of the sea.
parts: “Your oarsmen brought you into many waters, but the south wind broke you to pieces in the heart of the sea.

verses.text: Your armies and the profits from your markets of mixed goods, your oarsmen and pilots, your counselors and merchandisers from your market of mixed goods, all your men of war who are in you, and the entire company in your midst will fall in the heart of the sea in the day of your fall.
parts: Your armies and the profits from your markets of mixed goods, your oarsmen and pilots, your counselors and merchandisers from your market of mixed goods, all your men of war who are in you, and the entire company in your midst will fall in the heart of the sea in the day of your fall.

verses.text: At the sound of your cry, your pilots will be greatly afraid.
parts: At the sound of your cry, your pilots will be greatly afraid.

verses.text: All who handle the oar, the mariners, and all the pilots of the sea will disembark from their ships and stand on the shore.
parts: All who handle the oar, the mariners, and all the pilots of the sea will disembark from their ships and stand on the shore.

verses.text: They will cry out in pain over you.
parts: They will cry out in pain over you.

verses.text: Their sons will take up a song of grief and a lamentation for you, saying,
parts: Their sons will take up a song of grief and a lamentation for you, saying,

verses.text: ‘How great a profit did you find from the sea?
parts: ‘How great a profit did you find from the sea?

verses.text: Now you are broken to pieces in the sea, in the depth of water.
parts: Now you are broken to pieces in the sea, in the depth of water.

verses.text: All the inhabitants of the coastlands are shocked over you.

headers: The King of Tyre Is Overthrown

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “As for you, son of man, say to the ruler of Tyre, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Because your heart is lifted up, and you say, ‘I am God, and I live in the dwelling of God, in the heart of the sea,’ yet you are a man and not God, though you set your heart as the heart of God.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “As for you, son of man, say to the ruler of Tyre, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Because your heart is lifted up, and you say, ‘I am God, and I live in the dwelling of God, in the heart of the sea,’ yet you are a man and not God, though you set your heart as the heart of God.

verses.text: Are you wiser than Daniel?
parts: Are you wiser than Daniel?

verses.text: Have you gained wisdom by your own understanding?
parts: Have you gained wisdom by your own understanding?

verses.text: By your abundant understanding and trade you increased your power, and your heart was lifted up in your power.”
parts: By your abundant understanding and trade you increased your power, and your heart was lifted up in your power.”

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: “Since you set your heart as the heart of God,
parts: Therefore thus says the Lord: “Since you set your heart as the heart of God,

verses.text: instead of this, behold, I shall bring foreigners against you, the plague of the nations.
parts: instead of this, behold, I shall bring foreigners against you, the plague of the nations.

parts: Will you still say, ‘I am God,’ before those who slay you?

parts: You shall perish by the hands of foreigners among the multitude of the uncircumcised, for I have spoken,” says the Lord.’ ”

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, take up a lamentation for the ruler of Tyre, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “You are a seal of resemblance and crown of beauty.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, take up a lamentation for the ruler of Tyre, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “You are a seal of resemblance and crown of beauty.

verses.text: “Son of man, take up a lamentation for the ruler of Tyre, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “You are a seal of resemblance and crown of beauty.
parts: “Son of man, take up a lamentation for the ruler of Tyre, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “You are a seal of resemblance and crown of beauty.

verses.text: You were the luxury of the paradise of God, adorned with every good stone: sardius, topaz, emerald, and diamond, sapphire, jasper, silver, and gold, stone of Liguria, agate, and amethyst, chrysolite, beryl, and onyx.
parts: You were the luxury of the paradise of God, adorned with every good stone: sardius, topaz, emerald, and diamond, sapphire, jasper, silver, and gold, stone of Liguria, agate, and amethyst, chrysolite, beryl, and onyx.

verses.text: I appointed you to be with the cherub.
parts: I appointed you to be with the cherub.

verses.text: You were blameless in your days from the day you were created, until wrongs were found in you.
parts: You were blameless in your days from the day you were created, until wrongs were found in you.

verses.text: By the abundance of your trade, you filled your secret rooms with lawlessness; thus you sinned.
parts: By the abundance of your trade, you filled your secret rooms with lawlessness; thus you sinned.

verses.text: Your heart was lifted up because of your beauty.
parts: Your heart was lifted up because of your beauty.

verses.text: Because of the multitude of your sins and the wrongdoings of your trade, you desecrated your sanctuaries; therefore, I will bring fire from your midst which will devour you, to turn you into ashes upon your land in the sight of all who see you.
parts: Because of the multitude of your sins and the wrongdoings of your trade, you desecrated your sanctuaries; therefore, I will bring fire from your midst which will devour you, to turn you into ashes upon your land in the sight of all who see you.

verses.text: All who know you among the nations shall groan over you.
parts: All who know you among the nations shall groan over you.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against her, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against you, O Sidon, and I shall be glorified in you.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against her, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against you, O Sidon, and I shall be glorified in you.

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against her,
parts: “Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against her,

verses.text: and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against you, O Sidon, and I shall be glorified in you.
parts: and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against you, O Sidon, and I shall be glorified in you.

verses.text: Blood and death shall be in your streets, and those wounded by the sword shall fall on every side.
parts: Blood and death shall be in your streets, and those wounded by the sword shall fall on every side.

verses.text: “Thus there will no longer be in the house of Israel a thorn of bitterness or a painful thorn from all who are around them, who dishonor them.
parts: “Thus there will no longer be in the house of Israel a thorn of bitterness or a painful thorn from all who are around them, who dishonor them.

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “I shall bring Israel from the nations where they were scattered, and I shall be sanctified among them in the sight of the peoples and of the nations.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “I shall bring Israel from the nations where they were scattered, and I shall be sanctified among them in the sight of the peoples and of the nations.

verses.text: So they will dwell there in hope, build houses, and plant vineyards; yes, they will dwell in hope when I execute judgment on all those who dishonor them.
parts: So they will dwell there in hope, build houses, and plant vineyards; yes, they will dwell in hope when I execute judgment on all those who dishonor them.

headers: Lamentation for the Ruler of Tyre

verses.text: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, set your face toward Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.
parts: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, set your face toward Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.

verses.text: Speak and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against you, O Pharaoh king of Egypt, O great dragon who lies in the midst of his rivers and says, ‘The rivers are mine, for I made them.’
parts: Speak and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against you, O Pharaoh king of Egypt, O great dragon who lies in the midst of his rivers and says, ‘The rivers are mine, for I made them.’

verses.text: But I shall put hooks in your jaws and join the fish of your rivers to your wings, and I shall bring you and all the fish of your river up from the midst of your river.
parts: But I shall put hooks in your jaws and join the fish of your rivers to your wings, and I shall bring you and all the fish of your river up from the midst of your river.

verses.text: Then I will quickly cast down you and all the fish of your river.
parts: Then I will quickly cast down you and all the fish of your river.

verses.text: Then all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am the Lord, because they were a staff made of reed to the house of Israel.
parts: Then all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am the Lord, because they were a staff made of reed to the house of Israel.

verses.text: For when they took hold of you with their hand, you broke it, and when every hand conquered them and they rested their hand on you, you crushed it and broke all their backs.”
parts: For when they took hold of you with their hand, you broke it, and when every hand conquered them and they rested their hand on you, you crushed it and broke all their backs.”

verses.text: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will bring a sword against you, and destroy man and cattle from you.
parts: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will bring a sword against you, and destroy man and cattle from you.

verses.text: Thus the land of Egypt shall be destroyed and become a desert.
parts: Thus the land of Egypt shall be destroyed and become a desert.

verses.text: Therefore, behold, I am against you and against all your rivers, and I shall turn the land of Egypt into a desert, to the sword and to destruction, from Migdol to Syene, as far as the borders of Ethiopia.
parts: Therefore, behold, I am against you and against all your rivers, and I shall turn the land of Egypt into a desert, to the sword and to destruction, from Migdol to Syene, as far as the borders of Ethiopia.

verses.text: Neither foot of man nor foot of cattle will pass through it, and it will be uninhabited for forty years.
parts: Neither foot of man nor foot of cattle will pass through it, and it will be uninhabited for forty years.

verses.text: I shall make the land of Egypt a destruction in the midst of a land laid waste, and her cities will be laid waste for forty years.
parts: I shall make the land of Egypt a destruction in the midst of a land laid waste, and her cities will be laid waste for forty years.

verses.text: ‘Yet, thus says the Lord: “At the end of forty years, I shall gather the Egyptians from the nations where they were scattered.
parts: ‘Yet, thus says the Lord: “At the end of forty years, I shall gather the Egyptians from the nations where they were scattered.

verses.text: I shall bring back the captives of the Egyptians and cause them to dwell in the land of Pathros, in the land from which they were taken; but they will be a lowly dominion.
parts: I shall bring back the captives of the Egyptians and cause them to dwell in the land of Pathros, in the land from which they were taken; but they will be a lowly dominion.

verses.text: Alongside all the dominions, it will not be exalted any longer among the nations, for I shall make them to be very small, so as not to be great among the nations.
parts: Alongside all the dominions, it will not be exalted any longer among the nations, for I shall make them to be very small, so as not to be great among the nations.

verses.text: So they shall no longer be to the house of Israel as an expectation to remind them to follow after their lawlessness.
parts: So they shall no longer be to the house of Israel as an expectation to remind them to follow after their lawlessness.

verses.text: Again it came to pass in the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon caused his army to labor strenuously against Tyre.
parts: Again it came to pass in the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon caused his army to labor strenuously against Tyre.

verses.text: “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon caused his army to labor strenuously against Tyre.
parts: “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon caused his army to labor strenuously against Tyre.

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord and Master: ‘Behold, I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will plunder it and carry off her spoil.
parts: Therefore thus says the Lord and Master: ‘Behold, I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will plunder it and carry off her spoil.

verses.text: As compensation for his service in which he served against Tyre, I will give him the land of Egypt,’ says the Lord and Master.
parts: As compensation for his service in which he served against Tyre, I will give him the land of Egypt,’ says the Lord and Master.

verses.text: “In that day a horn shall spring forth for all the house of Israel, and I will give you an open mouth in the midst of them.
parts: “In that day a horn shall spring forth for all the house of Israel, and I will give you an open mouth in the midst of them.

headers: Woe to Egypt and Her Allies

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Woe, woe be the day!
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Woe, woe be the day!

verses.text: For the day of the Lord is near.
parts: For the day of the Lord is near.

verses.text: The sword will come upon the Egyptians, and there shall be trouble in Ethiopia.
parts: The sword will come upon the Egyptians, and there shall be trouble in Ethiopia.

verses.text: Persians, Cretans, Lydians, Libyans, and all the mixed multitude, and all the children of the covenant shall fall by the sword therein.”
parts: Persians, Cretans, Lydians, Libyans, and all the mixed multitude, and all the children of the covenant shall fall by the sword therein.”

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord: “The supports of Egypt will fall, and the insolence of her strength will come down.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord: “The supports of Egypt will fall, and the insolence of her strength will come down.

verses.text: “So they shall be wasted in the midst of desolate countries, and their cities shall be wasted in the midst of desolate cities.
parts: “So they shall be wasted in the midst of desolate countries, and their cities shall be wasted in the midst of desolate cities.

verses.text: Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I set Egypt on fire and crush all those who help it.
parts: Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I set Egypt on fire and crush all those who help it.

verses.text: In that day messengers shall go forth, hurrying to destroy Ethiopia, and there will be trouble among them in the day of Egypt; for behold, it is coming.”
parts: In that day messengers shall go forth, hurrying to destroy Ethiopia, and there will be trouble among them in the day of Egypt; for behold, it is coming.”

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “I shall destroy a multitude of the Egyptians by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “I shall destroy a multitude of the Egyptians by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon.

verses.text: His hand and the hand of his people, they are the plague of the nations, sent to destroy the land.
parts: His hand and the hand of his people, they are the plague of the nations, sent to destroy the land.

verses.text: I shall make their rivers deserts, and I will destroy the land and its fullness by the hands of foreigners.
parts: I shall make their rivers deserts, and I will destroy the land and its fullness by the hands of foreigners.

verses.text: ‘For thus says the Lord and Master: “I shall also destroy the men of high status from Memphis, and the rulers of Memphis from the land of Egypt; and they shall be no more.
parts: ‘For thus says the Lord and Master: “I shall also destroy the men of high status from Memphis, and the rulers of Memphis from the land of Egypt; and they shall be no more.

verses.text: I shall destroy the land of Pathros, and set Tanis on fire, and exact vengeance on Diospolis.
parts: I shall destroy the land of Pathros, and set Tanis on fire, and exact vengeance on Diospolis.

verses.text: I will pour out My anger on Sais, the strength of Egypt, and I will destroy the multitude of Memphis,
parts: I will pour out My anger on Sais, the strength of Egypt, and I will destroy the multitude of Memphis,

verses.text: and set Egypt on fire.
parts: and set Egypt on fire.

verses.text: The youth of Heliopolis and Bubastum shall fall by the sword, and the women will go into captivity.
parts: The youth of Heliopolis and Bubastum shall fall by the sword, and the women will go into captivity.

verses.text: At Taphnae, the day will be darkened, when there I break to pieces the kingly powers of Egypt, and there the insolence of her strength shall perish.
parts: At Taphnae, the day will be darkened, when there I break to pieces the kingly powers of Egypt, and there the insolence of her strength shall perish.

verses.text: Thus I shall execute judgment on Egypt, for they shall know that I am the Lord.” ’ ”
parts: Thus I shall execute judgment on Egypt, for they shall know that I am the Lord.” ’ ”

verses.text: Again it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, I have broken the arms of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and, behold, it has not been bound up to be healed, and no plaster applied to make it strong enough to hold a sword.
parts: Again it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, I have broken the arms of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and, behold, it has not been bound up to be healed, and no plaster applied to make it strong enough to hold a sword.

verses.text: “Son of man, I have broken the arms of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and, behold, it has not been bound up to be healed, and no plaster applied to make it strong enough to hold a sword.
parts: “Son of man, I have broken the arms of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and, behold, it has not been bound up to be healed, and no plaster applied to make it strong enough to hold a sword.

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord and Master: ‘I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt.
parts: Therefore thus says the Lord and Master: ‘I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt.

verses.text: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them as chaff throughout the countries.
parts: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them as chaff throughout the countries.

verses.text: I shall strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put My sword into his hand.
parts: I shall strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put My sword into his hand.

verses.text: Thus I shall strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh will fall.
parts: Thus I shall strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh will fall.

verses.text: So I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them as chaff throughout the countries.
parts: So I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them as chaff throughout the countries.

verses.text: Again it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, say to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and to his multitude, ‘To whom do you liken yourself in your high position? Behold, Assyria was a cypress in Lebanon, and he was beautiful in offshoots and high in greatness.
parts: Again it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, say to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and to his multitude, ‘To whom do you liken yourself in your high position?
Behold, Assyria was a cypress in Lebanon, and he was beautiful in offshoots and high in greatness.

verses.text: Water nurtured him, and the depths made him grow tall.
parts: Water nurtured him, and the depths made him grow tall.

verses.text: For this reason his greatness was exalted above all the trees of the plain, and his branches were enlarged because of the abundance of water.
parts: For this reason his greatness was exalted above all the trees of the plain, and his branches were enlarged because of the abundance of water.

verses.text: All the birds of the heavens made their nests in his offshoots, and under his branches all the wild animals of the plain brought forth their young; and all the multitude of nations dwelt under his shadow.
parts: All the birds of the heavens made their nests in his offshoots, and under his branches all the wild animals of the plain brought forth their young; and all the multitude of nations dwelt under his shadow.

verses.text: Thus he was beautiful in his high position because of the multitude of his branches, for his roots were in much water.
parts: Thus he was beautiful in his high position because of the multitude of his branches, for his roots were in much water.

verses.text: There were no such cypresses in the paradise of God, and there were no pine trees displaying offshoots like these.
parts: There were no such cypresses in the paradise of God, and there were no pine trees displaying offshoots like these.

verses.text: and all the trees of God's paradise of splendor were jealous of him.’
parts: and all the trees of God's paradise of splendor were jealous of him.’

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘Because you increased in greatness, and you established your rule among the clouds, and I saw him when he was exalted; therefore, I delivered him into the hands of the ruler of nations, and he carried out his destruction.
parts: “Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘Because you increased in greatness, and you established your rule among the clouds, and I saw him when he was exalted;
therefore, I delivered him into the hands of the ruler of nations, and he carried out his destruction.

verses.text: therefore, I delivered him into the hands of the ruler of nations, and he carried out his destruction.
parts: therefore, I delivered him into the hands of the ruler of nations, and he carried out his destruction.

verses.text: Thus foreigners, the plague of the nations, destroyed him and cast him down upon the mountains.
parts: Thus foreigners, the plague of the nations, destroyed him and cast him down upon the mountains.

verses.text: All the birds of heaven rested on his fall, and all the wild animals of the field came upon his branches,
parts: All the birds of heaven rested on his fall, and all the wild animals of the field came upon his branches,

verses.text: that no trees in the water may ever again exalt themselves in their greatness, nor establish their rule among the clouds, and that no trees which drink water may stand in their high position.
parts: that no trees in the water may ever again exalt themselves in their greatness, nor establish their rule among the clouds, and that no trees which drink water may stand in their high position.

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord and Master: ‘In the day he went down to Hades, the deep abyss mourned him; and I stood over her rivers and restrained her abundant water.
parts: “Thus says the Lord and Master: ‘In the day he went down to Hades, the deep abyss mourned him; and I stood over her rivers and restrained her abundant water.

verses.text: From the sound of his fall, the nations were shaken when I cast him down to Hades, together with those who descend into the pit.
parts: From the sound of his fall, the nations were shaken when I cast him down to Hades, together with those who descend into the pit.

verses.text: Yet they also went down to Hades with him among those slain by the sword, along with their posterity.
parts: Yet they also went down to Hades with him among those slain by the sword, along with their posterity.

verses.text: To whom are you likened?
parts: To whom are you likened?

verses.text: Again it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the twelfth month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, take up a lamentation over Pharaoh king of Egypt, and you shall say to him, ‘You are like a lion among the nations, and you are like a dragon in the sea.
parts: Again it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the twelfth month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, take up a lamentation over Pharaoh king of Egypt, and you shall say to him, ‘You are like a lion among the nations, and you are like a dragon in the sea.

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: ‘I shall therefore spread a net over you of many peoples, and bring you up with my fishhook.
parts: “Thus says the Lord: ‘I shall therefore spread a net over you of many peoples, and bring you up with my fishhook.

verses.text: I shall stretch you out upon the earth, and the plains will be filled with you.
parts: I shall stretch you out upon the earth, and the plains will be filled with you.

verses.text: I shall offer your flesh on the open mountains and saturate them with your blood.
parts: I shall offer your flesh on the open mountains and saturate them with your blood.

verses.text: The land shall be drenched with your excrement because of your multitude upon the mountains.
parts: The land shall be drenched with your excrement because of your multitude upon the mountains.

verses.text: When I extinguish you, I shall cover up heaven and make its stars grow dark.
parts: When I extinguish you, I shall cover up heaven and make its stars grow dark.

verses.text: All the bodies that give light in heaven shall grow dark over you, and I shall bring darkness upon your land, says the Lord and Master.
parts: All the bodies that give light in heaven shall grow dark over you, and I shall bring darkness upon your land, says the Lord and Master.

verses.text: I will provoke to anger the heart of many peoples, when I lead you captive among the nations into a land you have not known.
parts: I will provoke to anger the heart of many peoples, when I lead you captive among the nations into a land you have not known.

verses.text: Many nations will become saddened over you, and their kings will be utterly amazed when My sword flies in their faces, as they await their own fall from the day of your fall.’
parts: Many nations will become saddened over you, and their kings will be utterly amazed when My sword flies in their faces, as they await their own fall from the day of your fall.’

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord: ‘The sword of the king of Babylon will come upon you with the swords of his mighty men, and I will strike down your strength.
parts: “For thus says the Lord: ‘The sword of the king of Babylon will come upon you with the swords of his mighty men, and I will strike down your strength.

verses.text: All these men are plagues from the nations.
parts: All these men are plagues from the nations.

verses.text: I will also destroy all her cattle from beside her abundant water, which the foot of man will trouble no more, nor will the footstep of cattle trample it.
parts: I will also destroy all her cattle from beside her abundant water, which the foot of man will trouble no more, nor will the footstep of cattle trample it.

verses.text: Thus at that time, their waters shall become still, and their rivers will flow like oil, says the Lord,
parts: Thus at that time, their waters shall become still, and their rivers will flow like oil, says the Lord,

verses.text: when I give Egypt over to destruction, and the land becomes desolate with all its fullness, and when I disperse all who dwell in it.
parts: when I give Egypt over to destruction, and the land becomes desolate with all its fullness, and when I disperse all who dwell in it.

verses.text: There is a lamentation, and you shall mourn over Pharaoh.
parts: There is a lamentation, and you shall mourn over Pharaoh.

verses.text: Again in the first month of the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, lament over the strength of Egypt, for the nations will cast down her daughters dead into the depth of the earth, to those who go down into the pit.
parts: Again in the first month of the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, lament over the strength of Egypt, for the nations will cast down her daughters dead into the depth of the earth, to those who go down into the pit.

verses.text: “Son of man, lament over the strength of Egypt, for the nations will cast down her daughters dead into the depth of the earth, to those who go down into the pit.
parts: “Son of man, lament over the strength of Egypt, for the nations will cast down her daughters dead into the depth of the earth, to those who go down into the pit.

verses.text: They shall fall with him among those slain by the sword, and all his strength will sleep in death.
parts: They shall fall with him among those slain by the sword, and all his strength will sleep in death.

verses.text: ‘Be in the depth of the pit, for to whom are you superior?
parts: ‘Be in the depth of the pit, for to whom are you superior?

verses.text: “Assyria is there and all its company, and all the slain were put there.
parts: “Assyria is there and all its company, and all the slain were put there.

verses.text: All the slain who fell by the sword are those who caused their fear to be upon the land of the living.
parts: All the slain who fell by the sword are those who caused their fear to be upon the land of the living.

verses.text: “There is Elam and all his army all around his grave, and all the slain who fell by the sword, and the uncircumcised who went down into the depth of the earth, and who caused their terror to be in the land of the living.
parts: “There is Elam and all his army all around his grave, and all the slain who fell by the sword, and the uncircumcised who went down into the depth of the earth, and who caused their terror to be in the land of the living.

verses.text: “Meshech and Tubal and all their strength were put there around about his grave.
parts: “Meshech and Tubal and all their strength were put there around about his grave.

verses.text: They sleep in death with the mighty men who fell of old, who went down to Hades with their weapons of war.
parts: They sleep in death with the mighty men who fell of old, who went down to Hades with their weapons of war.

verses.text: Their swords were put under their heads, but their lawlessness was placed on their bones, because they terrified the mighty men in the land of the living.
parts: Their swords were put under their heads, but their lawlessness was placed on their bones, because they terrified the mighty men in the land of the living.

verses.text: As for you, you will sleep in death among the uncircumcised, with those slain by the sword.
parts: As for you, you will sleep in death among the uncircumcised, with those slain by the sword.

verses.text: “There are the rulers of Assyria who yielded his strength to a wound of the sword.
parts: “There are the rulers of Assyria who yielded his strength to a wound of the sword.

verses.text: They sleep in death with the slain, with those who go down into the pit.
parts: They sleep in death with the slain, with those who go down into the pit.

verses.text: There are the rulers of the north, all the commanders of Assyria, who, with their terror and their strength, go down slain into the pit.
parts: There are the rulers of the north, all the commanders of Assyria, who, with their terror and their strength, go down slain into the pit.

verses.text: “King Pharaoh will see them, and be comforted over all their strength,” says the Lord and Master.
parts: “King Pharaoh will see them, and be comforted over all their strength,” says the Lord and Master.

verses.text: “For I caused his fear to be in the land of the living; but he shall sleep in death among the uncircumcised, with those slain by the sword, even Pharaoh and all his multitude,” says the Lord and Master.
parts: “For I caused his fear to be in the land of the living; but he shall sleep in death among the uncircumcised, with those slain by the sword, even Pharaoh and all his multitude,” says the Lord and Master.

headers: The Nations Go Down to Hades

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, speak to the sons of your people, and you will say to them, ‘On whatever land I bring the sword, take one man from among the people of the land and make him their watchman.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, speak to the sons of your people, and you will say to them, ‘On whatever land I bring the sword, take one man from among the people of the land and make him their watchman.

verses.text: When he sees the sword coming upon the land, he shall blow the trumpet and warn the people.
parts: When he sees the sword coming upon the land, he shall blow the trumpet and warn the people.

verses.text: Then whoever hears the sound of the trumpet but does not take warning, and the sword comes and takes him away, his blood shall be on his own head.
parts: Then whoever hears the sound of the trumpet but does not take warning, and the sword comes and takes him away, his blood shall be on his own head.

verses.text: For he heard the sound of the trumpet, but did not take warning.
parts: For he heard the sound of the trumpet, but did not take warning.

verses.text: But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the trumpet, and the people are not warned, and the sword comes and takes any person from among them, he is taken away in his transgressions; but his blood I shall require at the watchman's hand.’
parts: But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the trumpet, and the people are not warned, and the sword comes and takes any person from among them, he is taken away in his transgressions; but his blood I shall require at the watchman's hand.’

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, I made you a watchman for the house of Israel, and you shall hear a word from My mouth.
parts: “As for you, son of man, I made you a watchman for the house of Israel, and you shall hear a word from My mouth.

verses.text: When I say to the sinner, ‘You will surely die,’ and you do not speak to warn the ungodly man to change his way, that lawless man will die in his lawlessness; but his blood I shall require at your hand.
parts: When I say to the sinner, ‘You will surely die,’ and you do not speak to warn the ungodly man to change his way, that lawless man will die in his lawlessness; but his blood I shall require at your hand.

verses.text: But if you warn the ungodly man to turn from his way, and he does not turn from his way, he will die in his ungodliness; but you have delivered your own soul.
parts: But if you warn the ungodly man to turn from his way, and he does not turn from his way, he will die in his ungodliness; but you have delivered your own soul.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus you spoke, saying, “Our errors and our lawlessness are upon us, and we waste away in them.
parts: “As for you, son of man, say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus you spoke, saying, “Our errors and our lawlessness are upon us, and we waste away in them.

verses.text: Say to them, ‘As I live, thus says the Lord: “I do not will the death of the ungodly man.
parts: Say to them, ‘As I live, thus says the Lord: “I do not will the death of the ungodly man.

verses.text: “Say to the sons of your people, ‘The righteousness of a righteous man will not deliver him in the day he goes astray.
parts: “Say to the sons of your people, ‘The righteousness of a righteous man will not deliver him in the day he goes astray.

verses.text: When I say regarding the righteous man, this man puts his trust in his righteousness but commits lawlessness, then none of his righteousness will be remembered, for he shall die in the wrongdoing he commits.
parts: When I say regarding the righteous man, this man puts his trust in his righteousness but commits lawlessness, then none of his righteousness will be remembered, for he shall die in the wrongdoing he commits.

verses.text: Again when I say to the ungodly man, “You will surely die,” and he turns from his sin, does judgment and righteousness,
parts: Again when I say to the ungodly man, “You will surely die,” and he turns from his sin, does judgment and righteousness,

verses.text: restores the pledge, gives back what he has stolen, and walks in the ordinances of life without committing wrongdoing, he will surely live.
parts: restores the pledge, gives back what he has stolen, and walks in the ordinances of life without committing wrongdoing, he will surely live.

verses.text: None of his sins he committed will be remembered, for he does judgment and righteousness.
parts: None of his sins he committed will be remembered, for he does judgment and righteousness.

verses.text: “Yet the sons of your people will say, ‘The way of the Lord is not upright.’ But it is their way that is not upright.
parts: “Yet the sons of your people will say, ‘The way of the Lord is not upright.’ But it is their way that is not upright.

verses.text: When the righteous turns from his righteousness and commits lawlessness, he will die because of it.
parts: When the righteous turns from his righteousness and commits lawlessness, he will die because of it.

verses.text: But when the sinner turns from his lawlessness and does judgment and righteousness, he shall live because of it.
parts: But when the sinner turns from his lawlessness and does judgment and righteousness, he shall live because of it.

verses.text: Yet this is what you say, ‘The way of the Lord is not upright.’ O house of Israel, I shall judge every one of you according to his ways.”
parts: Yet this is what you say, ‘The way of the Lord is not upright.’ O house of Israel, I shall judge every one of you according to his ways.”

verses.text: Again it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the twelfth month, on the fifth day of the month, that one who escaped from Jerusalem came to me, saying, “The city is taken.” Then the hand of the Lord came upon me the evening before the man came, and opened my mouth.
parts: Again it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the twelfth month, on the fifth day of the month, that one who escaped from Jerusalem came to me, saying, “The city is taken.”
Then the hand of the Lord came upon me the evening before the man came, and opened my mouth.

verses.text: Then the hand of the Lord came upon me the evening before the man came, and opened my mouth.
parts: Then the hand of the Lord came upon me the evening before the man came, and opened my mouth.

verses.text: Thus the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
parts: Thus the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

verses.text: “Son of man, those who inhabit the desolate places in the land of Israel say, ‘Abraham was one man, and he inherited the land.
parts: “Son of man, those who inhabit the desolate places in the land of Israel say, ‘Abraham was one man, and he inherited the land.

verses.text: Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “As I live, truly those in the desolate places shall fall by the sword, and those in the open plain shall be given to the wild animals as food; and those in the strongholds and caves I will surely kill.
parts: Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “As I live, truly those in the desolate places shall fall by the sword, and those in the open plain shall be given to the wild animals as food; and those in the strongholds and caves I will surely kill.

verses.text: For I shall make the land a desert, and the insolence of her strength will perish; and the mountains of Israel will be desolate by reason of no one passing through.
parts: For I shall make the land a desert, and the insolence of her strength will perish; and the mountains of Israel will be desolate by reason of no one passing through.

verses.text: Then they will know that I am the Lord.
parts: Then they will know that I am the Lord.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, the sons of your people are talking about you by the walls and at the gateways of the houses.
parts: “As for you, son of man, the sons of your people are talking about you by the walls and at the gateways of the houses.

verses.text: So they come together before you as people do, and they sit before you to hear your words, but they will not do them, because a lie is in their mouth, and their heart pursues their own defilements.
parts: So they come together before you as people do, and they sit before you to hear your words, but they will not do them, because a lie is in their mouth, and their heart pursues their own defilements.

verses.text: For you are to them as a sweet, well-tuned song, and they will hear your words, but will not do them.
parts: For you are to them as a sweet, well-tuned song, and they will hear your words, but will not do them.

verses.text: So when it comes to pass, they will say, ‘Behold, it has come.’ Then they will know a prophet was among them.”
parts: So when it comes to pass, they will say, ‘Behold, it has come.’ Then they will know a prophet was among them.”

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel; prophesy and say to the shepherds, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “O shepherds of Israel who feed themselves, should not the shepherds feed the sheep?
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

“Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel; prophesy and say to the shepherds, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “O shepherds of Israel who feed themselves, should not the shepherds feed the sheep?

verses.text: Behold, you drink the milk and clothe yourselves with the wool.
parts: Behold, you drink the milk and clothe yourselves with the wool.

verses.text: You have not strengthened the weak, and the sick you have not revived.
parts: You have not strengthened the weak, and the sick you have not revived.

verses.text: So My sheep were scattered, because there were no shepherds.
parts: So My sheep were scattered, because there were no shepherds.

verses.text: My sheep were scattered in all the mountains and on every high hill.
parts: My sheep were scattered in all the mountains and on every high hill.

verses.text: ‘Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord.
parts: ‘Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord.

verses.text: “As I live,” says the Lord and Master, “because My sheep became as plunder, and as food for all the wild animals of the plain, because there were no shepherds with them, nor did My shepherds search for My sheep, but fed themselves and not My flock”—
parts: “As I live,” says the Lord and Master, “because My sheep became as plunder, and as food for all the wild animals of the plain, because there were no shepherds with them, nor did My shepherds search for My sheep, but fed themselves and not My flock”—

verses.text: because of this, O shepherds,
parts: because of this, O shepherds,

verses.text: thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I am against the shepherds, and shall require My sheep at their hands.
parts: thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I am against the shepherds, and shall require My sheep at their hands.

verses.text: ‘For thus says the Lord: “Behold, I shall search for My sheep and care for them. As a shepherd seeks his flock on a day when there is darkness, and when a cloud separates the sheep, thus I will drive them from every place where they were scattered in the day of cloud and darkness.
parts: ‘For thus says the Lord: “Behold, I shall search for My sheep and care for them.

As a shepherd seeks his flock on a day when there is darkness, and when a cloud separates the sheep, thus I will drive them from every place where they were scattered in the day of cloud and darkness.

verses.text: As a shepherd seeks his flock on a day when there is darkness, and when a cloud separates the sheep, thus I will drive them from every place where they were scattered in the day of cloud and darkness.
parts: As a shepherd seeks his flock on a day when there is darkness, and when a cloud separates the sheep, thus I will drive them from every place where they were scattered in the day of cloud and darkness.

verses.text: And I shall bring them out from the Gentiles, gather them from the countries, and bring them into their land.
parts: And I shall bring them out from the Gentiles, gather them from the countries, and bring them into their land.

verses.text: I shall feed them in good pasture and on the high mountain of Israel, and their folds will be there.
parts: I shall feed them in good pasture and on the high mountain of Israel, and their folds will be there.

verses.text: I shall feed My sheep and refresh them; and they will know that I am the Lord,” thus says the Lord and Master.
parts: I shall feed My sheep and refresh them; and they will know that I am the Lord,” thus says the Lord and Master.

verses.text: “I shall seek the lost, bring back the misled, bind up the broken, strengthen the fallen, protect the strong, and feed them with judgment.”
parts: “I shall seek the lost, bring back the misled, bind up the broken, strengthen the fallen, protect the strong, and feed them with judgment.”

verses.text: ‘So as for you, My sheep, thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I will distinguish between sheep and sheep and between rams and goats. Is it not enough for you that you grazed on the good pasture, that you trampled down the rest of your pasture with your feet, that you drank the clear water, but muddied the rest with your feet?
parts: ‘So as for you, My sheep, thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I will distinguish between sheep and sheep and between rams and goats.
Is it not enough for you that you grazed on the good pasture, that you trampled down the rest of your pasture with your feet, that you drank the clear water, but muddied the rest with your feet?

verses.text: Is it not enough for you that you grazed on the good pasture, that you trampled down the rest of your pasture with your feet, that you drank the clear water, but muddied the rest with your feet?
parts: Is it not enough for you that you grazed on the good pasture, that you trampled down the rest of your pasture with your feet, that you drank the clear water, but muddied the rest with your feet?

verses.text: Thus My sheep grazed on what you trampled with your feet, and drank what you muddied with your feet.”
parts: Thus My sheep grazed on what you trampled with your feet, and drank what you muddied with your feet.”

verses.text: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I shall distinguish between the strong sheep and the weak sheep.
parts: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I shall distinguish between the strong sheep and the weak sheep.

verses.text: Because you pushed with side and shoulder, butted all the weak ones with your horns, and greatly distressed the weak;
parts: Because you pushed with side and shoulder, butted all the weak ones with your horns, and greatly distressed the weak;

verses.text: therefore, I will save My sheep, and they will not be as plunder anymore; and I shall judge between one ram and another.
parts: therefore, I will save My sheep, and they will not be as plunder anymore; and I shall judge between one ram and another.

verses.text: I shall raise up one Shepherd over them, and He will tend them, even My Servant David.
parts: I shall raise up one Shepherd over them, and He will tend them, even My Servant David.

verses.text: and I, the Lord, will be their God; and David will be the Ruler in their midst.
parts: and I, the Lord, will be their God; and David will be the Ruler in their midst.

verses.text: “I will also make a covenant of peace with David, and utterly destroy the evil wild animals from the land.
parts: “I will also make a covenant of peace with David, and utterly destroy the evil wild animals from the land.

verses.text: I will settle them round about my mountain and will give you rain, the rain of blessing.
parts: I will settle them round about my mountain and will give you rain, the rain of blessing.

verses.text: The trees of the plain will also produce their fruit, and the earth shall produce her strength.
parts: The trees of the plain will also produce their fruit, and the earth shall produce her strength.

verses.text: They shall no longer be as plunder for the nations, nor will the wild animals devour them; but they will dwell in hope, and no one shall make them afraid.
parts: They shall no longer be as plunder for the nations, nor will the wild animals devour them; but they will dwell in hope, and no one shall make them afraid.

verses.text: I will raise up for them a garden of peace, and they shall no longer perish with hunger, nor bear the insults of the nations.
parts: I will raise up for them a garden of peace, and they shall no longer perish with hunger, nor bear the insults of the nations.

verses.text: Then they will know that I am the Lord their God, and they are My people, O house of Israel,” says the Lord.
parts: Then they will know that I am the Lord their God, and they are My people, O house of Israel,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “You are My sheep and the sheep of My pasture, and I am the Lord your God,” says the Lord and Master.’ ”
parts: “You are My sheep and the sheep of My pasture, and I am the Lord your God,” says the Lord and Master.’ ”

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, set your face against Mount Seir and prophesy against it, and say to it, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, O Mount Seir, I am against you, and I will stretch out My hand against you.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

“Son of man, set your face against Mount Seir and prophesy against it, and say to it, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, O Mount Seir, I am against you, and I will stretch out My hand against you.

verses.text: I will also cause desolation in your cities, and you shall be desolate.
parts: I will also cause desolation in your cities, and you shall be desolate.

verses.text: Because you have an eternal hatred for the house of Israel, and laid in wait deceitfully with sword in hand as enemies, in a time of wrongdoing to the extreme;
parts: Because you have an eternal hatred for the house of Israel, and laid in wait deceitfully with sword in hand as enemies, in a time of wrongdoing to the extreme;

verses.text: therefore, as I live,” says the Lord and Master, “truly you sinned even to blood, thus blood shall pursue you.
parts: therefore, as I live,” says the Lord and Master, “truly you sinned even to blood, thus blood shall pursue you.

verses.text: I will cause Mount Seir to become a desert and a desolate place, and destroy man and cattle from it.
parts: I will cause Mount Seir to become a desert and a desolate place, and destroy man and cattle from it.

verses.text: I will fill your hills and valleys with your slain, and in all your plains and among you the slain shall fall by the sword.
parts: I will fill your hills and valleys with your slain, and in all your plains and among you the slain shall fall by the sword.

verses.text: I will make you an eternal desolation, and your cities will be inhabited no more.
parts: I will make you an eternal desolation, and your cities will be inhabited no more.

verses.text: “Because you said, ‘The two nations and the two countries shall be mine, and I shall inherit them,’ though the Lord is there; therefore, as I live,” says the Lord, “I will deal with you according to your enmity, and I will be made known to you when I judge you.
parts: “Because you said, ‘The two nations and the two countries shall be mine, and I shall inherit them,’ though the Lord is there; therefore, as I live,” says the Lord, “I will deal with you according to your enmity, and I will be made known to you when I judge you.

verses.text: therefore, as I live,” says the Lord, “I will deal with you according to your enmity, and I will be made known to you when I judge you.
parts: therefore, as I live,” says the Lord, “I will deal with you according to your enmity, and I will be made known to you when I judge you.

verses.text: Then you will know that I am the Lord.
parts: Then you will know that I am the Lord.

verses.text: You boasted against Me with your mouth, and I heard it.”
parts: You boasted against Me with your mouth, and I heard it.”

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “When all the earth is in gladness, I will make you a desert.
parts: Thus says the Lord: “When all the earth is in gladness, I will make you a desert.

verses.text: You will be a desert, O Mount Seir, and all of Edom will be utterly destroyed.
parts: You will be a desert, O Mount Seir, and all of Edom will be utterly destroyed.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, prophesy over the mountains of Israel, and say to the mountains of Israel, ‘Hear the word of the Lord. Thus says the Lord and Master: “Because the enemy said against you, ‘Good, well done!
parts: “As for you, son of man, prophesy over the mountains of Israel, and say to the mountains of Israel, ‘Hear the word of the Lord.
Thus says the Lord and Master: “Because the enemy said against you, ‘Good, well done!

verses.text: therefore, prophesy, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Because you were dishonored and hated by those all around you, so as to be a possession for the rest of the nations, and because you became a byword and were disgraced by the nations”—
parts: therefore, prophesy, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Because you were dishonored and hated by those all around you, so as to be a possession for the rest of the nations, and because you became a byword and were disgraced by the nations”—

verses.text: therefore, O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord!
parts: therefore, O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord!

verses.text: therefore, thus says the Lord and Master: “Certainly in the fire of My anger, I have spoken against the rest of the nations and against all of Edom, because they gave My land to themselves as a possession with gladness, when they treated souls shamefully, so as to destroy them by plunder.’ ”
parts: therefore, thus says the Lord and Master: “Certainly in the fire of My anger, I have spoken against the rest of the nations and against all of Edom, because they gave My land to themselves as a possession with gladness, when they treated souls shamefully, so as to destroy them by plunder.’ ”

verses.text: Therefore prophesy over the land of Israel, and say to the mountains, the hills, the valleys, and the wooded vales, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I have spoken in My jealousy and My anger, because you have borne the insults of the nations.
parts: Therefore prophesy over the land of Israel, and say to the mountains, the hills, the valleys, and the wooded vales, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I have spoken in My jealousy and My anger, because you have borne the insults of the nations.

verses.text: Therefore I shall raise My hand against the nations around you, and they will bear their disgrace.
parts: Therefore I shall raise My hand against the nations around you, and they will bear their disgrace.

verses.text: “But My people will eat your grapes and fruit, O mountains of Israel, for they are drawing near to this time to come. For behold, I am for you, and I will have regard for you, and you shall be tilled and sown.
parts: “But My people will eat your grapes and fruit, O mountains of Israel, for they are drawing near to this time to come.
For behold, I am for you, and I will have regard for you, and you shall be tilled and sown.

verses.text: For behold, I am for you, and I will have regard for you, and you shall be tilled and sown.
parts: For behold, I am for you, and I will have regard for you, and you shall be tilled and sown.

verses.text: I shall multiply people upon you, upon all the house of Israel to the end.
parts: I shall multiply people upon you, upon all the house of Israel to the end.

verses.text: I shall multiply people and cattle upon you, and they will increase and bear young.
parts: I shall multiply people and cattle upon you, and they will increase and bear young.

verses.text: Thus I will beget people upon you, My people Israel, and they shall inherit you.
parts: Thus I will beget people upon you, My people Israel, and they shall inherit you.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord and Master: “Because they say to you, ‘You devour people, O land, and thus you are bereaved of your nation’;
parts: Thus says the Lord and Master: “Because they say to you, ‘You devour people, O land, and thus you are bereaved of your nation’;

verses.text: therefore, you shall no longer devour people, nor be bereaved of your nation anymore,” says the Lord and Master.
parts: therefore, you shall no longer devour people, nor be bereaved of your nation anymore,” says the Lord and Master.

verses.text: “No longer will the disgrace of the nations be heard among you, nor shall you bear the insults of the peoples anymore,” says the Lord and Master.’ ”
parts: “No longer will the disgrace of the nations be heard among you, nor shall you bear the insults of the peoples anymore,” says the Lord and Master.’ ”

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, the house of Israel dwelt upon their land, but they defiled it by their conduct and by their idols and uncleanness.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
“Son of man, the house of Israel dwelt upon their land, but they defiled it by their conduct and by their idols and uncleanness.

verses.text: “Son of man, the house of Israel dwelt upon their land, but they defiled it by their conduct and by their idols and uncleanness.
parts: “Son of man, the house of Israel dwelt upon their land, but they defiled it by their conduct and by their idols and uncleanness.

verses.text: Therefore I poured out My anger on them.
parts: Therefore I poured out My anger on them.

verses.text: I scattered them among the nations and dispersed them as chaff into the countries.
parts: I scattered them among the nations and dispersed them as chaff into the countries.

verses.text: So when they came to the nations, wherever they went, they desecrated My holy name when they said, ‘These are the people of the Lord, and they have come out of His land.’
parts: So when they came to the nations, wherever they went, they desecrated My holy name when they said, ‘These are the people of the Lord, and they have come out of His land.’

verses.text: But I spared them for the sake of My holy name, which the house of Israel desecrated among the nations wherever they went.
parts: But I spared them for the sake of My holy name, which the house of Israel desecrated among the nations wherever they went.

verses.text: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord: “I will not do this for your sake, O house of Israel, but for the sake of My holy name, which you desecrated among the nations wherever you went.
parts: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord: “I will not do this for your sake, O house of Israel, but for the sake of My holy name, which you desecrated among the nations wherever you went.

verses.text: Thus I will sanctify My great name, desecrated among the nations, which you desecrated in their midst.
parts: Thus I will sanctify My great name, desecrated among the nations, which you desecrated in their midst.

verses.text: For I will take you from among the nations, gather you from all the lands, and bring you into your land.
parts: For I will take you from among the nations, gather you from all the lands, and bring you into your land.

verses.text: I shall sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be cleansed from all your uncleanness, and I will also cleanse you from all your idols.
parts: I shall sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be cleansed from all your uncleanness, and I will also cleanse you from all your idols.

verses.text: I shall give you a new heart and put a new spirit within you.
parts: I shall give you a new heart and put a new spirit within you.

verses.text: I shall put My Spirit within you and cause you to walk in My requirements, and you will keep My judgments and do them.
parts: I shall put My Spirit within you and cause you to walk in My requirements, and you will keep My judgments and do them.

verses.text: You will dwell in the land I gave to your fathers.
parts: You will dwell in the land I gave to your fathers.

verses.text: I shall save you from all your uncleanness; and I will call for the grain and multiply it, and bring no famine upon you.
parts: I shall save you from all your uncleanness; and I will call for the grain and multiply it, and bring no famine upon you.

verses.text: I shall multiply the fruit of your trees and the produce of your fields, that you need never again bear the disgrace of famine among the nations.
parts: I shall multiply the fruit of your trees and the produce of your fields, that you need never again bear the disgrace of famine among the nations.

verses.text: Then you will remember your evil ways and your practices which were not good, and you shall be angry in your own sight for your lawlessness and your abominations.
parts: Then you will remember your evil ways and your practices which were not good, and you shall be angry in your own sight for your lawlessness and your abominations.

verses.text: Not for your sake will I do this,” says the Lord and Master.
parts: Not for your sake will I do this,” says the Lord and Master.

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord: “On the day in which I shall cleanse you from all your lawlessness, I shall also cause you to dwell in the cities, and the uninhabited regions will be rebuilt.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord: “On the day in which I shall cleanse you from all your lawlessness, I shall also cause you to dwell in the cities, and the uninhabited regions will be rebuilt.

verses.text: The land which was destroyed will be cultivated, because it will no longer be desolate in the sight of all who pass by.
parts: The land which was destroyed will be cultivated, because it will no longer be desolate in the sight of all who pass by.

verses.text: Thus they will say, ‘That desolate land has become like a garden of luxury; and the wasted, desolate, and ruined cities are now fortified and inhabited.’
parts: Thus they will say, ‘That desolate land has become like a garden of luxury; and the wasted, desolate, and ruined cities are now fortified and inhabited.’

verses.text: Then the nations yet remaining around you will know that I, the Lord, have rebuilt the ruined cities and planted what was desolate.
parts: Then the nations yet remaining around you will know that I, the Lord, have rebuilt the ruined cities and planted what was desolate.

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord: “For this I shall be sought by the house of Israel, that I might establish and multiply their people like sheep.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord: “For this I shall be sought by the house of Israel, that I might establish and multiply their people like sheep.

verses.text: As holy sheep, as the sheep of Jerusalem in her feasts, thus shall the desert cities be filled with flocks of people.
parts: As holy sheep, as the sheep of Jerusalem in her feasts, thus shall the desert cities be filled with flocks of people.

verses.text: Again the hand of the Lord came upon me, and brought me by the Spirit of the Lord, and set me in the midst of the plain, which was full of human bones. So He led me round about them, and behold, there was a great multitude of bones on the face of the plain.
parts: Again the hand of the Lord came upon me, and brought me by the Spirit of the Lord, and set me in the midst of the plain, which was full of human bones.
So He led me round about them, and behold, there was a great multitude of bones on the face of the plain.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” So I answered, “O Lord, You know this.”
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” So I answered, “O Lord, You know this.”

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Prophesy to these bones and say to them, ‘O dry bones, hear the word of the Lord.
parts: Then He said to me, “Prophesy to these bones and say to them, ‘O dry bones, hear the word of the Lord.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord to these bones: “Behold, I will bring the Spirit of life upon you.
parts: Thus says the Lord to these bones: “Behold, I will bring the Spirit of life upon you.

verses.text: I will put muscles on you and bring flesh upon you.
parts: I will put muscles on you and bring flesh upon you.

verses.text: So I prophesied as He commanded me, and it came to pass while I prophesied that, behold, there was a shaking, and the bones came together, each one to its joint.
parts: So I prophesied as He commanded me, and it came to pass while I prophesied that, behold, there was a shaking, and the bones came together, each one to its joint.

verses.text: So I looked, and behold, muscle and flesh grew upon them, and skin covered them over; but no breath was in them.
parts: So I looked, and behold, muscle and flesh grew upon them, and skin covered them over; but no breath was in them.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Prophesy to the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Come from the four winds and breathe upon these dead men; and let them live.” ’ ”
parts: Then He said to me, “Prophesy to the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Come from the four winds and breathe upon these dead men; and let them live.” ’ ”

verses.text: So I prophesied as He commanded me, and the Spirit entered into them; and they lived and stood upon their feet, an exceedingly great assembly.
parts: So I prophesied as He commanded me, and the Spirit entered into them; and they lived and stood upon their feet, an exceedingly great assembly.

verses.text: Again the Lord spoke to me, saying, “Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel.
parts: Again the Lord spoke to me, saying, “Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel.

verses.text: Therefore prophesy and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will open your tombs, bring you up from your graves, and bring you into the land of Israel.
parts: Therefore prophesy and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will open your tombs, bring you up from your graves, and bring you into the land of Israel.

verses.text: Then you will know that I am the Lord, when I open your tombs to lead you, My people, up from their graves.
parts: Then you will know that I am the Lord, when I open your tombs to lead you, My people, up from their graves.

verses.text: I will put My Spirit in you, and you will live; and I will place you in your own land.
parts: I will put My Spirit in you, and you will live; and I will place you in your own land.

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “As for you, son of man, take a rod for yourself and write on it, ‘Judah and the sons of Israel devoted to him.’ Then take a second rod for yourself and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the rod of Ephraim, and all the sons of Israel added to him.’ Then you shall join them to one another for yourself so as to form one rod, and they shall be in your hand.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
