“As for you, son of man, take a rod for yourself and write on it, ‘Judah and the sons of Israel devoted to him.’ Then take a second rod for yourself and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the rod of Ephraim, and all the sons of Israel added to him.’ Then you shall join them to one another for yourself so as to form one rod, and they shall be in your hand.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, take a rod for yourself and write on it, ‘Judah and the sons of Israel devoted to him.’ Then take a second rod for yourself and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the rod of Ephraim, and all the sons of Israel added to him.’
parts: “As for you, son of man, take a rod for yourself and write on it, ‘Judah and the sons of Israel devoted to him.’ Then take a second rod for yourself and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the rod of Ephraim, and all the sons of Israel added to him.’

verses.text: Then you shall join them to one another for yourself so as to form one rod, and they shall be in your hand.
parts: Then you shall join them to one another for yourself so as to form one rod, and they shall be in your hand.

verses.text: “So it shall be, when the sons of your people speak to you, saying, ‘Will you not tell us what you mean by these?’— then you will say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will take the tribe of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel, who are added to him, and I will give them to the tribe of Judah.
parts: “So it shall be, when the sons of your people speak to you, saying, ‘Will you not tell us what you mean by these?’— then you will say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will take the tribe of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel, who are added to him, and I will give them to the tribe of Judah.

verses.text: then you will say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will take the tribe of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel, who are added to him, and I will give them to the tribe of Judah.
parts: then you will say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will take the tribe of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel, who are added to him, and I will give them to the tribe of Judah.

verses.text: The rods on which you write will be in your hand before their eyes.
parts: The rods on which you write will be in your hand before their eyes.

verses.text: Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I will take the whole house of Israel from the midst of the nations where they went, and will gather them from every side, to bring them into the land of Israel.
parts: Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I will take the whole house of Israel from the midst of the nations where they went, and will gather them from every side, to bring them into the land of Israel.

verses.text: I shall make them one nation in My land, even on the mountains of Israel, and there will be one Ruler over them.
parts: I shall make them one nation in My land, even on the mountains of Israel, and there will be one Ruler over them.

verses.text: so as to defile themselves with their idols.
parts: so as to defile themselves with their idols.

verses.text: “My Servant David shall be the Ruler among them, and there will be one Shepherd of them all; for they will walk in My ordinances and observe My judgments, and do them.
parts: “My Servant David shall be the Ruler among them, and there will be one Shepherd of them all; for they will walk in My ordinances and observe My judgments, and do them.

verses.text: Then they will dwell in their land which I gave Jacob My servant, where their fathers dwelt; and they will dwell upon it, and My servant David shall be their Ruler forever.
parts: Then they will dwell in their land which I gave Jacob My servant, where their fathers dwelt; and they will dwell upon it, and My servant David shall be their Ruler forever.

verses.text: I will make a covenant of peace with them.
parts: I will make a covenant of peace with them.

verses.text: My tabernacle shall be among them; and I will be their God, and they shall be My people.
parts: My tabernacle shall be among them; and I will be their God, and they shall be My people.

verses.text: Then the nations will know that I am the Lord who sanctifies them, when My sanctuary is among them forever.” ’ ”
parts: Then the nations will know that I am the Lord who sanctifies them, when My sanctuary is among them forever.” ’ ”

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Son of man, set your face against Gog and the land of Magog, the ruler of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal, and prophesy against him, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I am against you, O Gog, the ruler of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal.
parts: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

“Son of man, set your face against Gog and the land of Magog, the ruler of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal, and prophesy against him, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “Behold, I am against you, O Gog, the ruler of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal.

verses.text: I shall gather you and all your army—horses and horsemen, all armed with breastplates, and a large assembly with shields, helmets, and swords—
parts: I shall gather you and all your army—horses and horsemen, all armed with breastplates, and a large assembly with shields, helmets, and swords—

verses.text: along with Persians, Ethiopians, and Libyans with shields and helmets,
parts: along with Persians, Ethiopians, and Libyans with shields and helmets,

verses.text: and also Gomer and all belonging to him, and the house of Togarmah from the far north and all belonging to him, and many nations with you.
parts: and also Gomer and all belonging to him, and the house of Togarmah from the far north and all belonging to him, and many nations with you.

verses.text: “Be prepared; prepare yourself and all your gathering assembled with you; and you will be as an advance guard for Me.
parts: “Be prepared; prepare yourself and all your gathering assembled with you; and you will be as an advance guard for Me.

verses.text: He will be prepared after many days, and will come in the last years.
parts: He will be prepared after many days, and will come in the last years.

verses.text: You shall arrive like rain, like a cloud to cover the land, you and all your army and the many nations with you.”
parts: You shall arrive like rain, like a cloud to cover the land, you and all your army and the many nations with you.”

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “In that day it shall also come to pass that words will arise in your heart, and you will think evil thoughts.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord and Master: “In that day it shall also come to pass that words will arise in your heart, and you will think evil thoughts.

verses.text: For you will say, ‘I will go up to the rejected land.
parts: For you will say, ‘I will go up to the rejected land.

verses.text: to plunder them and take spoils.’ I will turn your hand against a nation gathered from many nations, which acquired possessions and inhabitants in the midst of the land.
parts: to plunder them and take spoils.’ I will turn your hand against a nation gathered from many nations, which acquired possessions and inhabitants in the midst of the land.

verses.text: Sheba, Dedan, and Carthaginian merchants and all their villages shall say to you, ‘You come for plunder, to capture a prey and take spoils.
parts: Sheba, Dedan, and Carthaginian merchants and all their villages shall say to you, ‘You come for plunder, to capture a prey and take spoils.

verses.text: “Therefore, son of man, prophesy and say to Gog, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Will you not arise in that day, the day My people Israel dwell in peace?
parts: “Therefore, son of man, prophesy and say to Gog, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Will you not arise in that day, the day My people Israel dwell in peace?

verses.text: Yes, you will come from your place out of the far north, you and the many nations with you, all riding on horses, a great assembly and a mighty army.
parts: Yes, you will come from your place out of the far north, you and the many nations with you, all riding on horses, a great assembly and a mighty army.

verses.text: You will come upon My people Israel like a cloud to cover the land.
parts: You will come upon My people Israel like a cloud to cover the land.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord and Master to Gog, “You are he of whom I spoke in former days by the hand of My servants the prophets of Israel, in those days and years, that I would bring you up against them.
parts: Thus says the Lord and Master to Gog, “You are he of whom I spoke in former days by the hand of My servants the prophets of Israel, in those days and years, that I would bring you up against them.

verses.text: “Thus it shall come to pass in that day, the day Gog comes against the land of Israel,” says the Lord and Master, “that My anger and jealousy shall arise in the fire of My wrath.
parts: “Thus it shall come to pass in that day, the day Gog comes against the land of Israel,” says the Lord and Master, “that My anger and jealousy shall arise in the fire of My wrath.

verses.text: “that My anger and jealousy shall arise in the fire of My wrath.
parts: “that My anger and jealousy shall arise in the fire of My wrath.

verses.text: Even the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the wild animals of the plain, all the reptiles that creep on the ground, and all the people on the face of the land will shake because of the Lord's presence.
parts: Even the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the wild animals of the plain, all the reptiles that creep on the ground, and all the people on the face of the land will shake because of the Lord's presence.

verses.text: I will also summon every fear against Gog,” says the Lord, “for the sword of every man shall be against his brother.
parts: I will also summon every fear against Gog,” says the Lord, “for the sword of every man shall be against his brother.

verses.text: I will judge him with death and bloodshed, and I will send a flooding rain and hailstones, and fire and brimstone against him and everyone with him, and also against the many nations with him.
parts: I will judge him with death and bloodshed, and I will send a flooding rain and hailstones, and fire and brimstone against him and everyone with him, and also against the many nations with him.

verses.text: For I shall be magnified, sanctified, and glorified, and known in the sight of many nations.
parts: For I shall be magnified, sanctified, and glorified, and known in the sight of many nations.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, prophesy against Gog and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against you, O Gog, the ruler of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal.
parts: “As for you, son of man, prophesy against Gog and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am against you, O Gog, the ruler of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal.

verses.text: I will gather and guide you, and raise you up from the far north, and bring you upon the mountains of Israel.
parts: I will gather and guide you, and raise you up from the far north, and bring you upon the mountains of Israel.

verses.text: Then I will destroy the bow in your left hand and the arrows in your right hand; and I will cast you down upon the mountains of Israel.
parts: Then I will destroy the bow in your left hand and the arrows in your right hand; and I will cast you down upon the mountains of Israel.

verses.text: For you and all with you shall fall, and I shall give the nations with you to the multitude of birds, to every fowl.
parts: For you and all with you shall fall, and I shall give the nations with you to the multitude of birds, to every fowl.

verses.text: for you will fall on the face of the open plain, because I have spoken,” says the Lord.
parts: for you will fall on the face of the open plain, because I have spoken,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “I will also send fire upon Gog, and the coastal peoples shall dwell in peace.
parts: “I will also send fire upon Gog, and the coastal peoples shall dwell in peace.

verses.text: and My holy name will be known in the midst of My people Israel; and My holy name will no longer be desecrated.
parts: and My holy name will be known in the midst of My people Israel; and My holy name will no longer be desecrated.

verses.text: Behold, it is coming, and you will know it shall be,” says the Lord and Master.
parts: Behold, it is coming, and you will know it shall be,” says the Lord and Master.

verses.text: Those who dwell in the cities of Israel will also go out and make a fire with the weapons: the shields and spears, the bows and arrows, and the javelins and lances; and they shall keep the fire burning for seven years.
parts: Those who dwell in the cities of Israel will also go out and make a fire with the weapons: the shields and spears, the bows and arrows, and the javelins and lances; and they shall keep the fire burning for seven years.

verses.text: So they will not take any wood from the field, nor cut down any of the forests; rather, they will burn the weapons, and plunder those who plundered them, and despoil those who took spoils from them,” says the Lord.
parts: So they will not take any wood from the field, nor cut down any of the forests; rather, they will burn the weapons, and plunder those who plundered them, and despoil those who took spoils from them,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “In that day it shall come to pass that I will give Gog a place of renown, a monument in Israel, a common burial place of those who come to the sea.
parts: “In that day it shall come to pass that I will give Gog a place of renown, a monument in Israel, a common burial place of those who come to the sea.

verses.text: The house of Israel shall bury them, that the land may be cleansed in the space of seven months.
parts: The house of Israel shall bury them, that the land may be cleansed in the space of seven months.

verses.text: Yes, all the people of the land will bury them, and it shall be a place of renown for them in the day I was magnified,” says the Lord.
parts: Yes, all the people of the land will bury them, and it shall be a place of renown for them in the day I was magnified,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “So they will appoint men continually to pass through the land to bury those bodies yet on the ground, to cleanse it by the end of seven months; and they will seek them out.
parts: “So they will appoint men continually to pass through the land to bury those bodies yet on the ground, to cleanse it by the end of seven months; and they will seek them out.

verses.text: Everyone who passes through the land and sees a man's bone will also set a marker by it, until the grave diggers shall bury it in the Burial Place of Gog.
parts: Everyone who passes through the land and sees a man's bone will also set a marker by it, until the grave diggers shall bury it in the Burial Place of Gog.

verses.text: Indeed, the name of the city shall be Burial Place.
parts: Indeed, the name of the city shall be Burial Place.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Speak to every sort of bird and every wild animal of the field: ‘Assemble yourselves and come; gather together from all sides to My sacrifice which I offered up for you, a great sacrifice on the mountains of Israel, and you will eat meat and drink blood.
parts: “As for you, son of man, say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Speak to every sort of bird and every wild animal of the field: ‘Assemble yourselves and come; gather together from all sides to My sacrifice which I offered up for you, a great sacrifice on the mountains of Israel, and you will eat meat and drink blood.

verses.text: You will eat the flesh of mighty men and drink the blood of the rulers of the earth: the rams, the young bulls, and the male goats; for they are all fatted animals.
parts: You will eat the flesh of mighty men and drink the blood of the rulers of the earth: the rams, the young bulls, and the male goats; for they are all fatted animals.

verses.text: You will eat fat until you are full, and drink wine until you are drunken from My sacrifice which I slaughtered for you.
parts: You will eat fat until you are full, and drink wine until you are drunken from My sacrifice which I slaughtered for you.

verses.text: You will be filled at My table, eating horse and rider, and the mighty man, and every warrior,’ says the Lord.
parts: You will be filled at My table, eating horse and rider, and the mighty man, and every warrior,’ says the Lord.

verses.text: “I will set My glory in your midst, and all the nations will see My judgment which I executed, and My hand which I laid on them.
parts: “I will set My glory in your midst, and all the nations will see My judgment which I executed, and My hand which I laid on them.

verses.text: Then the house of Israel will know that I am the Lord their God from this day forward.
parts: Then the house of Israel will know that I am the Lord their God from this day forward.

verses.text: All the nations will also know that the house of Israel was led into captivity on account of their sins, because they rejected Me.
parts: All the nations will also know that the house of Israel was led into captivity on account of their sins, because they rejected Me.

verses.text: According to their uncleanness and according to their lawless actions I dealt with them, and turned My face away from them.”
parts: According to their uncleanness and according to their lawless actions I dealt with them, and turned My face away from them.”

verses.text: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord and Master: “Now I will turn back the captivity of Jacob and have mercy on the house of Israel; and I will be jealous for the sake of My holy name.
parts: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord and Master: “Now I will turn back the captivity of Jacob and have mercy on the house of Israel; and I will be jealous for the sake of My holy name.

verses.text: They shall bear their dishonor and the wrongdoing they committed when they dwelt upon the land in peace; and there shall be no one to frighten them.
parts: They shall bear their dishonor and the wrongdoing they committed when they dwelt upon the land in peace; and there shall be no one to frighten them.

verses.text: Thus when I bring them back from the nations and gather them from the countries of the nations, I will be sanctified among them in the sight of the nations.
parts: Thus when I bring them back from the nations and gather them from the countries of the nations, I will be sanctified among them in the sight of the nations.

verses.text: Then they will know that I am the Lord their God, when I reveal Myself to them among the nations.
parts: Then they will know that I am the Lord their God, when I reveal Myself to them among the nations.

verses.text: But I will not turn away My face from them anymore, because I poured out My anger on the house of Israel,” says the Lord and Master.’ ”
parts: But I will not turn away My face from them anymore, because I poured out My anger on the house of Israel,” says the Lord and Master.’ ”

headers: Ezekiel's Vision: New City, New Temple

verses.text: Again in the twenty-fifth year of our captivity, in the first month, on the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was captured, on the very same day, the hand of the Lord was upon me.
parts: Again in the twenty-fifth year of our captivity, in the first month, on the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was captured, on the very same day, the hand of the Lord was upon me.

verses.text: He took me in a vision of God into the land of Israel and set me on a very high mountain.
parts: He took me in a vision of God into the land of Israel and set me on a very high mountain.

verses.text: He took me there, and behold, there was a man whose appearance was like the appearance of gleaming bronze.
parts: He took me there, and behold, there was a man whose appearance was like the appearance of gleaming bronze.

verses.text: Then the man said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?
parts: Then the man said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?

verses.text: Now there was a wall around the entire outside of the house.
parts: Now there was a wall around the entire outside of the house.

verses.text: Then he went to the gate which faced east, up seven stairs, and measured across the entrance of the gate, one measuring stick wide.
parts: Then he went to the gate which faced east, up seven stairs, and measured across the entrance of the gate, one measuring stick wide.

verses.text: Each gate chamber was one measuring stick long and one measuring stick wide.
parts: Each gate chamber was one measuring stick long and one measuring stick wide.

verses.text: The third gate chamber was one measuring stick wide and one measuring stick long.
parts: The third gate chamber was one measuring stick wide and one measuring stick long.

verses.text: The neighboring entrance was eight cubits, and the gatepost was two cubits, also the outer entrance of the gate.
parts: The neighboring entrance was eight cubits, and the gatepost was two cubits, also the outer entrance of the gate.

verses.text: The gate chambers were three on one side and three on the other.
parts: The gate chambers were three on one side and three on the other.

verses.text: He measured the width of the entrance to the gate, ten cubits, and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.
parts: He measured the width of the entrance to the gate, ten cubits, and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.

verses.text: The dimensions of the front of the gate chambers were equal, and the gate chambers were six cubits on this side and six cubits on that side.
parts: The dimensions of the front of the gate chambers were equal, and the gate chambers were six cubits on this side and six cubits on that side.

verses.text: Then he measured the gate from the roof of one gate chamber to the roof of the other, and the width was twenty-five cubits, from one gate to the other.
parts: Then he measured the gate from the roof of one gate chamber to the roof of the other, and the width was twenty-five cubits, from one gate to the other.

verses.text: He measured the open inner court of the gate chamber, sixty cubits high, and there were twenty gate chambers all around.
parts: He measured the open inner court of the gate chamber, sixty cubits high, and there were twenty gate chambers all around.

verses.text: From the open court of the gate outside into the open inner court of the gate chamber within was fifty cubits.
parts: From the open court of the gate outside into the open inner court of the gate chamber within was fifty cubits.

verses.text: There were hidden windows in the gate chambers and in their entrances on the inside of the gate all around, and likewise the entrances had hidden windows all around.
parts: There were hidden windows in the gate chambers and in their entrances on the inside of the gate all around, and likewise the entrances had hidden windows all around.

verses.text: Then he brought me into the inner court; and behold, there were temple chambers and pillars all around the court; thirty chambers among the pillars.
parts: Then he brought me into the inner court; and behold, there were temple chambers and pillars all around the court; thirty chambers among the pillars.

verses.text: The porches were behind the gates; corresponding to the same length of the gates was the underlying pillar.
parts: The porches were behind the gates; corresponding to the same length of the gates was the underlying pillar.

verses.text: Then he measured the width of the court, from the open air court of the gate which was to the outside to the open air court of the gate which faces out, a hundred cubits to the court which faces east.
parts: Then he measured the width of the court, from the open air court of the gate which was to the outside to the open air court of the gate which faces out, a hundred cubits to the court which faces east.

verses.text: and behold, there was the gate facing north to the outer court, and he measured its length and its width.
parts: and behold, there was the gate facing north to the outer court, and he measured its length and its width.

verses.text: Its gate chambers, three on this side and three on that side, its gateposts and its porches, and palm trees, and they were the same measurement of the gate which faces to the east: its length was fifty cubits and its width twenty-five cubits.
parts: Its gate chambers, three on this side and three on that side, its gateposts and its porches, and palm trees, and they were the same measurement of the gate which faces to the east: its length was fifty cubits and its width twenty-five cubits.

verses.text: Its windows, its doorposts, and also its palm trees were just like the gate facing east, and it was ascended by seven steps, and the doorpost within.
parts: Its windows, its doorposts, and also its palm trees were just like the gate facing east, and it was ascended by seven steps, and the doorpost within.

verses.text: A gate of the inner court was opposite the northern gate, in the same manner as the eastern gate, and he measured from gate to gate, one hundred cubits.
parts: A gate of the inner court was opposite the northern gate, in the same manner as the eastern gate, and he measured from gate to gate, one hundred cubits.

verses.text: Then he brought me toward the south, and behold, a gate was facing south; and he measured its gate chambers, gateposts, and archways according to these same measurements.
parts: Then he brought me toward the south, and behold, a gate was facing south; and he measured its gate chambers, gateposts, and archways according to these same measurements.

verses.text: There were windows in it and in its archways all around like those windows.
parts: There were windows in it and in its archways all around like those windows.

verses.text: Seven steps led up to it, and its gateposts were within; and it had palm trees on its gateposts, one on this side and one on that side.
parts: Seven steps led up to it, and its gateposts were within; and it had palm trees on its gateposts, one on this side and one on that side.

verses.text: There was also a gate on the inner court, facing south, and he measured from gate to gate toward the south, one hundred cubits, in the southerly direction.
parts: There was also a gate on the inner court, facing south, and he measured from gate to gate toward the south, one hundred cubits, in the southerly direction.

verses.text: Then he brought me to the inner court through the southern gate, and he measured the southern gate according to these same measurements.
parts: Then he brought me to the inner court through the southern gate, and he measured the southern gate according to these same measurements.

verses.text: Also its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways were according to these same measurements, and there were windows in it and in its archways all around.
parts: Also its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways were according to these same measurements, and there were windows in it and in its archways all around.

verses.text: There was the porch into the outer court, and palm trees were on its gatepost, and going up to it were eight steps.
parts: There was the porch into the outer court, and palm trees were on its gatepost, and going up to it were eight steps.

verses.text: Then he brought me to the gate facing east, and he measured it according to these same measurements. Its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways were according to these same measurements.
parts: Then he brought me to the gate facing east, and he measured it according to these same measurements.
Its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways were according to these same measurements.

verses.text: Its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways were according to these same measurements.
parts: Its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways were according to these same measurements.

verses.text: There were porches opening into the inner court, and palm trees were on its gateposts, on this side and on that side; and going up to it were eight steps.
parts: There were porches opening into the inner court, and palm trees were on its gateposts, on this side and on that side; and going up to it were eight steps.

verses.text: Then he brought me to the north gate and measured it according to these same measurements— also its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways.
parts: Then he brought me to the north gate and measured it according to these same measurements— also its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways.

verses.text: also its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways.
parts: also its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways.

verses.text: Its porches were toward the outer court, and there were palm trees on its gateposts, on this side and on that side, and going up to it were eight steps.
parts: Its porches were toward the outer court, and there were palm trees on its gateposts, on this side and on that side, and going up to it were eight steps.

verses.text: There were its chambers and its gateposts at its gate, and a drain for the second gate, so they might slay in it the sin offerings and trespass offerings.
parts: There were its chambers and its gateposts at its gate, and a drain for the second gate, so they might slay in it the sin offerings and trespass offerings.

verses.text: and a drain for the second gate, so they might slay in it the sin offerings and trespass offerings.
parts: and a drain for the second gate, so they might slay in it the sin offerings and trespass offerings.

verses.text: Behind the drain line for the whole burnt offerings of the gate which faces north, there were two tables placed toward the east, and behind the second gate and its gate chamber, there were two tables toward the east.
parts: Behind the drain line for the whole burnt offerings of the gate which faces north, there were two tables placed toward the east, and behind the second gate and its gate chamber, there were two tables toward the east.

verses.text: Four tables were on this side and four tables on that side, and behind the gate, there were eight tables on which they slaughtered the sacrifices.
parts: Four tables were on this side and four tables on that side, and behind the gate, there were eight tables on which they slaughtered the sacrifices.

verses.text: There were also four tables of hewn stone for the whole burnt offerings, two cubits long, one cubit and a half wide, and one cubit high.
parts: There were also four tables of hewn stone for the whole burnt offerings, two cubits long, one cubit and a half wide, and one cubit high.

verses.text: Inside were projections hewn out, a handbreadth wide, all around, and over the tables above, there were little roofs to cover from the rain and the drying wind.
parts: Inside were projections hewn out, a handbreadth wide, all around, and over the tables above, there were little roofs to cover from the rain and the drying wind.

verses.text: Then he led me into the inner court, and behold, there were two halls in the inner court, one behind the gate which faces north and bearing to the south, and the other behind the gate which faces to the south and bearing to the north.
parts: Then he led me into the inner court, and behold, there were two halls in the inner court, one behind the gate which faces north and bearing to the south, and the other behind the gate which faces to the south and bearing to the north.

verses.text: So he said to me, “This hall which faces south is for the priests who have charge of the temple.
parts: So he said to me, “This hall which faces south is for the priests who have charge of the temple.

verses.text: The hall which faces north is for the priests who have charge of the altar.
parts: The hall which faces north is for the priests who have charge of the altar.

verses.text: Then he measured the court, one hundred cubits long and one hundred cubits wide, foursquare.
parts: Then he measured the court, one hundred cubits long and one hundred cubits wide, foursquare.

verses.text: Then he brought me to the entrance chamber of the house and measured the doorpost of the entrance chamber, five cubits on this side and five cubits on that side; and the width of the doorway was fourteen cubits; and the sills of the door to the entrance chamber were three by three on each side.
parts: Then he brought me to the entrance chamber of the house and measured the doorpost of the entrance chamber, five cubits on this side and five cubits on that side; and the width of the doorway was fourteen cubits; and the sills of the door to the entrance chamber were three by three on each side.

verses.text: The length of the entrance chamber was twenty cubits, and the width twelve cubits, and one would ascend it by ten steps; and there were pillars by the entrance chamber, one on this side and another on that side.
parts: The length of the entrance chamber was twenty cubits, and the width twelve cubits, and one would ascend it by ten steps; and there were pillars by the entrance chamber, one on this side and another on that side.

headers: The East Gate of the Temple
A Place for the Sacrifices and the Priests

verses.text: Then he brought me into the temple and measured its entrance, six cubits wide on one side and six cubits wide on the other side. The width of the entryway was ten cubits, and the sills of the gate were five cubits on this side and five cubits on the other side; and he measured its length, forty cubits, and its width, twenty cubits.
parts: Then he brought me into the temple and measured its entrance, six cubits wide on one side and six cubits wide on the other side.

The width of the entryway was ten cubits, and the sills of the gate were five cubits on this side and five cubits on the other side; and he measured its length, forty cubits, and its width, twenty cubits.

verses.text: He also went into the inner court and measured the posts of the doorway, two cubits; and the doorway itself, six cubits high; and the width of the sills, seven cubits.
parts: He also went into the inner court and measured the posts of the doorway, two cubits; and the doorway itself, six cubits high; and the width of the sills, seven cubits.

verses.text: He measured the length of the doors, forty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits, in front of the sanctuary; and he said to me, “This is the holy of holies.”
parts: He measured the length of the doors, forty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits, in front of the sanctuary; and he said to me, “This is the holy of holies.”

verses.text: Next he measured the wall of the house, six cubits.
parts: Next he measured the wall of the house, six cubits.

verses.text: The side chambers were thirty-two in number, each next to the other, and the layout along the wall of the house all around was so one could see that all of them went together, and that nowhere did they touch the walls of the house.
parts: The side chambers were thirty-two in number, each next to the other, and the layout along the wall of the house all around was so one could see that all of them went together, and that nowhere did they touch the walls of the house.

verses.text: As one went up from story to story, the side chambers became wider all around, because their supporting ledges in the wall of the temple ascended like steps; therefore, the width of the structure increased as one went up from the lowest story to the highest, by way of the middle one.
parts: As one went up from story to story, the side chambers became wider all around, because their supporting ledges in the wall of the temple ascended like steps; therefore, the width of the structure increased as one went up from the lowest story to the highest, by way of the middle one.

verses.text: The side chambers of the house all around were of a high layout of sides, equal in measurement to one measuring stick.
parts: The side chambers of the house all around were of a high layout of sides, equal in measurement to one measuring stick.

verses.text: The thickness of the outer wall of the side chambers was five cubits, and the open spaces between the sides of the house
parts: The thickness of the outer wall of the side chambers was five cubits, and the open spaces between the sides of the house

verses.text: and the halls measured twenty cubits in width, all around the sides of the house.
parts: and the halls measured twenty cubits in width, all around the sides of the house.

verses.text: The doors of the halls led to the open space: the one door led north, and the other door led south; and the width of the light of the open space was five cubits in width all around.
parts: The doors of the halls led to the open space: the one door led north, and the other door led south; and the width of the light of the open space was five cubits in width all around.

verses.text: That which made a boundary before the open space, like the edge of the sea, was seventy cubits wide; and the width of the wall which bordered was five cubits all around, and its length ninety cubits.
parts: That which made a boundary before the open space, like the edge of the sea, was seventy cubits wide; and the width of the wall which bordered was five cubits all around, and its length ninety cubits.

verses.text: Then he measured in front of the house, one hundred cubits long, and the open spaces and their boundaries and walls were one hundred cubits long.
parts: Then he measured in front of the house, one hundred cubits long, and the open spaces and their boundaries and walls were one hundred cubits long.

verses.text: Also the width of the face of the house, along with the open spaces before it, was one hundred cubits.
parts: Also the width of the face of the house, along with the open spaces before it, was one hundred cubits.

verses.text: Then he measured the length of the boundary in front separating the open space, with its galleries on the one side and on the other side, one hundred cubits.
parts: Then he measured the length of the boundary in front separating the open space, with its galleries on the one side and on the other side, one hundred cubits.

verses.text: their thresholds and the latticed doors, were set so the narrow openings would give light through narrow openings to all three stories, like that of a fishnet.
parts: their thresholds and the latticed doors, were set so the narrow openings would give light through narrow openings to all three stories, like that of a fishnet.

verses.text: As far as the nearby wall of the inner and outer courts and along upon the wall all around within and without were depicted cherubim and palm trees, between cherub and cherub.
parts: As far as the nearby wall of the inner and outer courts and along upon the wall all around within and without
were depicted cherubim and palm trees, between cherub and cherub.

verses.text: were depicted cherubim and palm trees, between cherub and cherub.
parts: were depicted cherubim and palm trees, between cherub and cherub.

verses.text: the face of a man toward a palm tree on one side, and the face of a lion toward a palm tree on the other side.
parts: the face of a man toward a palm tree on one side, and the face of a lion toward a palm tree on the other side.

verses.text: From the floor to the threshold, the cherubim and the palm trees were interspersed upon the walls.
parts: From the floor to the threshold, the cherubim and the palm trees were interspersed upon the walls.

verses.text: The holy place and the temple were laid out square, and along the face of the sanctuary was what looked like a wooden altar. Its height was three cubits, and its length and breadth, two cubits.
parts: The holy place and the temple were laid out square, and along the face of the sanctuary was what looked like a wooden altar.
Its height was three cubits, and its length and breadth, two cubits.

verses.text: Its height was three cubits, and its length and breadth, two cubits.
parts: Its height was three cubits, and its length and breadth, two cubits.

verses.text: The temple and the holy place had two doors.
parts: The temple and the holy place had two doors.

verses.text: The doors had two panels apiece, two folding panels on hinges: two panels for one door and two panels for the other door.
parts: The doors had two panels apiece, two folding panels on hinges: two panels for one door and two panels for the other door.

verses.text: Depictions were upon them, cherubim and palm trees upon the doorways of the temple, like the depiction of the sanctuary, and excellent kinds of wood, as in front of the entrance without, along with hidden windows.
parts: Depictions were upon them, cherubim and palm trees upon the doorways of the temple, like the depiction of the sanctuary, and excellent kinds of wood, as in front of the entrance without, along with hidden windows.

verses.text: He measured from one side to the other along the canopies of the entrance chamber, and the sides of the house were joined together.
parts: He measured from one side to the other along the canopies of the entrance chamber, and the sides of the house were joined together.

verses.text: Then he brought me out into the outer court, to the east, in front of the gate which faces north; and he brought me, and behold, there were five halls adjoining the open space and five halls adjoining the boundary facing north, up to a hundred cubits long toward the north, and the width was fifty cubits, laid out in a pattern the same way as the gates leading into the inner court and the pillars of the outer court, and broken up into galleries of three stories in height.
parts: Then he brought me out into the outer court, to the east, in front of the gate which faces north; and he brought me, and behold, there were five halls adjoining the open space and five halls adjoining the boundary facing north,

up to a hundred cubits long toward the north, and the width was fifty cubits, laid out in a pattern the same way as the gates leading into the inner court and the pillars of the outer court, and broken up into galleries of three stories in height.

verses.text: In front of the halls there was a walk ten cubits wide and up to a hundred cubits in length.
parts: In front of the halls there was a walk ten cubits wide and up to a hundred cubits in length.

verses.text: Now the upper walkways were just the same, because the pillars projected out from them, namely, the pillar which was below; thus was the pillar and the layout for the porches.
parts: Now the upper walkways were just the same, because the pillars projected out from them, namely, the pillar which was below; thus was the pillar and the layout for the porches.

verses.text: For they were in three stories and did not have pillars like the pillars of the outer courts; therefore, the upper level was projected out more than the lower and middle levels from the ground up.
parts: For they were in three stories and did not have pillars like the pillars of the outer courts; therefore, the upper level was projected out more than the lower and middle levels from the ground up.

verses.text: There was light from without, as in the halls of the outer court which were facing the halls toward the north; they were fifty cubits in length.
parts: There was light from without, as in the halls of the outer court which were facing the halls toward the north; they were fifty cubits in length.

verses.text: Because the length of the halls which face the outer court was fifty cubits, and these were standing over against them, thus the whole was one hundred cubits.
parts: Because the length of the halls which face the outer court was fifty cubits, and these were standing over against them, thus the whole was one hundred cubits.

verses.text: Now there were doors of these halls at the entrance way for an outlet to the east, so one might enter through them from the outer court,
parts: Now there were doors of these halls at the entrance way for an outlet to the east, so one might enter through them from the outer court,

verses.text: by the light which strikes at the head of the entrance.
parts: by the light which strikes at the head of the entrance.

verses.text: and there was a walk in front of them also, according to the measurement of the halls facing north.
parts: and there was a walk in front of them also, according to the measurement of the halls facing north.

verses.text: So were the measures of the entrances toward the south, according to the doorways at the head of the walkway, as it were, the distance of a reed for light, and eastward as one went in by them.
parts: So were the measures of the entrances toward the south, according to the doorways at the head of the walkway, as it were, the distance of a reed for light, and eastward as one went in by them.

verses.text: Then he said to me, “The halls toward the north and the halls toward the south, according to the pattern of the layout, are the halls of the holy place, where the priests who approach the Lord will eat the most holy offerings.
parts: Then he said to me, “The halls toward the north and the halls toward the south, according to the pattern of the layout, are the halls of the holy place, where the priests who approach the Lord will eat the most holy offerings.

verses.text: They shall not enter there, except for the priests.
parts: They shall not enter there, except for the priests.

verses.text: Now the measurement of the whole house was completed within.
parts: Now the measurement of the whole house was completed within.

verses.text: He stood behind the gate which faces east and measured five hundred measuring stick units of measurement.
parts: He stood behind the gate which faces east and measured five hundred measuring stick units of measurement.

verses.text: Then he turned to the north side and measured five hundred measuring stick units of measurement.
parts: Then he turned to the north side and measured five hundred measuring stick units of measurement.

verses.text: Then he turned toward the west and measured five hundred measuring stick units of measurement.
parts: Then he turned toward the west and measured five hundred measuring stick units of measurement.

verses.text: Then he turned toward the south and measured five hundred measuring stick units of measurement.
parts: Then he turned toward the south and measured five hundred measuring stick units of measurement.

verses.text: The four directions were the same measurement, and he planned it out, and the enclosing wall all around was five hundred units to the east and five hundred units in width for setting out the boundary wall between the holy precinct and the remaining layout of the house.
parts: The four directions were the same measurement, and he planned it out, and the enclosing wall all around was five hundred units to the east and five hundred units in width for setting out the boundary wall between the holy precinct and the remaining layout of the house.

headers: The Glory of the Lord Fills the Temple

verses.text: Then he brought me to the gate, the gate that faces toward the east, and led me out. Behold, the glory of the God of Israel was approaching from the way of the gate which faces east.
parts: Then he brought me to the gate, the gate that faces toward the east, and led me out.
Behold, the glory of the God of Israel was approaching from the way of the gate which faces east.

verses.text: The vision I saw was like the vision I saw when I entered to anoint the city, and the vision of the chariot I saw was like the vision I saw by the River Chebar; so I fell on my face.
parts: The vision I saw was like the vision I saw when I entered to anoint the city, and the vision of the chariot I saw was like the vision I saw by the River Chebar; so I fell on my face.

verses.text: Then the glory of the Lord entered into the house by way of the gate which faces toward the east.
parts: Then the glory of the Lord entered into the house by way of the gate which faces toward the east.

verses.text: The Spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner court, and behold, the house was full of the Lord's glory.
parts: The Spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner court, and behold, the house was full of the Lord's glory.

verses.text: Then I stood, and behold, there was a voice from the house, and a Man was standing with me.
parts: Then I stood, and behold, there was a voice from the house, and a Man was standing with me.

verses.text: He said to me, “Son of man, you have seen the place of My throne and the place of the soles of My feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the house of Israel forever.
parts: He said to me, “Son of man, you have seen the place of My throne and the place of the soles of My feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the house of Israel forever.

verses.text: When they set My threshold by their thresholds, and My doorpost by their doorposts, with a wall between them and Me, they desecrated My holy name by their lawlessness, and I destroyed them in My anger and with slaughter.
parts: When they set My threshold by their thresholds, and My doorpost by their doorposts, with a wall between them and Me, they desecrated My holy name by their lawlessness, and I destroyed them in My anger and with slaughter.

verses.text: Now let them remove their fornication from My presence, and the murders of their leaders, and I will dwell in their midst forever.
parts: Now let them remove their fornication from My presence, and the murders of their leaders, and I will dwell in their midst forever.

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, explain this house to the house of Israel, and they will cease from the shame of their sins; and describe to them its vision and its plan.
parts: “As for you, son of man, explain this house to the house of Israel, and they will cease from the shame of their sins; and describe to them its vision and its plan.

verses.text: They shall take the chastisements for all the things they did, and you shall describe the house, its design, its exits, and its substance, and all its ordinances.
parts: They shall take the chastisements for all the things they did, and you shall describe the house, its design, its exits, and its substance, and all its ordinances.

verses.text: You will also show them the diagram of the house to be on the mountaintop and all its boundaries roundabout.
parts: You will also show them the diagram of the house to be on the mountaintop and all its boundaries roundabout.

verses.text: “These are the measurements of the altar in cubits (where a cubit equals one cubit and a handbreadth): from the drain up one cubit high and one cubit wide, with a projection all around its edge of one span.
parts: “These are the measurements of the altar in cubits (where a cubit equals one cubit and a handbreadth): from the drain up one cubit high and one cubit wide, with a projection all around its edge of one span.

verses.text: the depth of the hollow which is toward the great mercy seat, below this, two cubits; and its width, one cubit; and from the little mercy seat to the great mercy seat, four cubits; and the width, one cubit.
parts: the depth of the hollow which is toward the great mercy seat, below this, two cubits; and its width, one cubit; and from the little mercy seat to the great mercy seat, four cubits; and the width, one cubit.

verses.text: The altar shall be four cubits, and from the altar and above the four horns, one cubit.
parts: The altar shall be four cubits, and from the altar and above the four horns, one cubit.

verses.text: The altar shall be twelve cubits long, up to fourteen wide, in its four directions,
parts: The altar shall be twelve cubits long, up to fourteen wide, in its four directions,

verses.text: and its projection which goes all around it on all sides is a half of a cubit, so the outcropping all around is a cubit.
parts: and its projection which goes all around it on all sides is a half of a cubit, so the outcropping all around is a cubit.

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: ‘These are the ordinances for the altar on the day of its construction, for offering up whole burnt offerings and pouring out blood on it. You shall offer a young bull for a sin offering to the priests, the Levites, who are of the seed of Zadok, who approach Me to minister liturgically to Me,’ says the Lord God.
parts: Then He said to me, “Son of man, thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: ‘These are the ordinances for the altar on the day of its construction, for offering up whole burnt offerings and pouring out blood on it.
You shall offer a young bull for a sin offering to the priests, the Levites, who are of the seed of Zadok, who approach Me to minister liturgically to Me,’ says the Lord God.

verses.text: You shall offer a young bull for a sin offering to the priests, the Levites, who are of the seed of Zadok, who approach Me to minister liturgically to Me,’ says the Lord God.
parts: You shall offer a young bull for a sin offering to the priests, the Levites, who are of the seed of Zadok, who approach Me to minister liturgically to Me,’ says the Lord God.

verses.text: ‘They shall take some of its blood and put it on the four horns of the altar, on the four corners of the mercy seat, and on the step around it; and they shall make atonement for it.
parts: ‘They shall take some of its blood and put it on the four horns of the altar, on the four corners of the mercy seat, and on the step around it; and they shall make atonement for it.

verses.text: Then they shall take the calf of the sin offering and consume it by fire in the appointed place, set apart from the house, outside the sanctuary.
parts: Then they shall take the calf of the sin offering and consume it by fire in the appointed place, set apart from the house, outside the sanctuary.

verses.text: On the second day they shall take two kids of goats without blemish for a sin offering, and they shall make atonement for the altar, as they made atonement with the calf.
parts: On the second day they shall take two kids of goats without blemish for a sin offering, and they shall make atonement for the altar, as they made atonement with the calf.

verses.text: After they finish the atonement, they shall offer a calf from the herd without blemish, and a ram from the flock without blemish.
parts: After they finish the atonement, they shall offer a calf from the herd without blemish, and a ram from the flock without blemish.

verses.text: They shall offer them before the Lord; and the priests shall throw salt on them and offer them up as whole burnt offerings to the Lord.
parts: They shall offer them before the Lord; and the priests shall throw salt on them and offer them up as whole burnt offerings to the Lord.

verses.text: Every day for seven days, you shall prepare a goat for a sin offering; and you shall prepare a calf and a ram from the flock, and they shall offer them without blemish for seven days.
parts: Every day for seven days, you shall prepare a goat for a sin offering; and you shall prepare a calf and a ram from the flock, and they shall offer them without blemish for seven days.

verses.text: So they shall make atonement for the altar, and purify it, and fill their hands.
parts: So they shall make atonement for the altar, and purify it, and fill their hands.

verses.text: It will be when these days are over, on the eighth day, the priests shall offer your whole burnt offerings and your peace offerings on the altar, and I shall accept you,’ says the Lord.”
parts: It will be when these days are over, on the eighth day, the priests shall offer your whole burnt offerings and your peace offerings on the altar, and I shall accept you,’ says the Lord.”

headers: The East Gate Is for the Lord

verses.text: Then He brought me back to the outer gate of the sanctuary that faces toward the east, but it was shut. So the Lord said to me, “This gate shall be shut.
parts: Then He brought me back to the outer gate of the sanctuary that faces toward the east, but it was shut.
So the Lord said to me, “This gate shall be shut.

verses.text: As for the prince, he will sit in it to eat bread before the Lord.
parts: As for the prince, he will sit in it to eat bread before the Lord.

verses.text: Then He brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple, and I looked, and behold, the house of the Lord was full of glory; and I fell on my face.
parts: Then He brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple, and I looked, and behold, the house of the Lord was full of glory; and I fell on my face.

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Son of man, note well with your heart, see with your eyes, and hear with your ears all I say to you concerning all the ordinances of the Lord's house and all its laws.
parts: The Lord said to me, “Son of man, note well with your heart, see with your eyes, and hear with your ears all I say to you concerning all the ordinances of the Lord's house and all its laws.

verses.text: Then you will say to the house which provokes, to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord God: “O house of Israel, enough of your lawlessness,
parts: Then you will say to the house which provokes, to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord God: “O house of Israel, enough of your lawlessness,

verses.text: when you brought in foreign sons, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in My sanctuary to defile it, as when you offered breads, meat, and blood.
parts: when you brought in foreign sons, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in My sanctuary to defile it, as when you offered breads, meat, and blood.

verses.text: You have not kept charge of My holy things, but sought out others.”
parts: You have not kept charge of My holy things, but sought out others.”

verses.text: ‘Therefore, thus says the Lord God: “No foreign son, uncircumcised in heart or uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter My sanctuary, including any foreigner among the children of Israel.
parts: ‘Therefore, thus says the Lord God: “No foreign son, uncircumcised in heart or uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter My sanctuary, including any foreigner among the children of Israel.

verses.text: “But for the Levites who departed far from Me, when Israel went astray, who strayed away from Me to seek their inventions, they will bear their wrongdoing.
parts: “But for the Levites who departed far from Me, when Israel went astray, who strayed away from Me to seek their inventions, they will bear their wrongdoing.

verses.text: Yet they shall be ministers in My sanctuary as gatekeepers at the gates of the house and ministers in the house.
parts: Yet they shall be ministers in My sanctuary as gatekeepers at the gates of the house and ministers in the house.

verses.text: Because they used to minister to them before their idols and became a punishment of wrongdoing to the house of Israel, for this reason I lifted up My hand against them,” says the Lord God.
parts: Because they used to minister to them before their idols and became a punishment of wrongdoing to the house of Israel, for this reason I lifted up My hand against them,” says the Lord God.

verses.text: “They will not draw near to Me to act as priests for Me, nor approach the sanctuary of the sons of Israel, nor My holy place; and they shall bear their shame and dishonor for the error wherein they erred.
parts: “They will not draw near to Me to act as priests for Me, nor approach the sanctuary of the sons of Israel, nor My holy place; and they shall bear their shame and dishonor for the error wherein they erred.

verses.text: Nevertheless they shall keep charge of the house, for all the service of it and all that needs to be done.
parts: Nevertheless they shall keep charge of the house, for all the service of it and all that needs to be done.

verses.text: “But the priests, the Levites, the sons of Zadok, who kept charge of My sanctuary when the house of Israel went astray from Me, they shall come near Me to minister liturgically to Me; and they shall stand before Me to offer to Me sacrifice, the fat and the blood,” says the Lord God.
parts: “But the priests, the Levites, the sons of Zadok, who kept charge of My sanctuary when the house of Israel went astray from Me, they shall come near Me to minister liturgically to Me; and they shall stand before Me to offer to Me sacrifice, the fat and the blood,” says the Lord God.

verses.text: “They shall enter My sanctuary and come near My table to minister liturgically to Me; and they shall keep My charge.
parts: “They shall enter My sanctuary and come near My table to minister liturgically to Me; and they shall keep My charge.

verses.text: So it will be, whenever they enter the gates of the inner court, they shall put on linen vestments, but no wool shall come upon them while they minister liturgically within the gates of the inner court.
parts: So it will be, whenever they enter the gates of the inner court, they shall put on linen vestments, but no wool shall come upon them while they minister liturgically within the gates of the inner court.

verses.text: They shall have linen turbans on their heads and linen trousers on their bodies, and they shall not tightly gird themselves.
parts: They shall have linen turbans on their heads and linen trousers on their bodies, and they shall not tightly gird themselves.

verses.text: When they go out to the outer court to the people, they shall take off their vestments in which they ministered liturgically, leave them in their halls, and put on other garments; and in these garments they shall not sanctify the people.
parts: When they go out to the outer court to the people, they shall take off their vestments in which they ministered liturgically, leave them in their halls, and put on other garments; and in these garments they shall not sanctify the people.

verses.text: They shall neither shave their heads nor pluck out their hairs; but they shall surely keep their head covered.
parts: They shall neither shave their heads nor pluck out their hairs; but they shall surely keep their head covered.

verses.text: No priest shall drink wine when he enters the inner court.
parts: No priest shall drink wine when he enters the inner court.

verses.text: They shall not take as wife a widow or a divorced woman, but rather a virgin of the descendants of Israel, or a widow of a priest.
parts: They shall not take as wife a widow or a divorced woman, but rather a virgin of the descendants of Israel, or a widow of a priest.

verses.text: They shall teach My people the difference between the holy and the profane, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.
parts: They shall teach My people the difference between the holy and the profane, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.

verses.text: They shall stand at a judgment of blood, and judge in righteousness and according to My judgments.
parts: They shall stand at a judgment of blood, and judge in righteousness and according to My judgments.

verses.text: They shall not defile themselves by coming near a dead person.
parts: They shall not defile themselves by coming near a dead person.

verses.text: After he is cleansed, he shall number seven days for himself.
parts: After he is cleansed, he shall number seven days for himself.

verses.text: Then on the day they go into the inner court to minister liturgically in the sanctuary, they shall bring a propitiation offering,” says the Lord God.
parts: Then on the day they go into the inner court to minister liturgically in the sanctuary, they shall bring a propitiation offering,” says the Lord God.

verses.text: “It shall be, in regard to their inheritance, that I am their inheritance.
parts: “It shall be, in regard to their inheritance, that I am their inheritance.

verses.text: They shall eat the sacrifices—the sin offering and the trespass offering—and every dedicated thing in Israel shall be theirs.
parts: They shall eat the sacrifices—the sin offering and the trespass offering—and every dedicated thing in Israel shall be theirs.

verses.text: The best of all firstfruits of any kind, and every sacrifice of any kind from all your sacrifices, shall be for the priests.
parts: The best of all firstfruits of any kind, and every sacrifice of any kind from all your sacrifices, shall be for the priests.

verses.text: But the priests shall not eat anything, bird or beast, that died naturally or was torn by wild animals.
parts: But the priests shall not eat anything, bird or beast, that died naturally or was torn by wild animals.

verses.text: “When you divide the land by lot into inheritance, you shall set apart the firstfruit for the Lord, a holy section of the land.
parts: “When you divide the land by lot into inheritance, you shall set apart the firstfruit for the Lord, a holy section of the land.

verses.text: Of this there shall be a square plot for the sanctuary, five hundred by five hundred rods, with fifty cubits around it for an open space.
parts: Of this there shall be a square plot for the sanctuary, five hundred by five hundred rods, with fifty cubits around it for an open space.

verses.text: From this measurement, you shall measure twenty-five thousand cubits long and ten thousand wide; in it shall be the sanctuary, the holy of holies.
parts: From this measurement, you shall measure twenty-five thousand cubits long and ten thousand wide; in it shall be the sanctuary, the holy of holies.

verses.text: From the land, there shall be a portion for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister to the Lord.
parts: From the land, there shall be a portion for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister to the Lord.

verses.text: An area twenty-five thousand cubits long and ten thousand wide shall belong to the Levites, the ministers of the house.
parts: An area twenty-five thousand cubits long and ten thousand wide shall belong to the Levites, the ministers of the house.

verses.text: “You shall appoint as the property of the city an area five thousand cubits wide and twenty-five thousand long; in this manner the whole house of Israel shall have the firstfruit of the holy things.
parts: “You shall appoint as the property of the city an area five thousand cubits wide and twenty-five thousand long; in this manner the whole house of Israel shall have the firstfruit of the holy things.

verses.text: The prince shall have a portion from this, and from this there shall be a portion for the firstfruits of the sanctuary and for the possession of the city, in front of the firstfruits of the sanctuary, extending westward on the west side and eastward on the east side.
parts: The prince shall have a portion from this, and from this there shall be a portion for the firstfruits of the sanctuary and for the possession of the city, in front of the firstfruits of the sanctuary, extending westward on the west side and eastward on the east side.

verses.text: The land shall be his possession in Israel, and the princes of Israel shall not oppress My people anymore; but the house of Israel will inherit the land according to their tribes.”
parts: The land shall be his possession in Israel, and the princes of Israel shall not oppress My people anymore; but the house of Israel will inherit the land according to their tribes.”

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord God: “Enough, O princes of Israel.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord God: “Enough, O princes of Israel.

verses.text: “You shall have an honest scale, an honest unit, and an honest dry measure.
parts: “You shall have an honest scale, an honest unit, and an honest dry measure.

verses.text: The unit and the dry measure shall be uniform for receiving goods, so the dry measure may contain one-tenth of a homer, and the unit one-tenth of a homer.
parts: The unit and the dry measure shall be uniform for receiving goods, so the dry measure may contain one-tenth of a homer, and the unit one-tenth of a homer.

verses.text: The standard weight shall be twenty obols.
parts: The standard weight shall be twenty obols.

verses.text: “This is the firstfruit you shall offer: you shall give one-sixth of a unit from a homer of wheat, and one-sixth of an ephah from a kor of barley.
parts: “This is the firstfruit you shall offer: you shall give one-sixth of a unit from a homer of wheat, and one-sixth of an ephah from a kor of barley.

verses.text: The ordinance concerning oil, the liquid measure of oil, is one-tenth of such a measure.
parts: The ordinance concerning oil, the liquid measure of oil, is one-tenth of such a measure.

verses.text: One sheep shall be given from a flock of ten, from all the rich pastures of Israel, for sacrifices and whole burnt offerings, and for peace offerings to make atonement for you,” says the Lord God.
parts: One sheep shall be given from a flock of ten, from all the rich pastures of Israel, for sacrifices and whole burnt offerings, and for peace offerings to make atonement for you,” says the Lord God.

verses.text: “All the people shall give this firstfruit to the prince of Israel.
parts: “All the people shall give this firstfruit to the prince of Israel.

verses.text: Then it shall be the prince's part to offer whole burnt offerings, sacrifices, and drink offerings at the feasts, the new moons, the Sabbaths, and at all the appointed festivals of the house of Israel.
parts: Then it shall be the prince's part to offer whole burnt offerings, sacrifices, and drink offerings at the feasts, the new moons, the Sabbaths, and at all the appointed festivals of the house of Israel.

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord God: “In the first month, on the first day of the month, you shall take a young bull without blemish and make atonement for the sanctuary.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord God: “In the first month, on the first day of the month, you shall take a young bull without blemish and make atonement for the sanctuary.

verses.text: The priest shall take some of the blood of the atonement and put it on the doorposts of the house, on the four corners of the temple, on the altar, and on the gateposts of the gate of the inner court.
parts: The priest shall take some of the blood of the atonement and put it on the doorposts of the house, on the four corners of the temple, on the altar, and on the gateposts of the gate of the inner court.

verses.text: Thus you shall do this in the seventh month, on the first of the month.
parts: Thus you shall do this in the seventh month, on the first of the month.

verses.text: “In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, you shall observe the Paschal Feast; for seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.
parts: “In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, you shall observe the Paschal Feast; for seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.

verses.text: And on that day the leader shall prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bull for a sin offering.
parts: And on that day the leader shall prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bull for a sin offering.

verses.text: During the seven days of the feast he shall make whole burnt offerings to the Lord, seven bulls and seven rams without blemish, daily for seven days, and a kid of the goats daily for a sin offering.
parts: During the seven days of the feast he shall make whole burnt offerings to the Lord, seven bulls and seven rams without blemish, daily for seven days, and a kid of the goats daily for a sin offering.

verses.text: He shall also prepare a cake for each bull and a cake for each ram, using a hin of oil for each cake.
parts: He shall also prepare a cake for each bull and a cake for each ram, using a hin of oil for each cake.

verses.text: In the seventh month, on the fifteenth day of the month, in the feast, he shall do likewise for seven days, according to the sin offerings, the whole burnt offerings, the grain offering, and the oil.”
parts: In the seventh month, on the fifteenth day of the month, in the feast, he shall do likewise for seven days, according to the sin offerings, the whole burnt offerings, the grain offering, and the oil.”

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord God: “The gate of the inner court that faces toward the east shall be shut the six working days, but on the Sabbath it shall be opened, and on the day of the New Moon it shall be opened. The prince shall enter by way of the entrance chamber of the gate from the outside, and stand by the gatepost.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord God: “The gate of the inner court that faces toward the east shall be shut the six working days, but on the Sabbath it shall be opened, and on the day of the New Moon it shall be opened.
The prince shall enter by way of the entrance chamber of the gate from the outside, and stand by the gatepost.

verses.text: Likewise the people of the land shall worship at the entrance to this gate before the Lord on the Sabbaths and the New Moons.
parts: Likewise the people of the land shall worship at the entrance to this gate before the Lord on the Sabbaths and the New Moons.

verses.text: The prince shall offer the whole burnt offerings to the Lord on the Sabbath day: six lambs without blemish, and a ram without blemish,
parts: The prince shall offer the whole burnt offerings to the Lord on the Sabbath day: six lambs without blemish, and a ram without blemish,

verses.text: and the grain offering for a ram, and the grain offering for the lambs, as much as he wants to give, as well as a hin of oil with every cake.
parts: and the grain offering for a ram, and the grain offering for the lambs, as much as he wants to give, as well as a hin of oil with every cake.

verses.text: On the day of the New Moon it shall be a young bull without blemish, six lambs, and a ram without blemish.
parts: On the day of the New Moon it shall be a young bull without blemish, six lambs, and a ram without blemish.

verses.text: The cake with the bull and the cake with the ram shall be a grain offering, and for the lambs, whatever he wishes, along with a hin of oil with the cake.
parts: The cake with the bull and the cake with the ram shall be a grain offering, and for the lambs, whatever he wishes, along with a hin of oil with the cake.

verses.text: When the prince enters, he shall go in by way of the entrance of the gate, and go out the same way.
parts: When the prince enters, he shall go in by way of the entrance of the gate, and go out the same way.

verses.text: But whenever the people of the land come before the Lord on the appointed feast days, whoever enters by way of the north gate to worship shall go out by way of the south gate; and whoever enters by way of the south gate shall go out by way of the north gate.
parts: But whenever the people of the land come before the Lord on the appointed feast days, whoever enters by way of the north gate to worship shall go out by way of the south gate; and whoever enters by way of the south gate shall go out by way of the north gate.

verses.text: The prince shall then be in their midst.
parts: The prince shall then be in their midst.

verses.text: At the festivals and the ceremonial days the grain offering shall be a cake of cereal for a bull, cereal for a ram, as much as he wants to give for the lambs, and a hin of oil with every cake.
parts: At the festivals and the ceremonial days the grain offering shall be a cake of cereal for a bull, cereal for a ram, as much as he wants to give for the lambs, and a hin of oil with every cake.

verses.text: “Now when the prince offers whole burnt offerings as a thanksgiving to the Lord, he shall open the gate which faces east and offer his whole burnt offerings and his peace offerings, as he did on the Sabbath day.
parts: “Now when the prince offers whole burnt offerings as a thanksgiving to the Lord, he shall open the gate which faces east and offer his whole burnt offerings and his peace offerings, as he did on the Sabbath day.

verses.text: You shall offer daily as a whole burnt offering to the Lord a lamb of the first year without blemish, and you shall offer it every morning.
parts: You shall offer daily as a whole burnt offering to the Lord a lamb of the first year without blemish, and you shall offer it every morning.

verses.text: You shall also offer a grain offering with it every morning, a sixth of a unit, and a third of a hin of oil to moisten the fine flour of the grain offering.
parts: You shall also offer a grain offering with it every morning, a sixth of a unit, and a third of a hin of oil to moisten the fine flour of the grain offering.

verses.text: You shall offer the lamb, the grain offering, and the oil, and you shall offer them as a whole burnt offering every morning continually.”
parts: You shall offer the lamb, the grain offering, and the oil, and you shall offer them as a whole burnt offering every morning continually.”

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord God: “If the leader gives a gift of some of his inheritance to any of his sons, it shall belong to his sons, and it is their possession by inheritance.
parts: ‘Thus says the Lord God: “If the leader gives a gift of some of his inheritance to any of his sons, it shall belong to his sons, and it is their possession by inheritance.

verses.text: But if he gives a gift of some of his inheritance to one of his servants, it shall be his until the Year of Remission, after which it shall return to the prince.
parts: But if he gives a gift of some of his inheritance to one of his servants, it shall be his until the Year of Remission, after which it shall return to the prince.

verses.text: Moreover the prince shall not take any of the people's inheritance so as to oppress them.
parts: Moreover the prince shall not take any of the people's inheritance so as to oppress them.

verses.text: Now he brought me through the entrance which was behind the gate into the hall of the holy priests, which faces toward the north; and there was a place set apart there.
parts: Now he brought me through the entrance which was behind the gate into the hall of the holy priests, which faces toward the north; and there was a place set apart there.

verses.text: Then he said to me, “This is the place where the priests shall boil the trespass offerings and the sin offerings, and where they shall bake the grain offering, all of it together, so as not to bring them out into the outer court to sanctify the people.”
parts: Then he said to me, “This is the place where the priests shall boil the trespass offerings and the sin offerings, and where they shall bake the grain offering, all of it together, so as not to bring them out into the outer court to sanctify the people.”

verses.text: Then he brought me out into the outer court and took me around to the four sides of the court; and behold, on every side there was also a side court.
parts: Then he brought me out into the outer court and took me around to the four sides of the court; and behold, on every side there was also a side court.

verses.text: Each side court of the four sides was small, forty cubits long and thirty wide; the same measure for all four.
parts: Each side court of the four sides was small, forty cubits long and thirty wide; the same measure for all four.

verses.text: There were also halls all around in them, all around the four of them, and cooking hearths were made under the halls all around.
