parts: There were also halls all around in them, all around the four of them, and cooking hearths were made under the halls all around.

verses.text: Then he said to me, “These are the houses of the kitchens where the ministers of the house boil the sacrifices of the people.”
parts: Then he said to me, “These are the houses of the kitchens where the ministers of the house boil the sacrifices of the people.”

verses.text: Then he brought me back to the outer door of the house, and there was water, flowing from under the open air of the chamber toward the east; and the water was flowing from under the right side court, from the south to the altar. Then he brought me out by way of the north gate and led me around on the outside to the outer gate that faces east; and there was water coming down, running out on the right side, in the direction in which a man went forth opposite.
parts: Then he brought me back to the outer door of the house, and there was water, flowing from under the open air of the chamber toward the east; and the water was flowing from under the right side court, from the south to the altar.

Then he brought me out by way of the north gate and led me around on the outside to the outer gate that faces east; and there was water coming down, running out on the right side, in the direction in which a man went forth opposite.

verses.text: Again he measured a thousand, and he passed through the water, and the water was up to the knees.
parts: Again he measured a thousand, and he passed through the water, and the water was up to the knees.

verses.text: Again he measured a thousand, and it could not be crossed; for it broke into a rushing torrent which man cannot pass through.
parts: Again he measured a thousand, and it could not be crossed; for it broke into a rushing torrent which man cannot pass through.

verses.text: He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?” Then he led me to the bank of the river.
parts: He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?” Then he led me to the bank of the river.

verses.text: As I returned, behold, along the bank of the river there were very many trees on this side and the other.
parts: As I returned, behold, along the bank of the river there were very many trees on this side and the other.

verses.text: Then he said to me, “This is the water that flows into Galilee, which is to the east.
parts: Then he said to me, “This is the water that flows into Galilee, which is to the east.

verses.text: So it shall be that every living thing that moves, wherever the river goes, will live.
parts: So it shall be that every living thing that moves, wherever the river goes, will live.

verses.text: Fishermen will stand by it from En Gedi to En Eglaim, and they will be places for spreading their nets.
parts: Fishermen will stand by it from En Gedi to En Eglaim, and they will be places for spreading their nets.

verses.text: But in its outlets and turns and overflows, they will not be healed, for they will be given over to salt.
parts: But in its outlets and turns and overflows, they will not be healed, for they will be given over to salt.

verses.text: Along the bank of the river, on this side and that, will grow all kinds of trees used for food.
parts: Along the bank of the river, on this side and that, will grow all kinds of trees used for food.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord God: “These are the borders by which you shall divide the land as an inheritance among the twelve tribes of Israel.
parts: Thus says the Lord God: “These are the borders by which you shall divide the land as an inheritance among the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.text: You shall inherit it equally with one another; for I raised My hand in an oath to give it to your fathers, and this land shall fall to you as your inheritance.
parts: You shall inherit it equally with one another; for I raised My hand in an oath to give it to your fathers, and this land shall fall to you as your inheritance.

verses.text: This shall be the border of the land on the north: from the Great Sea which goes down and the entrance which divides Emath Seddatha,
parts: This shall be the border of the land on the north: from the Great Sea which goes down and the entrance which divides Emath Seddatha,

verses.text: Berothah, Sebraim, Eliam (which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath), and the court of Saunan; these are above the borders of Auranitis.
parts: Berothah, Sebraim, Eliam (which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath), and the court of Saunan; these are above the borders of Auranitis.

verses.text: These are the boundaries from the Sea, from the court of Enan, the borders of Damascus and those to the north.
parts: These are the boundaries from the Sea, from the court of Enan, the borders of Damascus and those to the north.

verses.text: On the east side you shall mark out the border from between Auran and Damascus, and between Gilead and the land of Israel, along the Jordan, which divides over along the eastern side of the sea which is to the east of Phoenicia.
parts: On the east side you shall mark out the border from between Auran and Damascus, and between Gilead and the land of Israel, along the Jordan, which divides over along the eastern side of the sea which is to the east of Phoenicia.

verses.text: The southern and southwestern coasts are from Teman and Phoenicia to the waters of Meribah by Kadesh to the Great Sea.
parts: The southern and southwestern coasts are from Teman and Phoenicia to the waters of Meribah by Kadesh to the Great Sea.

verses.text: The west side shall be the Great Sea, from the southern boundary until one comes to a point opposite Hamath.
parts: The west side shall be the Great Sea, from the southern boundary until one comes to a point opposite Hamath.

verses.text: “Thus you shall divide this land among yourselves according to the tribes of Israel.
parts: “Thus you shall divide this land among yourselves according to the tribes of Israel.

verses.text: It shall be that you will divide it by lot as an inheritance for yourselves, and for the resident aliens who dwell among you, and who bear sons in the midst of you.
parts: It shall be that you will divide it by lot as an inheritance for yourselves, and for the resident aliens who dwell among you, and who bear sons in the midst of you.

verses.text: It shall be that in whatever tribe the resident alien dwells, there you shall give him his inheritance,” says the Lord God.
parts: It shall be that in whatever tribe the resident alien dwells, there you shall give him his inheritance,” says the Lord God.

headers: Dividing the Land for the Tribes

verses.text: “Now these are the names of the tribes: From the northern border of the descent which divides at the entrance of Hamath, the court of Enan, the border of Damascus northward, in the direction of Hamath, of the court, from its east to its west side, there shall be one section for Dan; by the border of Dan, from the east side to the west, one section for Asher; by the border of Asher, from the east side to the west, one section for Naphtali; by the border of Naphtali, from the east side to the west, one section for Manasseh; by the border of Manasseh, from the east side to the west, one section for Ephraim; by the border of Ephraim, from the east side to the west, one section for Reuben; by the border of Reuben, from the east side to the west, one section for Judah; by the border of Judah, from the east side to the west, shall be the district which you shall set apart, twenty-five thousand cubits in width, and in length the same as one of the other portions, from the east side to the west, with the sanctuary in the center.
parts: “Now these are the names of the tribes: From the northern border of the descent which divides at the entrance of Hamath, the court of Enan, the border of Damascus northward, in the direction of Hamath, of the court, from its east to its west side, there shall be one section for Dan;

by the border of Dan, from the east side to the west, one section for Asher; by the border of Asher, from the east side to the west, one section for Naphtali; by the border of Naphtali, from the east side to the west, one section for Manasseh; by the border of Manasseh, from the east side to the west, one section for Ephraim; by the border of Ephraim, from the east side to the west, one section for Reuben; by the border of Reuben, from the east side to the west, one section for Judah; by the border of Judah, from the east side to the west, shall be the district which you shall set apart, twenty-five thousand cubits in width, and in length the same as one of the other portions, from the east side to the west, with the sanctuary in the center.

verses.text: “The firstfruits, the district that you shall set apart for the Lord, shall be twenty-five thousand cubits in length and twenty-five thousand in width.
parts: “The firstfruits, the district that you shall set apart for the Lord, shall be twenty-five thousand cubits in length and twenty-five thousand in width.

verses.text: To these—to the priests—the holy district shall belong: on the north twenty-five thousand cubits in length, on the west ten thousand in width, on the east ten thousand in width, and on the south twenty-five thousand in length.
parts: To these—to the priests—the holy district shall belong: on the north twenty-five thousand cubits in length, on the west ten thousand in width, on the east ten thousand in width, and on the south twenty-five thousand in length.

verses.text: It shall be for the priests of the sons of Zadok, who are sanctified, who keep My charge, who did not go astray when the children of Israel went astray, as the Levites went astray.
parts: It shall be for the priests of the sons of Zadok, who are sanctified, who keep My charge, who did not go astray when the children of Israel went astray, as the Levites went astray.

verses.text: The firstfruit shall be given to them from the firstfruits of the land, even a most holy portion from the borders of the Levites.
parts: The firstfruit shall be given to them from the firstfruits of the land, even a most holy portion from the borders of the Levites.

verses.text: “Next to the territory of the priests, the Levites shall have an area twenty-five thousand cubits in length and ten thousand in width.
parts: “Next to the territory of the priests, the Levites shall have an area twenty-five thousand cubits in length and ten thousand in width.

verses.text: They shall not sell or exchange any of it; neither shall they take away or remove the first produce of the land, for it is holy to the Lord.
parts: They shall not sell or exchange any of it; neither shall they take away or remove the first produce of the land, for it is holy to the Lord.

verses.text: “But the five thousand cubits in width that remain, along the edge of the twenty-five thousand, shall be for general use by the city, for habitation and common land; and the city shall be in the center.
parts: “But the five thousand cubits in width that remain, along the edge of the twenty-five thousand, shall be for general use by the city, for habitation and common land; and the city shall be in the center.

verses.text: These shall be its measurements: the north side, four thousand five hundred cubits; the south side, four thousand five hundred; the east side, four thousand five hundred; and the west side, four thousand five hundred.
parts: These shall be its measurements: the north side, four thousand five hundred cubits; the south side, four thousand five hundred; the east side, four thousand five hundred; and the west side, four thousand five hundred.

verses.text: There shall be common land for the city: to the north two hundred and fifty cubits, to the south two hundred and fifty, to the east two hundred and fifty, and to the west two hundred and fifty.
parts: There shall be common land for the city: to the north two hundred and fifty cubits, to the south two hundred and fifty, to the east two hundred and fifty, and to the west two hundred and fifty.

verses.text: The rest of the length, alongside the district of the holy section, shall be ten thousand cubits to the east and ten thousand to the west.
parts: The rest of the length, alongside the district of the holy section, shall be ten thousand cubits to the east and ten thousand to the west.

verses.text: The workers of the city, from all the tribes of Israel, shall cultivate it.
parts: The workers of the city, from all the tribes of Israel, shall cultivate it.

verses.text: The entire firstfruits district shall be twenty-five thousand cubits by twenty-five thousand cubits, foursquare.
parts: The entire firstfruits district shall be twenty-five thousand cubits by twenty-five thousand cubits, foursquare.

verses.text: “The rest shall belong to the prince, on one side and on the other of the holy district and of the city's property, next to the twenty-five thousand cubits of the holy district as far as the eastern border, and westward next to the twenty-five thousand as far as the western border, adjacent to the tribal portions.
parts: “The rest shall belong to the prince, on one side and on the other of the holy district and of the city's property, next to the twenty-five thousand cubits of the holy district as far as the eastern border, and westward next to the twenty-five thousand as far as the western border, adjacent to the tribal portions.

verses.text: Moreover, apart from the possession of the Levites and the possession of the city which are in the midst of what belongs to the leaders, the area between the border of Judah and the border of Benjamin shall belong to the leaders.
parts: Moreover, apart from the possession of the Levites and the possession of the city which are in the midst of what belongs to the leaders, the area between the border of Judah and the border of Benjamin shall belong to the leaders.

verses.text: “As for the rest of the tribes, from the east side to the west, Benjamin shall have one section; by the border of Benjamin, from the east side to the west, Simeon shall have one section; by the border of Simeon, from the east side to the west, Issachar shall have one section; by the border of Issachar, from the east side to the west, Zebulun shall have one section; by the border of Zebulun, from the east side to the west, Gad shall have one section; by the borders of Gad, from the eastern parts to the southwestern parts, the borders shall be from Teman to the waters of Meribah by Kadesh, along the brook to the Great Sea.
parts: “As for the rest of the tribes, from the east side to the west, Benjamin shall have one section; by the border of Benjamin, from the east side to the west, Simeon shall have one section; by the border of Simeon, from the east side to the west, Issachar shall have one section; by the border of Issachar, from the east side to the west, Zebulun shall have one section; by the border of Zebulun, from the east side to the west, Gad shall have one section; by the borders of Gad, from the eastern parts to the southwestern parts, the borders shall be from Teman to the waters of Meribah by Kadesh, along the brook to the Great Sea.

verses.text: by the border of Benjamin, from the east side to the west, Simeon shall have one section;
parts: by the border of Benjamin, from the east side to the west, Simeon shall have one section;

verses.text: by the border of Simeon, from the east side to the west, Issachar shall have one section;

author: The prophet Ezekiel himself. No one else could be so intimately informed of his actions and intentions.
date: The generally accepted time frame in which the book was written is 595–572 BC. This work contains more dates than any other Old Testament prophetic book, and the times of the prophecies are accurately described.
theme: God's direction of events in heaven and on earth. His revelation of knowledge to all the nations is another predominant theme running throughout the book. He is the Judge, but He is equally desirous to be gracious and merciful.

lessons.title: The Glory of the Lord Fills the Temple

parts: T Y P E S O F M A R Y I N T H E
O L D T E S T A M E N T

Types of both Christ and Mary, His Mother, fill the Old Testament. Indeed, most of the Old Testament types of Mary—a natural consequence of her essential role in the Incarnation of her Son, Jesus Christ—reveal the awesome marvel of her womb which contained the almighty God. Referring to

, the hymnography of the Church sees the garden of Eden as a type of Mary: “Rejoice, . . . O living Paradise, having the Lord, the Tree of Life, in your midst” (Akathist Hymn). The burning bush beheld by Moses in the wilderness (

) is one of the most often mentioned types of Mary. For example, “She is the Bush springing from barren ground [her mother, St. Anna, had been barren] and burning with the immaterial fire that cleanses and enlightens our souls” (Small Vespers, Nativity of the Theotokos). St. John of Damascus observes, “The burning bush is an image of God’s Mother . . . If, therefore, the ground where the image of the Theotokos was seen by Moses is holy ground [
], how much more holy is the image itself?”
The tabernacle in the wilderness, where God dwelt among the wandering Israelites (

), also prefigures Mary: “The tabernacle that is to hold God, the sanctuary of the glory, has chosen to dwell in the holy temple” (Matins, Entry of the Theotokos into the Temple). Another hymn from this service addresses her as “O Holy of Holies,” identifying her with the most holy inner place of the tabernacle and the temple (
Other Old Testament types of Mary relating to the Lord dwelling in her womb include the jar of manna (
); Aaron’s rod that budded (
); the tablet of the Law “written with the finger of God” (
); the ladder reaching from earth to heaven (
); the fleece that received the dew (
; see
); the tongs bearing the live coal (
); and the fiery furnace in Babylon (

). Concerning this last image, the hymnographer St. Cosmas of Maiuma writes, “The furnace moist with dew was the image and figure of a wonder past nature. For it burned not the Children whom it had received, even as the fire of the Godhead consumed not the Virgin’s womb into which it had descended” (Matins, Nativity of Christ).

The miracle of the Virgin Birth is another prominent theme among the Old Testament types of Mary. One of the most striking of these is found in Ezekiel 43:27—44:4 , the only Old Testament passage read at all four of the major Feasts of the Theotokos. This reading tells about the east gate of the heavenly temple remaining shut even as the Lord God of Israel, and He alone, goes in and out through it. This is prophetic of the Lord entering Mary’s womb and being born nine months later with her virginity remaining intact. Hence in various hymns the Church proclaims her as “the Gate that looks towards the East,” “the Gate through which none may pass,” and “the East Gate . . . [who] awaits the entrance of the Great Priest.”
Another such image occurs in
, where the Theotokos is the mountain out of whom a stone (that is, Christ;
) is cut “without hands.” This refers to Christ’s birth from the Virgin, untouched by a man.

Mary is the culmination of the whole history of the ancient Hebrews. She is the perfection to which all of faithful Israel aspired through the long centuries of preparation for the coming of the Messiah, beginning with the promise given to Abraham: “God promised to our forefather Abraham that in his seed the Gentiles would be blessed [
], O pure Lady; and through thee today, the promise receives its fulfillment” (Matins, Annunciation).
